loans.name: Justina

texts.es: Justina de 45 años es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Luis de 43 años y sus 4 hijos ; Florentina de 10, Fredy de 9 , Candy de 8 y Erika de 7 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.Los años que Justina viene realizando la crianza de ganado, le han servido para forjarse una vida digna, realiza esta actividad desde que tenia 13 años y actualmente se a convertido en una de las ganaderas más solicitadas, debido a las grandes reses que lleva a vender a su ciudad.Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es criar su ganado, ya que sabe que mientras mejor los cuide, mejores pagos le darán por sus reses, lleva 25 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar las reses hasta el lugar de la venta, puesto que es una actividad que le demanda mucho tiempo y esfuerzo. Para más adelante, desea aperturar  una tienda de abarrotes, la cual le pueda generar otros ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.Este es el segundo préstamo de Justina con  MFP, se siente en la responsabilidad de pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no quiere meter en problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy querida debido a la alegría que imparte en  las reuniones.Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más forraje para sus animales, ya que desea tenerlos bien alimentados para venderlos a un buen precio.
texts.en:
Justina, 45, is a responsible, hard-working woman. She lives with her husband, Luis, 43, and their 4 children, Florentina, 10, Fredy, 9, Candy, 8 and Erika, 7, in their own house. Her children are the motivating force in her life. For several years, Florentina has raised cattle. This has allowed the family to have a worthy life. She has been in this line of work since she was 13 years old and she is now one of the most sought-after cattlewomen thanks to the big steers she brings into the city to sell. What she likes most about her work is raising the cattle because she knows that, the better she cares for them, the better prices her steers will command. She has been in this line of work for 25 years and she feels that the most difficult aspect of it is transporting the steers to the sales points because this activity is very labor intensive. For later in the future, she would like to open a grocery store to generate extra income and, thus, improve her family's quality of life. This is Justina's second loan with MFP and she feels obliged to repay on time because she doesn't want any problems with her fellow members where she is very well-liked because of the joy she brings to the meetings. With the 1000 new soles requested she will buy fodder for her animals because she wants them to be well fed in order to sell them at the best price.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy animal feed.

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
Elva tiene 27 años, vive con su hijo de 10 años en una casa arrendada.
Su principal actividad es la venta de los productos que ella misma siembra en sus tierras de cultivo, y las de sus familiares. La comercialización la hace en otras ciudades, y el capital del país, donde viaja los fines de semana, y en otras oportunidades su madre le envía la mercadería por encomienda para que ella pueda ofertar a su clientela una variedad de productos frescos. 
El sueño de Elva es tener una bodega donde no sólo venda verduras y hortalizas, sino también todo tipo de productos comestibles de primera necesidad. 

Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y está convencida que es muy positivo trabajar en coordinación con el banco comunal al que pertenece. Con el dinero que ahora solicita adquirirá más verduras y hortalizas para repotenciar su capital de trabajo y también comprará sacos de abono para su próxima siembra de papa.
texts.en:
Elva, 27, lives in a rented house with her 10-year-old son. She sells vegetables that she, herself, grows on her farmlands. She sells in other cities and in the nation's capital where she travels on weekends. On other occasions, her mother sends her the merchandise so that she can offer her customers a variety of fresh products. Elva's dream is to have a store where she won't sell just vegetables, but also all kinds of food products and basic needs items. This is her third loan with MFP and she is convinced that it is very positive to work in collaboration with her communal bank. The funds requested now will be used to buy more vegetables to stock her business; she will also buy sacks of natural fertilizer for her next potato planting.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables and natural fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Maria Nelfie

texts.en:
Maria Nelfie P. is from the village of Manabay, Ozamiz City. She is 24 years old and single. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling soft drinks, such as Coke, in the local community. Maria Nelfie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2009, Maria Nelfie joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Maria Nelfie is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Watch You Neiber Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the Watch You Neiber group. They are small scale businesswomen in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They have formed a group of five women to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each member from SMT and Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they can attract more customers, make more sales and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is 28-year-old Zainab T..  Zainab is married to a police officer and they have two children who are attending primary school. Zainab has four years of experience in selling shoes, dishes, cottons, soaps, creams, and women’s clothes. With her share of this loan, she will expand her business by buying more inventory wholesale.

loans.use: Buy shoes, dishes, cottons, soaps, creams, and women’s clothes

loans.name: Mrs. Makk Yann Village Bank Group

texts.en: Twenty-six people from the village of Kork Romiet in the Kandal province have requested a village bank loA.. Mrs. Makk Y. was selected by all of the members to be the village bank president. All of the members will use the loA. for different purposes. Mrs. Makk Y. is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she grows rice and other crops to support her family. She is a widow who lives with six members in her household. She has some problems with her crop field because it is on time to grow, but she does not have enough money to support it. Thus, Mrs. Makk Y. decided to ask for a loA. to buy morning glory seed, fuel, and fertilizer in order to improve her farming. All of the members are shown in the picture, but some of tH. are blocked.

loans.use: To buy morning glory seed, fuel, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Nocturnal Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Nocturnal. Está ubicado en la colonia el Deny, Jilotepec en el Estado de México, , México. El grupo está conformado  por 10 integrantes.

Eleuteria Martínez L. es integrante del grupo. Tiene 61 años, no tiene estudios, es ama de casa y campesina y tiene 7 hijos, 3 mujeres y 4 varones, los cuales ya son grandes pero ella se encarga de criar a sus dos nietos de 10 y 6 años.  Ella se dedica a la crianza de vacas, vende leche y hace queso, inició su negocio hace 4 años. Solicita el préstamo para la  compra de alimento y forrajes para sus vacas y también quiere comprar unos pollos para engordarlos y después venderlos, ya que suele dedicarse a la crianza de animales en general, pues comenta, todo es negocio y hay que aprovechar. Sus clientes y vecinos la consideran una mujer muy activa y trabajadora pues a pesar de no tener una preparación académica es una excelente administrador, quien además de atender su negocio y su hogar tiene bajo su cuidado a dos de sus nietecitos, a quienes desde ahora les inculca el amor al trabajo. 
Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente motivada  a seguir adelante y agradecida por la oportunidad que se le brinda de obtener un crédito sin tanto requisito. Espera poder conservar éste crédito para mantener su negocio y con ello poder dejarles un patrimonio a sus nietos. 

Irma O. V. es Presidenta de este grupo. Tiene 42 años, estudió hasta el sexto año de primaria, es casada y tiene  3 hijos, una mujer y 2 varones de 2, 4 y 5 años.  Ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas hechas a mano que inició hace un año. Solicita el préstamo para iniciar su negocio de bisutería en el cual ya tiene experiencia,  y en su momento le fue muy bien, por lo que considera que es una muy buena opción para obtener mas ingresos para su hogar y poder brindar a sus hijos una  calidad de vida. Además tiene la ventaja de que podrá atender sus dos negocios a la vez pues mientras sus clientas compran tortillas, podrán ver su joyería y así poco a poco se irán animando a comprar alguna novedad. De esta manera con las ganancias que ambos le generen tendrá la oportunidad de establecer bien su negocio de tortillas ya que actualmente lo trabaja en un pequeño espacio de un local que le prestaron y para ella su sueño es tener su propio localito bien equipado y acondicionado para brindar mejor calidad y servicio a sus clientes. 
Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se muestra muy optimista porque para ella es muy importante que su negocio crezca y comenta ésta es una buena oportunidad con la que espera sacar adelante a su familia.  

Las demás integrantes del grupo son:
-	Gabriela M. S. (Venta de Sabanas)
-	Alejandra P. Martínez (Venta de Ropa y Zapato)
-	Juana Hernández Martínez (Venta de Lencería)
-	Sandra Hernández Martínez (Venta de zapato por catalogo)
-	Altagracia Martínez Hernández (Venta de Cosméticos)
-	Anayensi Sánchez Hernández (Venta de Lencería por catalogo)
-	Reyna Velázquez García (Venta de Frituras)
-	M. M. Geraldine Estefanía (Venta de ropa interior)
texts.en:
This group is called “Nocturnal”, which is located in the subdivision of Deny, Jilotepec in the State of México. There are ten members in the group.

Eleuteria Martínez L. is one of the group members. She is 61 years old and has no education. Eleuteria works as a homemaker and farmer. She has seven children, three daughters and four sons, who are all grown and care for her two grandchildren (ages 10 and 6). Eleuteria raises dairy cows, sells the milk, and produces cheese. She started this business four years ago. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy feed and fodder for her cows. She will also buy a few chickens to fatten for subsequent resale since she already raises animals. Eleuteria says her business is everything, so she has to make the most of it. Her customers and neighbors consider her to be an active and hardworking woman who is an excellent manager despite not having any academic training. In addition to tending to her business and household, she also looks after her two young grandchildren in whom she tries to instill a love of work. At the time of this loan request, Eleuteria felt motivated to press forward and was appreciative of this opportunity to obtain a loan with few requirements. She hopes to secure this loan so that she can maintain her business with which she will be able to leave an inheritance for her grandchildren.

Irma O. V. is the group president. She is 42 years old, married, and has a sixth grade education. Irma has three children, a daughter (age 2) and two sons (ages 4 and 5). A year ago, she started her business selling handmade tortillas. She is requesting a loan so that she can start a costume jewelry business since she already has experience. At the moment, Irma is doing very well but she believes this will be a better option to earn more household income to provide her children a higher quality of life. She will also have the advantage of running two businesses at the same time because customers who buy tortillas will be able to see her jewelry. Gradually they will be convinced to buy some of her novelties. With the earnings from both ventures, she will have the opportunity to improve her tortilla business since the location where she currently works is a small space. Her dream is to have a better location that is well-equipped and suited for providing a better quality of service to her customers. At the time of her loan request, Irma was very optimistic because she says growing her business is a good opportunity for her family to get ahead.

The other group members are as follows: - Gabriela M. S. (Bedding sales) - Alejandra P. Martínez (Clothing & Shoe Sales) - Juana Hernández Martínez (Lingerie Sales) - Sandra Hernández Martínez (Catalog Shoe Sales) - Altagracia Martínez Hernández (Cosmetic Sales) - Anayensi Sánchez Hernández (Catalog Lingerie Sales) - Reyna Velázquez García (Fried Food Sales) - M. M. Geraldine Estefanía (Undergarment Sales)

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animal feed & chickens for fattening

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a 27 year old married mother of one young boy.  Her son is 8 months old at this time, and he is her only child so far.  She dreams of having a bigger family one day, but with her business small like it is – she only has the capacity for one.  Dorcas describers herself as a very hard working woman.

Dorcas works as a tailor.  She has been in this business for 3 years. She began immediately after completing a school where she learned the trade of tailoring.   She says that she attracts customers through her friendly attitude and customer service.

Today Dorcas has requested a loan of 15,000 KSH. This loan will be used to purchase more materials for her tailor business.  With future loans she hopes to buy additional sewing machines and even employ people to help do her work.

loans.use: Extra materials and cloth

loans.name: Martine Alex

texts.en:
Alex Martine S. is 28-years-old. He and his wife Mareen have one child in school. 

Alex is a wheat farmer who has farmed his own piece of land for the last four years.

He learned about KADET from marketing done by Kadet staff in his area. This will be his third loan. He plans to plant twenty acres of wheat, which does very well in this area. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to lease more land for farming to increase his wheat output.

Alex's dream is that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land and do wheat farming on a larger scale. He is hard working and, with the right resources at his disposal, he believes he can achieve a lot.

loans.use: To plant twenty acres of wheat.

loans.name: Mohammed Ahmed

texts.en:
50-year-old Mohammed is a carpenter. He and his wife have six children, two of whom are grown. He has been in the carpentry business for 25 years and sells to the locals of Malindi, especially for weddings and tourism. He earns a monthly profit of Kshs 16500. 

This loan will enable him to finish a project he had already started by buying hardwood, paying salaries, and paying for miscelleneous expenses related to the project. He was introduced to KADET by an existing member of his group. With profits from this loan, he plans to buy a woodcutting machine. He also hopes to acquire a yard to sell timber and charcoal.

loans.use: Buy hardwood and pay salaries for a carpentry project

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina se inicio con la venta de quesos de casa en casa, actividad que dejo de realizar porque no le generaba suficientes ganancias y hace 2 años vende cebiche de manera ambulatoria en un triciclo que ubica diariamente en un paradero interprovincial de mucha concurrencia, actividad que realiza por las mañanas y por las tardes se dedica a la preparación. Justina tiene 1 hijo y esta esperando a su segundo bebe, vive en casa alquilada, su mayor sueño es construir su casa, brindar una buena educación a su hijo y seguir trabajando para salir adelante. 
Justina pertenece al Banco Comunal Llapanchik que significa Todos en quechua y necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de un triciclo, porque el que tiene ya esta deteriorado.
texts.en:
Justina started out selling soft-drinks from home but she stopped doing this because she didn’t earn enough income from it; for the last 2 years she has been selling cebiche (marinated fish dish) in an itinerant manner from a three-wheel sales cart that she sets up at one of the interprovincial bus stops, a very busy place. She’s involved in this activity during the morning and in the afternoon she prepares the next day’s product. Justina has a son and is expecting a second baby. She lives in a rented house and her greatest wish is to build her own house, to provide her son with a good education and to continue to work in order to succeed. Justina is a member of the Llapanchik, which means ” Everyone” in Quechua, communal bank and needs a 1000 new sol loan to buy a three-wheeler because the one she has now is pretty deteriorated.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a three-wheel sales cart.

loans.name: Partner Brothers Business Group

texts.en:
For 10 years, Leon T. has been selling sports materials like jerseys, boots, caps, gloves, etc., at the Redlight Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. He sells in a friendly manner which keeps customers returning. He is 29 years old, married and has two children who range in age from 6 to 10 years old. He also cares for one sibling. He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to lack of financial support. 

Leon plans to use his 6,000 Liberian dollar (LRD) portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more sports materials. His plan is to expand his business and continue to support his family.

Leon T. who is holding the sign is the leader of a group of five borrowers called "Partner Brothers Business".

loans.use: To buy more sports materials like jerseys, boots, caps, gloves, etc.

loans.name: Zam

texts.en: Zam is married to a machine operator in a coffee factory. The couple has five children, all of whom go to school, and they don't take care of additional family members. Zamu owns a stall in Kawempe Mbogo selling bananas and charcoal. Zam would like to go directly to farmers in Masaka for bananas, but currently she buys bunches of bananas from delivery vans which transport them from the Masaka district in central eastern Uganda. She doesn’t pay to transport charcoal because she buys it from her place of work. Zam wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas, bags of charcoal and fish. Since Zam works from home seven days a week, she doesn’t pay rent for her business. Her main challenge is the rainy season because it hinders her customers reaching her as she works in a muddy place. Zam decided to work with MCDT because they were giving out timely loans. Zam resides in and owns a three roomed house. Her family has access to electricity but no piped water.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, fish and bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Elizabeth Achieng

texts.en:
Elizabeth Achieng is 41 years old and married to Sabiano Ogola. They have three children, two are in high school; i.e Dorothy, age 16  and Kennedy age 14.  The last born, Andrew, 10 years old, is in primary school, .

Elizabeth has a grinding machine that is used to grind maize into maize flour. It is a business that she has been running for the past 3 years. Her grinding machine is situated in Migori market and most of her clients are from the nearby hotels. Elizabeth is applying for a loan of Kshs 80,000 to buy more cereals for the grinding machine. This will be her third loan. She has a good credit history with KADET.  With the profits from her business she pays the school fees for her children.

Elizabeth hopes to buy another grinding machine which will be a boost to her family as it will improve their living standard.

loans.use: To buy more cereals for the grinding machine

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita M. is from the village of Makawa Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old. Anecita is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Anecita owns & operates a  rice field business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice like "masipag", "74", "angelica" for sale. Anecita has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Anecita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anecita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from GDMPC. Anecita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Anecita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela nació en el departamento de Apuricma y tiene 42 años. Actualmente, Andrea vive junto con sus cinco hijos (Alexander de 23 años, Nelly de 22 años, Verónica de 19 años, Nancy de 17 años y Mario de 06 años) en la ciudad del Cusco. Adela es madre y padre para sus hijos pues su pareja la abandonó por otra mujer, Adela se quedo sola al cuidado de sus cinco hijos.  

La señora Adela es tal vez la emolientera más famosa de la urbanización Santa Ana. Adela  tiene un puesto de emoliente en la calle.  Adela tiene varios años calentando las mañanas de muchos trabajadores que, apurados, salen de sus casas sin desayunar y pasan por la calle Santa Rosa a tomar su emoliente: tibio, frio o bien caliente, todo el año y dependiendo de la época. Adela trabaja de lunes a sábados de 6am hasta las 10 am. 
Adela también trabaja en el restaurante “Emperador”  que está ubicado en la plaza San Francisco como chef, desde hace 23 años y empezó como lava platos pero ahora es la cocinera principal del restaurante. 

Con su próximo préstamo, Adela que espera recibir S/. 1000 nuevos soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para uso personal desea pagar la atención de una clínica particular.

El banco comunal “Cusi Ccoyllor de Chinchero” tiene dos años y medio de funcionamiento, Adela pertenece desde hace dos años al banco comunal y le va muy bien. El nombre del banco comunal es un término que en quechua (el idioma autóctono) significa “Princesa Hermosa de Chichero”.
texts.en:
Adela was born in the Apuricma department and is 42 years old. Nowadays, she lives with her 5 children (Alexander who is 23, Nelly 22, Verónica 19, Nancy 17, and Mario 6) in the city of Cusco. Adela is a mother and father to her children since her husband abandoned them for another woman. Adela was left alone to take care of their 5 children.

Adela is probably the best known emollient woman in Santa Ana street. Adela has an herbal tea stand in the street. For many years Adela has been warming up many worker's mornings who leave their homes in a rush with out eating breakfast and pass by Santa Rosa street to drink their beverage: lukewarm, cold, or very hot, all year round and depending on the season. She works from Monday to Saturday from 6 a.m. to 10 a.m. Adela also works in the restaurant "Emperador" (Emperor) located on San Francisco Plaza as a chef. She has been working there for 23 years and started out as a dishwasher but now is the main cook.

With the next loan Adela awaits to receive 1,000 Peruvian Soles. She would like to use the loan money for personal use to open a private clinic.

The communal bank "Cusi Ccoyllor de Chinchero" has been active for two and a half years and Adela joined two years ago and she likes it very much. The name of the communal bank is a Quechua term (the native language) meaning " Beautiful Chinchero Princess."

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To open up a private clinic.

loans.name: Yenny Elizabeth

texts.es:
Se dedica a la venta de ropa en un mercado y a le ofrece también a los vecinos. 
Solicita el préstamo para incrementar su negocio y así contar con mas mercadería para ofrecer a sus clientes.
Tiene cinco años dedicándose a este rubro.
texts.en:
This client works in clothing sales in a market and also makes sales to her neighbors.

She is requesting the loan to expand her business and have more merchandise to offer to her clients.

She has been in this area of work for five years.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Dolgormaa

texts.en:
Dolgormaa D. is 29 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in a rented apartment owned by the 016th squad in the Tuv province in central Mongolia. Her husband works as a sergeant at the 016th Army squad and his monthly salary is 330,000 MNT (247 USD). Dolgormaa worked at Gobi Co. Ltd from 2001-2003 and at a knitting manufacturer in Ulaanbaatar as a wool knitter from 2008 to 2009.  

She started her business operation in March of 2010 after purchasing two new knitting sewing machines. She hires two employees for her sewing business. She purchases her raw materials from Gobi and Goyo Companies and produces her products. She usually sells her products at wholesale places. She is a hardworking and open-minded person and says "I will expand my business and become even more successful." Dolgormaa is requesting a 4,000,000 MNT (2998 USD) loan to purchase materials and a sewing machine that can be used to help make high-quality wool knitted products.

loans.use: To purchase materials and a sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy note books, pens and more for sale in the stationary shop

loans.name: Raul

texts.en:
Raul is sixty-four years old. He lives along with his wife in their own home in Jose Leonard Ortiz in the northern part of the city of Chiclayo. His children are already adults and live outside of the home.

Raul drives a taxi in and around the city of Chiclayo. He also receives a pension from his previous service within the federal police force. The brand of his taxi is typical for the area. It is a very resilient vehicle which gets good gas mileage.

Unfortunately, the year 2001 vehicle is beginning to show some wear. It is in need of a few repairs in order to keep keep Raul on the road. For this reason he has requested a loan of S/. 2,000.00.  Raul hopes to be able to continue working as a taxi driver in order to provide a better life for himself and his wife as they continue to age.

loans.use: Make repairs to his taxi

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: Maribel B. is from the village of Malinao, Banisilan, Cotabato. She is 39 years old. Maribel is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Maribel runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and junk food. She is also buying and selling rice by the kilogram. Maribel has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Maribel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maribel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Maribel is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Maribel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Lucy; ella tiene 78 años de edad, soltera   y no tiene hijos.  La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de juguetes para niños como son: robots, osos de peluche, pelotas, carros entre otros mas   y la vez también vende ropa para niños las cuales las venden a sus familiares y amigos.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar más variedad de juguetes y ropa  para su negocio.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Lucy belongs to the Amauta Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Lucy is 78 years old, single, and has no children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business of selling children’s toys.  She sells things like robots, stuffed bears, balls, and cars, among other things.  She also sells children's clothes to her relatives and friends.

She is requesting the loan to buy a greater variety of toys and clothes for her business.

She is grateful to those who are part of this dream through the loan.  She pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of toys and clothes for her business

loans.name: Purificacion

texts.es:
el sr. Purificacion P. R. tiene 52 años de edad, vive en la aldea el Madreal, Purificacion se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion. Purificacion es una persona de la tercera edad y esta es la unica fuente de ingresos que el tiene.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia y asi surtir su negocio, desea tener variedad de productos para la navidad.
texts.en: Sr. Purificacion P. R. is 52 years old. He lives in the village of Madreal. Purificacion sells basic consumer products. He has a small grocery store in his home. Since he is older, this is his only source of income. He will use the loan to buy merchandise to stock his store. He wants to have a variety of products on hand for the Christmas season.

loans.use: Buy eggs, lard, oil, beans, rice, sugar, soups, soda, and juice for his store.

loans.name: La Fe 1, 2, 4 Group

texts.en:
Marie is the coordinator of her group La Fe 1,2,4 (The Faith). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and three children. She says that her most difficult challenges are to educate her children and to support all of their needs. She sells clothing and accessories, a business she enjoys doing. 

Marie is excited to be taking out her fourth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She has had her business for two years. She plans to use this loan to purchase blue jeans and women's shoes. She will use the profits to buy some clothes for her children for Christmas and to invest in her business. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because of "the respect that Esperanza offered to us and the type of program that we receive." Her story is representative of her group and, generally, of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominates the economy. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a motorbike for the family use

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Ny P., 30, is married and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province. She opened a pharmacy in her village in 1995 and is able to make about US $7 of profit each day. Her husband is a local doctor. On average, he earns US $11 per day. This couple has two young children living at home to support. Ny P. needs a loan to buy more medicines.

loans.use: To buy more medicines

loans.name: Yawovi Mawuko

texts.fr: Monsieur  Yawovi  a 34 ans et est marié.  IL  habite quartier   Baguida et fait élevage de poules pondeuses.  Il  a commencé en  2009 cette activité. Il achète les ingrédients de nourriture des poules au grand marché de Lomé.  Il sollicite un prêt  pour acheter 5 sacs de maïs et 3 sacs de soja.
texts.en: Mr. Yawovi is 34 years old and is married. He lives in the Baguida district and raises laying hens. He began this activity in 2009. He buys chicken feed at the Great Market in Lomé. He is requesting a loan to buy five bags of corn and three bags of soya beans.

loans.use: buy corn and soya

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim K., 48, resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. K. is a farmer, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 11 on food and USD 30 on the other necessary expenses. 

K. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a new motorbike for the family to use. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
La Sra. Marcela B. es cliente antigua  de nuestra entidad, es casada y vive en casa propia.
La titular  se dedica a la renta desde hace 5 años, el domicilio que renta está en la ciudad de Luque, comprende una vivienda y un depósito. La titular ha retirado dicho préstamo para la refracción de dicha vivienda.
La titular considera que este préstamo le dará una mejor atención a sus clientes y a su vez le dejará mejor ingreso posteriormente.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marcela B. is a long-standing client of our entity; she’s married and lives in her own house.

For five years she’s been a landlord.  She has a place she rents out in the city of Luque consisting of a house and a grocery store.  She has taken out a loan to refurbish said house.  She thinks that the loan will allow her to provide better customer service and subsequently improved income.

loans.use: to do some home repairs

loans.name: Maria Nicolasa

texts.es:
Maria Nicolasa A. C. tiene 47 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO DE MUJERES MUSHUC ÑAN se encuentra ubicado en la Comunidad Guanto Cruz, parroquia Guanujo, pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 22 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en cultivo de mora, maíz, cría de animales de corral y vacas lecheras para la elaboración de quesos. 

Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora y maíz y a la cría de animales de corral comprar sus productos en Guaranda y los vende en la feria de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y animales de cría y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener casa propia y más terrenos.

Le gusta las fiestas de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Maria Nicolasa A. C. is 47.  She is married and lives with her husband and their children in the Guaranda canton of Bolivar province.  She has 3 children.

The members of the rural communal bank "Grupo de Mujeres Muschuc Nan" meet in the community of Guanto Cruz in the Guanujo parish in the canton of Guaranda. This communal bank has 22 members who farm raspberries and corn and raise poultry and dairy cows in order to make cheese.

Maria cultivates raspberries and corn and raises poultry. She buys her products in Guaranda, and she sells her products in the Guaranda market.

She requests a loan to purchase supplies and animals to raise, and also to buy feed for the animals. The support of this loan will help her financially to obtain the supplies she needs. In her work she must deal with challenges such as pests, changing weather conditions and diseases that affect her crops. Her dream is to have her own house and to have more land.

She enjoys the festivals that are held in her community.

loans.use: to buy supplies and animals to raise, and to buy feed for the animals

loans.name: Giovanna

texts.es: Giovanna Sánchez S.  tiene una heladería ubicada en la ciudad de Cartagena  donde vive con su cónyuge y su hijo de 11 años.  Giovanna inicio su actividad comercial vendiendo frutas de manera ambulante,  luego  se dedico a vender mercancías y actualmente vende refrescos como cervezas  al por mayor  y al detal; este ultimo negocio está ubicado en un local de propiedad de su hermano que se lo cedió ya que carecía de tiempo suficiente para atender esta actividad y por eso  negoció con ella asignarle  una cuota fija, en calidad de arriendo. El negocio de Giovanna cuenta con toda la infraestructura necesaria para brindar a sus clientes un excelente servicio, pero requiere tener la suficiente cantidad de canastas de cervezas, para rotar mas rápido su capital de trabajo y esto es justamente lo que planea con su credikiva, comprar canastas de cervezas y refrescos logrando inventarios que canalicen a sus clientes hacia el punto de venta de Giovanna. Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el espera lograr aumentar su capital de trabajo y responder oportunamente a sus clientes y lograr poco a poco su sueño de apoyar a su hijo hasta convertirlo en lo que a el le gusta: ser un basquetbolista de talla internacional,
texts.en:
Giovanna Sánchez S. has a soda fountain in the city of Cartagena, where she lives with her husband and eleven year old son. She started her business selling fruit as a street vendor. Later she sold merchandise and now sells beverages, such as beer, in bulk and by the unit. This latest business is located on a piece of property owned by her brother. He left this business to her because he did not have enough time to manage it and they have negotiated a fee for her to pay as rent. Giovanna’s business has the necessary infrastructure to provide her customers with excellent service, but she needs to have sufficient quantities of beer because of quick turnover. For this reason, she will use her Kiva loan as operating capital. She plans to buy cases of beer and soft drinks so that she can attract more customers to her establishment.

This is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She hopes to increase her operating capital, respond quickly to her customers, and support her son’s dream of becoming an international basketball player.

loans.use: To purchase cases of beer and soft drinks.

loans.name: Victory Group

texts.en:
Hellen M., 35, is the leader of Victory Group, which has applied for a loan from Kiva partner MicroKing. Hellen will be buying winter clothing for her flea market. She is a single mother of 2 children; her oldest is attending school, and her youngest is two years old. 

She specifically intends to buy winter wear for kids (track suits, jackets and jerseys). She has been operating the flea market business which is her sole source of income for the past two and a half years. She intends to own and operate a boutique in the future. In the interim she sees the loan proceeds improving her family's income and lifestyle.    

Hellen can only sing praises for MicroKing and Kiva and hopes for continued support. 

Note: In the photo, the lady seated is Hellen.

loans.use: To purchase winter clothing for stocking her flea market

loans.name: Deus

texts.en: Deus is a forty year old married man with nine children and he owns a house in Kasese Uganda.  He has been dealing in local brew for eight years in which he started with sales of ten jerrycans per month and now he sells 50 jerrycans.  His hardship is bad debtors.  His vision is personally distilling and selling local brew in Kampala city along with educating his children.  Deus needs the credit facility to buy local brew for sale.

loans.use: To buy local brew for sale.

loans.name: Siham

texts.en:
Siham is 42 years old. She started her own business two years ago when she launched a small grocery store as she struggled with different jobs when her husband didn't help her take care of her two daughters and two sons. Siham took out a loan from FATEN to purchase a larger variety of items to sell and attract more customers. Siham, who is photographed in the store with her husband, is planning to expand the store to have a big and good reputation, which will secure a good life for her family.

About this loan product:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m

loans.use: to purchase a larger variety of items to sell

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 36 years old and married with five children. He has 3 years experience in his business selling various products such as Irish potatoes, beans, etc. His business is well-organized and is open from 7 a.m. until 6 p.m. during the week. He currently employs 3 people to help him.

Charles has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more products such as Irish potatoes, beans, etc. to sell. He will use the profit generated from this loan to reinvest in his business and to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To purchase more products such as Irish potatoes, beans, etc. to sell

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is divorced and has one child. She buys fish from the market and then cleans and smokes it for resale. Her income is used to see to the well-being of the home. Hannah will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Hannah plans to save towards the education of her child.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish to sell

loans.name: Malik

texts.en:
Malik is a 29 years old man, who got married recently.

He opened a supermarket one year ago that has a lot of space in it that allows people to shop easily and also provides them with good quality food products.

 Now Malik has applied for a loan to add new kinds of frozen items such as meat and chicken to his supermarket.

loans.use: To add frozen meat and chicken to the items he sells in the supermarket.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a single woman who lives in a rental house that has no electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent.

For three years, Mercy has operated a beauty salon. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Mercy dreams of establishing a well-furnished beauty salon business in the future. Mercy plans to use this 40,000 KES loan to purchase bundles of cosmetics and hair weaves. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of cosmetics and hair weaves.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo, es un hombre soltero y trabajador de 32 años, que vive en compañía de sus padres Lucia y Alejo, a los que ama mucho. En armonía familiar ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Patay. Como joven tiene muchas ambiciones. Estudió Farmacia en un instituto reconocido de la localidad; pero sus deseos son consolidarse en un negocio propio, por ello hace 5 años comenzó a dedicar su tiempo y sus fuerzas en la agricultura. En los terrenos de sus padres siembra una variedad de productos como: arveja, papa y flor de gladiolo a gran escala. Asimismo, tiene un botiquín lleno de medicinas, que vende a los pobladores de su localidad cuando se sienten enfermos. En todo este tiempo le fue muy bien, tanto así; que logró obtener un auto propio con el que también hace trasporte público. Ahora consiente de que el precio de venta de los productos en el mercado central de la ciudad de Tarma, son muy buenos desea mejorar la calidad de sus productos. Por eso comenzó a buscar tierras nuevas y descansadas para obtener frutos nutritivos, su secreto para su obtención es sembrar en época de invierno. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Picaflores de Patay”, y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde se siente realizado, ya que el apoyo económico y las constantes charlas que recibe le ayudan a progresar. Por eso desea seguir obteniendo el soporte de todos ustedes. Wilfredo de obtener su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para su próxima siembra de flor de gladiolo.
texts.en:
Wilfredo, age 32, is single and a hardworking gentleman. He lives with his parents, Lucia and Alejo, who he loves very much. They live in harmony as a family in their own home in the village of Patay. Being a young man, Wilfredo has many ambitions. He studied pharmacology at a recognized local institute, but his dreams came together by establishing his own business. Five years ago, Wilfredo started devoting his time and efforts into farming. He grows a variety of crops in mass quantities on his parents’ land such as peas, potatoes, and gladiola flowers. In addition, he has a pharmacy that is stocked with medicines that he sells to the local villagers whenever they are sick. Throughout this entire time, Wilfredo has done very well. He also owns an automobile that he makes available for public transportation. Now he is aware that good prices are being offered for products sold at the central market in Tarma, so he wants to improve the quality of his crops. For this reason, Wilfredo has started to look for additional farmland that has had a chance to rest so that he can produce fruits that have nutritional value. His secret to obtaining a good harvest is to plant during the winter season.

Wilfredo belongs to the Communal Bank “Los Picaflores de Patay” and is receiving his sixth loan from MFP, where he feels fulfilled as a member. The financial support and the frequent seminars that are offered have helped him to advance. For this reason, he hopes to gain everyone’s support. With the assistance he received, Wilfredo will invest the money he requested in the purchase of several sacks of natural fertilizers for his next crop of gladiola flowers.

loans.use: to purchase several sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Jimena Adriana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia Jimena; La socia tiene 22 años de edad, la socia es soltera; la socia es docente de inicial, la socia trabaja en un prestigioso colegio particular en el nivel de primaria, ella enseña ingles a sus alumnos, la socia requiere el crédito para pagar su curso de capacitación, es un curso dirigido a docentes de nivel inicial, es una pedagogía, y la socia quiere asistir para lo cual ella requiere el préstamo para invertir en sus estudios. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en el pago de sus estudios.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Granito de Mostaza" (Grain of Mustard Seed) communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Huanchac in the province and department of Cusco.  Jimena is 22, single, and a primary school teacher.  She works in a prestigious private school at the primary level. She teaches English to her students. 

She needs the loan to pay for a training course directed at primary teachers. It is a teacher training course, and the member wants to attend, so she needs the loan to pay for her studies.  

The member is thankful for the support she has been given, and furthermore, she is committed to making her instalment payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: To pay for teacher education.

loans.name: Senten

texts.en:
Senten has been a sheep trader for the past six years. He is married and supports five people in his family. He was introduced to KADET by a KADET registered client. He has applied for his first loan of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) which he plans to use to purchase more sheep for sale. 

He hopes to make to make a profit and reinvest in the business. He is an industrious person who strives to achieve more if funded.

loans.use: to purchase more sheep for sale

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa is 46 years old and lives in Barnersville. She is married and has seven children between 14 and 29 years old; four are attending school, while three are working (business) and all of them live at home. Hawa did not go to school. For the past 21 years she has been selling oil, bitter ball, pepper and rice in the local market. She makes a lot of profit and likes the way people respond to her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, bitter ball, pepper, and rice for her business. She hopes to build her house and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, bitter ball, pepper, and rice for her business

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.es: Jeannette tiene 30 años, es una mujer alegre, amable y trabajadora, convive con su pareja, con quien tiene dos hijos de 6 y 2 años. Juntos habitan en casa de su suegra. EL trabajo al que se dedica es la venta de zapatos, mercadería que trae de otra ciudad. Previamente sus clientes le hacen el pedido y al cabo de un tiempo un proveedor es el que trae la mercadería solicitada. Ella está contenta con su trabajo, pues los diseños que venden son variados y gusta del cliente. Ella considera muy rentable su negocio, que gracias a ello puede ayudar a su parejar a solventar los gastos del hogar, por tanto espera invertir más en su negocio para que pueda consolidarse. Este será el primer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes. Con el monto solicitado comprará más calzados, además que intentará comprar un stand donde pueda exhibir sus productos.
texts.en:
Jeannette is 30 years old.  She is a cheerful, kind and hard-working woman who lives with her partner.  The couple have two children aged 6 and 2.  They live together in her mother-in-law's house.

Jeannette's business is selling shoes.  This is merchandise that she brings back from another city.  Her customers make orders with her in advance and, after a certain period of time, a supplier brings the merchandise they have requested.  Jeannette is happy with her work as the designs she sells are varied and please her customers.  She considers her business to be very profitable and it has enabled her to help her partner cover their household expenses.  For this reason, she hopes to invest further in her business so that she can consolidate it.  

This will be Jeannette's first loan from MFP and she hopes to receive your support.  She will use the sum she has requested to buy more footwear.  She will also try to buy a stand where she can display her products.

loans.use: to buy more shoes and a stand

loans.name: Man

texts.en:
Man, who is pictured here, is a fisherman. His wife, Aimmeynas, sells the fish that her husband catches in their village. They have been married since 1980 and have three sons and two daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home and the others are in school.

Man is applying for another loan of 800 USD to buy additional fishing nets to continue his fishing business.

loans.use: to buy nets for his fishing business

loans.name: C5683 Terimbere Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 23 years old and single. Emmanuel is also the leader of this group, which is called "Terimbere" in the local language. Emmanuel employs two people to help him and he has two years of experience. He works from 7:00 a.m until 6:00 p.m every day. He is the first person on the left in the picture.

Emmanuel has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by buying more paper, books,calculators and staplers to sell. With this profit,  Emmanuel hope to satisfy their customers and save for their futures.

loans.use: To purchase more paper, books, calculators, etc

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lillian  lives in  Uganda.  She is married and has  three children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her mother).

Lillian has a business selling bananas. She has been in this business for five years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Lillian sells her products at the market, retail. She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas. She also generates additional income through working as a women councilor in her village.

The main business challenges for  Lilian include ever increasing prices  of  bananas and high transportation  costs. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and be a wholesaler. Lilian lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Qadiraga

texts.en: Qadiraga is 50, married, and has three children. He sells veterinary medicines and supplies in his own drug store. He has 10 years of experience in this field. His son helps him to sell his goods. Qadiraga is a very polite and friendly gentleman who always knows all of his clients by name. His monthly income is 120 AZN. His business is very profitable because a majority of the people living in his city, and in the region, are engaged in livestock breeding. He would like to expand his business to be able to meet customers’ demand. He applied for a 1,300 AZN loan to do that. Qadiraga has already demonstrated himself as a good client with a positive credit history.

loans.use: purchase more veterinary medicines and supplies

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban  vive y trabaja en Ica, Perú. Ica is located in the Sechura Desert about four hours south of Lima, the country's capital, and is hailed by Peruvians as "The Land of the Sun." It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007), its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives, and perhaps most notably, as the source of Peruvian's traditional national drink, Pisco. In this hot, arid climate we find the client's home and business.

Esteban, es un hombre soltero D. 28 años D. edad, el  se dedica al transporte,eligio este tipo D. trabajo, porque le gusta transportar a L. gente y porque le sale rentable.
El  es un hombre luchador,  perseverante y muy responsable con muchas ganas D. salir cada día adelante. 
Esteban  empezó su negocio en el año 2007 en el servicio D. transporte , gana semanalmente S/.290 nuevos soles. Diariamente trabaja alrededor D. 12 horas al día y 6 días a L. semana. Con el préstamo D. S/. 1000  soles que recibirá gracias a KIVA, Esteban  invertirá su crédito para darle mantenimiento general a su moto y así poder atender mejor a sus clientes.  Su sueño D. Esteban es tener su propio auto, para que le pueda generar mayores ingresos y poder llevar una mejor calidad D. vida, su asesor cree es que un excelente cliente y que pagara puntualmente sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Esteban lives and works in Ica, Peru. Ica is located in the Sechura Desert about four hours south of Lima, the country's capital, and is hailed by Peruvians as "The Land of the Sun." It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007); its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives; and perhaps most notably, as the source of the Peruvian traditional national drink, Pisco. In this hot, arid climate one can find the client's home and business.

Esteban is a 28-year-old single man who works in the transportation sector. He chose this line of work because he likes transporting people and the work is profitable. Esteban is a determined, persevering, and responsible man who has tremendous drive to succeed each day. He started his transportation business in 2007 and earns 290 PEN each week. Esteban works approximately 12 hours a day, six days a week.

With this loan of 1000 PEN that he will receive thanks to Kiva, Esteban will invest in the general maintenance of his motorcycle taxi so that he can better serve his customers. His dream is to have his own automobile so that he can earn more income and have a better quality of life. His loan officer believes that he is an excellent client and will submit his payments on time.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Dambadarjaa

texts.en:
Dambadarjaa, 59, works as a watchman for a private company. He is also a driver. He worked as a driver for a public organization between 1981-1995 in rural areas, but he left his job due to illness. His salary is often not sufficient for his family's expenses. It is for this reason that he is planning start the taxi business in addition to his job. According to his plans, this will increase his earnings. 

He first needs to purchase a car which is of the standard needed for a taxi service. The loan Dambadarjaa is taking will be used to cover the cost of a car to start his taxi business.

loans.use: To cover the cost of car to start a taxi business.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 5 children, two of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (3 grandchildren).  Edith  has a business selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for 6 years, and she works 7 days every week.  Edith sells her products from home, by means of retail. She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income through rental rooms. 

The main business challenge(s) for Edith includes defaulters and the increasing price of charcoal. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and to build more rentals houses. Edith lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication, and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Ross

texts.es:
Rossde 33 años convive hace 13 años con Juan Carlos con quien tiene un hijo de 4 años. Ellos viven en una casa propia en el anexo de Kivinaki, distrito de perené, en la provincia de Chanchamayo. Ross es una mujer de negocios. Desde que unió su vida con Juan Carlos abrió una tienda en su hogar. Empezó vendiendo artículos de perfumería, gaseosas y comestibles. Actualmente su pequeña tienda es una botica, ahí vende medicinas de  todas las marcas, artículos de perfumería, juguetes, ropa, gaseosas, etc.
Le va muy bien en el negocio por surtir bien sus productos, pues en todos estos años ha vista las necesidades de sus compradores, las que satisfació de alguna manera. Se siente contenta con su negocio.
“Hace medio año me robaron en la tienda, como 2000 soles, en todo este tiempo tuve que trabajar para volver a invertir en mi negocio. Mi situación volvió a la normalidad gracias a mis ahorros, ahora a seguir invirtiendo”, comenta. Ella anhela contar con un terreno en la ciudad de La Merced, por las mayores oportunidades de educación para su hijo. Así que seguirá trabajando duro y parejo. Este sería su primer crédito de MFP, por lo que siente contenta de recibir su apoyo. A la vez muestra satisfacción de pertenecer al banco comunal “las Semillitas de Kivinaki”. Comprará con el dinero insumos para implementar su negocio, con gaseosas, ropa, juguetes, perfumería, todo esto para la campaña navideña que es muy conveniente.
texts.en: Ross is 33 years old and has been married for 13 years to Juan Carlos, with whom she has a 4-year-old son. They live in their own home in Kivinaki, district of Perené, province of Chanchamayo, Peru. She is a businesswomen who opened a store at home after she wed Juan Carlos. She started out selling perfumes, soft drinks and food. Now her little shop is a boutique, selling all kinds of brands of medicine, perfumes, toys, clothing, soft drinks and other items. The business is going very well and is well stocked since in all this time she has met the needs of her suppliers in one way or another. She feels content with the business. "Six months ago I was robbed in the store, like 2,000 soles (approximately $750), and over all this time I have had to work to re-invest in my business. My situation has returned to normal thanks to my savings, and now I'm going to continue investing," she said. Ross aims to have a plot of land in the city of La Merced, where there are better educational opportunities for her son. So she will continue working long and hard. This will be her first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she feels content in receiving your support. At the same time, she feels satisfied with her community bank, "Las Semillitas de Kivinaki." She plans to use the money to purchase supplies, such as soft drinks, clothing, toys and perfume, to expand her business for Christmas, which is fast approaching.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, toys, clothing and perfumes.

loans.name: Kion

texts.en: Mrs. Kion has worked growing rice since she was a teenager. She is now 60 years old and blessed with six children. Two of them are living together with her in her own home in the Baray district and help support the family by selling fresh fish in a local market in the province. Kion finds that her two daughters have difficulties transporting fish to sell at the market without a motorcycle, and she really wishes to help them. So she decided to borrow some funds from HKL and Kiva to buy a used motorcycle to support her daughters’ business. She is very grateful and hopes that the loan will change her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Monserrate (Montecristi) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Monserrate se reúne cada quince días en la ciudad de Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse hace tres ciclos y formar este Grupo De Crédito que les ha servido  de mucho ya que con los créditos, ellos han mejorado  sus pequeños negocios y su vida. Ellos se dedican a diversas actividades tales como agricultura, comercio en general, servicios, entre otras actividades.

Uno de los socios de este grupo es el señor Carlos, tiene 48 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos, cuatro mayores y el menor de 17 años de edad el cual estudia en colegio, todos sus hijos viven en su casa.  Su esposa es ama de casa.

El trabaja en una empresa en la ciudad de Manta, pero además de esto es comerciante,  en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, sabanas y edredones, nos cuenta que por las noches se va a visitar a sus clientes para venderles sus productos, les deja a crédito y cobra en dos partes, los cobros los realiza los fines de semana, su mercadería compra en Guayaquil  cuando necesita. Lleva dedicado a esta labor  6 años y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas, ropa de niños, sabanas y e dredones. Este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que brinda la institución.

Su sueño es comprar un carro.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Monserrate" meets every two weeks in the city of Montecristi, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and crafts that are renowned both nationally and internationally.  It is the place of the famous Panama straw hat.

This group of people decided to get together three cycles ago and set up the communal bank which has helped them greatly.  With the loans they have received they have improved their small business and lifestyles.  They are involved in different businesses such as agriculture, general commerce, services and other activities.  

One of the members of the group is Mr. Carlos, 48, who is married and has five children, four adults and a minor son who is 17 and in school.  All of his children live at home.  His wife is a homemaker.

He works for a compny in the city of Manta, but is also a merchant and in his free time sells all kinds of clothing, sheets and comforters.  In the evenings he goes out to visit his customers to sell his products which he leaves on credit and then collects in two payments.  He collects payment on the weekends.  He buys merchandise in Guayaquil when necessary.  He has been in business for six years and it is going well for him.  

This loan will be used to buy trousers, shirts, blouses, children's clothing, sheets and comforters.  This is his third cycle with the communal bank and he enjoys the benefits offered by the institution.

His dream is to buy a car.

loans.use: To buy trousers, shirts, blouses, children's clothing, sheets and comforters.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El cliente Juan Carlos, es un señor de 22 años de edad, es casado con la señora Benedicta, el cliente presta sus servicios como chofer de una empresa de productos lácteos en una provincia que se encuentra a 15 horas de viaje de la ciudad de Cochabamba, que se encuentra al oeste de la ciudad,  actualmente el cliente vive por la zona oeste de la ciudad de Cochabamba, la casa donde vive el cliente es propia y de su familia, el cliente vive con su esposa y sus hermanos, y el destino del nuevo crédito es para capital de comercio ya que su esposa del cliente se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos en el mercado local de la ciudad, y el capital es para aumentar su negocio como también su mercadería y así mejorar sus ingresos para la sostenibilidad de su familia, es por lo cual reflejamos esta pequeña historia del cliente, para el conocimiento de todos ustedes.
texts.en:
The client, Juan Carlos is a 22 year old man. He is married to Benedicta. He lends his services as a driver for a dairy product business in a province that is found 15 hours from the city of Cochabamba toward the west. He currently lives in the western zone of Cochabamba. The house in which he lives is his own and of his family. He lives with his wife and siblings. 

The purpose of the new from the institution is for trading capital because his wife makes a living in the sale of dairy products in the city's local market. The capital is to expand his business and his merchandise. As such, he will improve his earnings for his family's livelihood. For this reason the client's history is reflected upon--for your own knowledge.

loans.use: compra de insumos y capital de comercio para la venta de leche.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.en:
Four years ago, Maria Isabel decided to open a clothes sales business to help with the family expenses at home. She thought that this activity was simple because she could work and also take care of her home and children. Maria Isabel is married and her husband is a bricklayer. One of her daughters, Enny, helps her with the business by selling her mother’s merchandise to her friends and neighbors.

Maria Isabel needs a loan of US$ 475 because her sales have increased and she needs to purchase more merchandise. She comments that thanks to her business she feels independent because her income is good and she does not need to ask her husband for money to cover her basic expenses. She works every afternoon and during the weekends she dedicates more time to the business. She feels so proud of her achievements and she one day wants to have her own clothes store in a good place.

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

Hace 4 años Maria Isabel, decidió ponerse a vender ropa para ayudar con los gastos del hogar, consideraba que era una actividad muy práctica, ya que con ella no descuidaría su casa y el cuidado de sus hijos. Maria Isabel esta casada y su esposo es albañil. Una de sus hijas de nombre Enny le ayuda en el negocio, va y surte mercancía para vender entre sus amistades y vecinos y le ayuda a cobrar los días de pago. Esta solicitando un préstamo de US $475 a 6 meses, pues se le han incrementado las ventas con motivo del cambio de temporada, por lo que necesita invertir en mercancía. Ella comenta que gracias al negocio, se siente independiente, pues las ganancias son buenas y no necesita estar pidiendo dinero a su esposo para cubrir sus gastos más básicos. Su negocio lo atiende un rato por las tardes y los fines de semana, que es cuando le dedica mayor tiempo. Se siente satisfecha con lo que esta logrando y no descarta la posibilidad de llegar a tener su propia tienda de ropa bien establecida.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more bananas and fertilizers

loans.name: Khiev

texts.en: Khiev S. E. is 25 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  S. E. stays home to watch over her two young children, while her husband is self-employed as a photographer.  Her husband can typically generate about $5 per day from his photography business.  They hope to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle for S. E.'s husband to go to and from work.  In the future, S. E. hopes to open a photograph shop where she will sell her husband's pictures.  Eventually, she hopes that she will be able to send her children to university.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle taxi to get to and from work

loans.name: Nkohi

texts.en: Mother of one child, Mrs. Nkohi O. sells cooked food and cold drinks to customers in her neighborhood of Asaba, Delta State, Nigeria. She has been in this business for five years now. Mrs. O. is looking forward to receiving a loan of US$ 750 to add to her capital and thus improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more food ingredients for her little restaurant

loans.name: Hanu

texts.fr:
Mrs. Hanu A. is 50 years of age. Despite her age, she remains very dynamic and knows how to manage her time. The second wife of a polygamous husband, she is the mother of five (5) children and has two (2) additional children in her care. Every morning, from 6AM to 9AM, she sells doughballs accompanied by fried fish. Afterwards, she goes to the market to sell cereals and gari (cassava flour). It is thanks to this activity that she is able to meet the needs of her children. Currently, the household expenses are becoming increasingly high, and Mrs. Hanu A. wants to enlarge her business. She is thus asking for a loan of $750 which will serve as a capital base for the sale, storage, and resale of cereals.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Hanu est âgée de 50 ans. Malgré cet âge, elle demeure très dynamique et sait gérer son temps. Deuxième femme d’un mari polygame, elle est mère de cinq (5) enfants et a à sa charges deux (2) autres enfants. Tous les matins, de 6 heures à 9 heures, elle vend des boules de pâtes accompagnées de poissons frits. Après elle se rend au marché pour la vente des céréales et du gari. C’est grâce à cette activité qu’elle parvient à subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. Aujourd’hui, les charges du ménage deviennent de plus en plus lourdes et Mme A. Hanu désire élargir son commerce. Elle sollicite à cet effet un crédit de $750 qui va lui servir de fond de commerce pour l’achat, le stockage et la revente des céréales.

loans.use: To buy, store, and re-sell cereals

loans.name: Emma Leticia

texts.es:
Six years ago Emma’s husband had an accident which left him unable to work for a long time. This was what pushed Emma Leticia to take up sales. She began by selling second hand clothes and little by little, through hard work, she added new clothes, footwear, cosmetics, and other things in order to pay for her husband’s medical expenses as well as the needs of her young son and household costs. Currently she has a list of client requests that unfortunately she has not been able to fill due to lack of money.

Emma is asking for a loan of $325 that she is prepared to repay in 6 months. This would help Emma buy merchandise that her clients have asked for and it would help her grow her business a little. You could be the angel that helps Emma.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace 6 años el esposo de Emma tuvo un accidente donde quedó sin poder trabajar durante un largo tiempo, esto fue lo que impulsó a Emma Leticia a emprender el camino de las ventas, comenzando por vender ropa de segunda y poco a poco, con mucho esfuerzo metiendo ropa nueva, calzado, cosméticos entre otras cosas. Para así poder pagar los gastos médicos de su esposo, los gastos de su pequeño hijo y los de su casa. Actualmente ya cuenta con una lista de pedidos que desafortunadamente no ha podido surtir por falta de dinero.

Emma está solicitando un préstamo de US $325 que está dispuesta a pagar en un plazo de 6 meses, y así ayudaras a Emma a comprar mercancía que le han solicitado y así poder crecer un poco su negocio. Tú podrás ser ese ángel que ayude a Emma.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise that will fill orders for clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Rudyt

texts.es:
The native community of Pampaniche welcomes many tourists each year and Rudyt P. is one of it's greatest ambassadors. She learned the value of hard work as a girl and continues to work today both in agriculture and in making her fine handicrafts. Her family and the community benefit greatly from her industry as she strives daily to improve their standard of living. She makes necklaces and bracelets out of all sorts of materials and these are very popular with tourists. At this time she would like to improve the setup of her retail space and buy craft materials in greater bulk. Please help her fulfill her dreams.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

La comunidad nativa de Pampaniche, muestra gran cordialidad y amabilidad al recibir a los cientos de visitantes y turistas que llegan en gran cantidad a esta localidad y sin duda una de las impulsoras de este acogedor ambiente, es la señora Rudyt P., quien desde niña aprendió el valor del trabajo a través de las labores agrícolas y artesanales.Aún continua desarrollando estas actividades de una manera muy eficiente en beneficio de su amada familia y su comunidad; todo con el único propósito de brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Ella elabora hábilmente collares y pulseras con materiales muy diversos, que los turistas y visitantes saben apreciar en muy grande forma. Desea acondicionar de una mejor manera su kiosco y así mismo traer mayor cantidad de materiales para elaborar mejores productos a fin de que los visitantes puedan llevarse hermosas piezas.Ayudemos a esta mujer emprendedora y diligente en la realización de sus sueños.

loans.use: To set up a shop space and to buy craft materials.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.es:
Catherine is a very active woman with wishes of self-improvement. For a long time now, she has been selling beauty products such as: perfumes, shampoos, powders, lipsticks, nail polish removers, etc. In the time she has been doing this job, she has acquired a great range of clients, and for that reason she has decided to set up a glass counter (showcase) so that she can display these beauty products. Wilter, her loving husband, supports her in all her decisions since he is an independent worker. She is the mother of three wonderful children, and all she expects from them is that they get an education so that they can reach each one of the goals they set in the future. She is in immediate need of investment capital to reach her objectives and accomplish everything she wants to do. With your help, Catherine will accomplish her goals in a very short time.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Catherine, es una dama muy activa y con deseos de superación, se dedica desde hace mucho tiempo a la venta de productos de belleza como: perfumes, shampoos, talcos, lápices labiales, Correctores para uñas, etc; con este trabajo durante el tiempo de su permanencia ha conseguido una gran gama de clientes y es por eso que ahora optó por poner su mostrador (vitrina), con el fin de exhibir estos productos de belleza, el señor Wilter su querido esposo la apoya en todas sus decisiones, ya que él es trabajador independiente. Ella es madre de tres hijos maravillosos y lo único que espera es que estudien para que puedan alcanzar cada una de las metas que se tracen en un futuro; precisa de un capital de inversión lo más pronto posible para lograr su objetivo y cumplir con lo que realmente quiere. Con tu ayuda la señora Catherine logrará su propósito en corto tiempo.

loans.use: Increase capital to purchase a glass counter (showcase).

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en: Dominga is in her early thirties and she has three children who attend school.  Dominga has been running a small grocery store for seven years in the Café, community of Santo Domingo.
