Every day, people visit her store to purchase miscellaneous products such as bread, milk, chocolate, spaghetti, tomato paste, butter, rice, beans and other basic foodstuffs. The grocery store is the principal source of income of the family. Dominga would like to expand her business and add new products to the store, which is why she has asked for this loan.  With the loan, Dominga expects to be a condition to continue expanding her business and maintain a comfortable lifestyle for her family.

loans.use: to replenish the entrepreneur's grocery store.

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Mr. Kokou A. was born in 1968 in Gapé, where he now works as a farmer. A married father of two (2), he also has three (3) of his brother's children as apprentices. His main business is agriculture, which provides him with the means to meet the needs of his family. He owns a large field of pineapples, but due to the poor quality of the soil and the insects, he is no longer able to satisfy market demand. Very hard-working, he is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and insecticides.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur A. Kokou cultivateur à Gapé est né en 1968 dans la même localité. Marié et père de deux (2) enfants il a en charge trois (3) autres enfants de son frère en apprentissage. Son activité principale est l’agriculture qui lui procure le nécessaire pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Il dispose d’un vaste champ d’ananas mais à cause de la pauvreté du sol et des insectes il n’arrive plus à satisfaire la demande du marché. Très travailleur, il sollicite un financement pour acheter des fertilisants et des insecticides

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Sara Del Pilar

texts.es:
Señora Sara del Pilar is 26 years old. She has one little son who is three years old and she makes a living by making undergarments in a modest shop that she set up in a space in her house. Everyday she receives orders and since the undergarments are easy to make she does not have a problem accepting them ever due to the amount of time required to make them. However, she does run into the obstacle of not having sufficient raw materials to make these undergarments and many times it has caused her to not accept orders. For this reason she is requesting a loan for a boost of working capital to get her shop running in a space that is better set up and so she can put her name brand on the garments so that they will become well known.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La señora Sara del Pilar de 26 años de edad, tiene un pequeño niño de tres años de edad y se dedica a confeccionar prendas interiores en un modesto taller que acondicionó en un espacio de su domicilio, a diario recibe pedidos y debido a que son prendas de fácil confección no tiene problemas en aceptarlos incluso con menor tiempo de lo requerido para la confección de estas prendas, sin embargo el obstáculo de no contar con materia prima suficiente muchas veces la han llevado a no aceptar los pedidos. Por esa razón solicita un préstamo a fin de e poco tiempo con la inyección de capital de trabajo que obtenga poner en marcha su taller en un espacio más acondicionado y ponerle un nombre a sus prendas para que estas sean reconocidas.

loans.use: Increase in capital to acquire a greater quantity of raw material for making undergarments.

loans.name: Maria  Yolanda

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Yolanda M. I. belongs to the Communal Bank “Sarita Colonia”. She lives in the Mariscal Cáceres province of San Martín, in the Juanjui district. She started her business in the parking lot of Juanjui-Tarapoto and serves people coming from the interior of the province. Maria’s clientèle is fluid but her continued sales are assured by her clean store and good treatment of her customers.

When Maria separated from her spouse and found herself facing the world with just her children, she decided to set up a business selling traditional food so that her family could get ahead. With a loan of 1,000.00 soles, Maria will buy cooking supplies such as: rice, sugar, soups, vegetables of all varieties, ground beef, chicken, pork, and fish. She’ll use these supplies to prepare a variety of food so that she can pay back the loan in 6 months.

Maria is a young woman of 40, enthusiastic and persevering. She’d like a better future for her children and dreams of building her own house with rooms that she can rent out in order to ensure a future for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Maria Yolanda M. I. pertenece al Banco Comunal.” Sarita Colonia”, vive en la Región San Martín , Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres y distrito de Juanjui, desarrolla su negocio en un puesto ubicado en el paradero de autos Juanjui – Tarapoto que realiza servicio a los pueblos del interior de la provincia, por la que la clientela es bastante fluida y sus ventas están aseguradas por el buen trato e higiene de su negocio. Al separase de su esposo y al verse sola enfrentándose a la vida con sus hijos decidió iniciar con este tipo de negocio venta de comida tipo menú, para así sacar adelante a su familia Con el crédito de S/ 1000.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, le servirá para adquirir los insumos para la preparación de los alimentos como: arroz, azúcar, menestras al por mayor, verduras en todas sus variedades por kilos, carnes de res, pollo, cerdo y pescado también en kilos, que le permitirá preparar comida variada para atender a sus clientes. Maria es una mujer joven de 40 años, entusiasta y perseverante quiere un futuro mejor para sus hijos por lo que sueña con construir su propia casa y tener cuartos para ser alquilados y asegurándolos así un porvenir .

loans.use: Con el prestamo comprara mas insumos para la preparacion de sus alimentos

loans.name: Anipha

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 29 year-old Anipha S.. She is single and has one child, aged 6. In 2007, Anipha opened a small stand where she sells snacks, candy, phone credit vouchers and other items. She has applied for a loan to buy additional stocks of each item, and wishes to thank you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of candy, phone credit vouchers, and snacks.

loans.name: Presentacion Del Car

texts.es:
Ms. Presentación del Carmen is a very hardworking person who sells clothing inside the El Bisne market in the city of Chinandega. She is arduously dedicated to her business with the aim of improving its condition and getting ahead so that she can offer her young son better living conditions.

Ever since she started her business, it has steadily been improving and she has been able to acquire greater quantities of merchandise to sell. She currently needs to invest in the purchase of clothing, which is why she is seeking Ceprodel’s backing for a loan that will allow her to purchase merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La dama Presentación del Carmen es una persona muy esforzada que se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa atendida en su propio negocio en el mercado El Bisne de la ciudad de Chinandega. Se dedica muy esforzadamente a su negocio con el propósito de mejorar su condición y salir adelante para brindarle las condiciones de vida necesaria a su pequeño hijo.

Desde que inició su negocio ha ido mejorando hasta adquirir mayores volúmenes de mercadería para sus ventas. La necesidad que hoy en día atraviesa es que necesita invertir en la compra de la ropa y es por esta situación que busca el respaldo en Ceprodel para obtener un crédito necesario para la compra de su mercadería.

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Sadiq

texts.en:
Sadiq U. is young and married. This resident of the Ningarhar has three children; they are small and don’t go to school yet. Sadiq and his family have returned from two decades of living as refugees in neighboring Pakistan. The young man studied in Pakistan in a private school and his father used to work in a general store.

Upon repatriation the family has faced various financial problems, pushing the young man to leave off the pursuit of his education and help his father to support their family. Unfortunately, his father has been getting weaker day by day, as he has had some serious illnesses. Sadiq U. had to take the responsibility for supporting his family and has started a small business in his village.

With a little family fund, Sadiq purchased some basic goods and put them in his shop. Due to his friendly behavior, he became a popular shopkeeper in the village, attracting more customers day by day. Besides the store, he grows some vegetables on his land to sell them in his own shop. He enrolled his small brother in a public school and some other private courses. Now Sadiq is very happy with his life, and he is attempting to start his remaining education once again. For that purpose, he first needs to expand his business to increase his income from about US$8 a day to US$ 16 per day. With this goal in mind, he is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 Afghanis (US$ 1100).

Sadiq U. hopes to make a brighter future for himself and his brother. And he says that everything is possible if we have a strong will.

loans.use: To buy seeds, etc. for his land

loans.name: Mkasi

texts.en:
Mkasi is 33 years old. She is married with 5 children aged 16, 11, 9, 6, and 1. She has been a juice seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 25 from her sales.

Mkasi is now seeking a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
With skillful experience in motorcycle repairs, Mr. Tom T. decided to open his own repair business, where he also provides motorcycle washing services outside his home. He opened his business in 2008, and so far it is going well. He earns around US$8.00 per day. His wife, who is 23 years old, sells groceries and earns around US$4.00 per day. The couple lives with one child in Kontang Commune, Siem Reap Province.

Because of his quickly growing business, Tom is requesting a loan to purchase more repair service instruments. He would also like to use part of the loan to buy a faster and more efficient washing machine.

loans.use: To purchase additional instruments to repair motorcycles.

loans.name: Chin

texts.en:
Mr. Chin S. was born in 1972 and he now lives in Klaong Thvear Village in Takeo Province. He is a farmer who can make a little revenue to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Pen Sokhom, sells palm sugar. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more palm sugar to meet her customers' demand.

Mr. Chin S. has six children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, while the other three attend the local school. The youngest one is too young to work or study at the age of seven months. His wife is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more palm sugar.

loans.name: Chen

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Chén năm nay 54 tuổi, gia đình chị có 5 con đều đã trưởng thành. Tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1994 chị Chén  xin vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Đến năm 2005, nhờ kinh tế gia đình phát triển chị đã đầu tư mua được máy say sát gạo phục vụ cho nhu cầu của bà con địa phương. Hiện  nay với mức thu nhập 5.000.000đ từ chăn nuôi, làm máy sát gạo và lương của chồng kinh tế gia đình  chị Chén đang ngày càng phát triển hơn. Vòng vốn tới chị mongm uốn được vay 8.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn vào chăn nuôi lợn, gà.
texts.en:
Ms. N. Thi Chen is 54 years old. Her family has 5 children, all are grown. Joining TYM fund in 1994, she borrowed money to invest in raising pigs. In 2005, thanks to improved family income, she was able to purchase a machine to grind rice for the local community. Presently, with income from raising pigs at 297 USD, rice grinding and her husband's salary, her family's income is improving every day. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 475 USD to invest in raising pigs and chickens.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business and raising pigs and chickens

loans.name: Hanieh

texts.en: Hanieh is a 48 year old single woman living in Bazourieh, Southern Lebanon, and has been working as a tailor since 2005. Hanieh first started selling textiles to her neighbors and friends. After several years, she wanted to open her own shop and shifted to tailoring. Today, Hanieh wants to borrow $1,200 to buy textiles and a sewing kit to provide a variety of products for her clientele.

loans.use: Buy textiles and a sewing kit

loans.name: Saifuddin

texts.ru: Сатторов Сайфуддин житель Шахринау. Не женат. Возраст 32 года. Живет  со своими родителями и семьей брата. Семья очень большая, поэтому для того, чтобы прокормить семью ему приходится много работать. В его семье работают все. Женщины работают дома , а мужчины на рынке. Они покупают молодых неоткормленных телят , откармливают , растят , а затем продают. Таким образом все заняты бизнесом. Сейчас время дешевых животных , поэтому он планирует получить кредит и купить  еще одного бычка. Таким образом он увеличит поголовье скота. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Saifuddin S. lives in the Shahrinav district. He is 32 years old and lives with his parents and his brother’s family. Hi family is very big, so he has to work a lot in order to support the family. Everyone in his family works: women work at home, and men at the market. They purchase young calves, feed and grow them and then sell them. Current animal prices are very low, so Saifuddin wants to obtain this loan to purchase one more bull and to increase his cattle headcount. He will be able to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bull

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
ERIKA RÍOS GARCÍA, pertenece al Banco Comunal “De la Amistad II”, ubicado en el Jr. Libertad N° 820 int. 08 del Distrito de Callería, tiene 25 años de edad, dos menores hijos, su esposo trabaja vendiendo ropas en el mercado, con tres años de ser socia de Manuela Ramos.

Su primer préstamo fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró ropas, shores, blusas, polos, vendía de casa en casa, adquirió muchos clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, compró sábanas importadas, blusas, shorts, zapatos, camisas, todo lo vende en el Mercado, deja a crédito, cobra diario, luego vuelve a invertir.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por la confianza y credibilidad de su persona.
texts.en:
Erika R. G. belongs to the From Friendship II Community Bank, located in Jr. Libertad N° 820 int. 08 in the district of Callería. She is 25 years old, has two young children, and her husband sells clothes in the market. She has been a member of Manuela Ramos for three years. Her first loan was for 300 soles. She bought clothes, blouses, and polo shirts. She sold her products door to door and gained many clients. With this loan of 1500 soles, she will buy imported sheets, blouses, shorts, shoes, and shirts. She will sell of this in the market on credit. She will cover this daily and then will invest the money. She is thankful to Manuela Ramos for their trust and credibility that they have.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy imported sheets, blouses, shorts, shoes, and shirts, which she will sell in the market

loans.name: Vat

texts.en: Mr. Vat V. is 52 years old. He has a battery charging machine and provides a battery charge service for the village. He started his business in 2005 and earns an average income of $5 per day. To help meet the family's foods need, his wife grows vegetables and sells groceries. The couple currently live in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. They have two children who are married and live away from the family home. V. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a second-hand motorcycle for family transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a second-hand motorcycle for family transportation

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther O. sells second-hand shoes. She hopes to expand her business. She travels to Cotonou to purchase second-hand shoes to sell in Warri, Delta state, Nigeria. She is 49 years old and married with seven children. She is asking for a loan of $950 to purchase more shoes to sell. Esther says thanks to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand shoes to sell

loans.name: In

texts.en: Almost one hectare of the village land and a wooden house in Pursat Province belong to Mrs. In M. and six other family members. She, 56, earns a living cultivating rice and raising pigs in a small pigpen next to her house. She has been farming for years, a skill she learned from her grandparents who have now been dead for a long time. Her husband helps her with her business activities. The old couple have nine children; five of them are single and the others are married and live independently. Two of their single children are employed. Because the farming season is approaching, the family needs to have cows and some fertilizers for their farming business, and this is why they are applying for a loan. They plan to use half of the loan to repair their house.

loans.use: To buy cows, fertilizers, and to repair their house.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua A. is twenty-eight years old. She is married and blessed with three children. Currently, they are all pursuing education in primary school. She lives with her family in a house in a town called Akim Oda, a farming community in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She works with zeal as a resourceful mother to support her family and provide for the children's schooling.

She is a fish monger and sells all kinds of fresh and smoked fishes. She sells in a shed in the local market square. She procures her stock of fish from big time fish mongers in Mankessim town, who sell at wholesale prices. She has been in business for eight years. According to Akua, most of her customers are food vendors in her community.

She believes the loan assistance would enable her to buy tilapia and assorted fishes in bulk to serve a larger market and eventually help improve her family finances. She is a member of a Trust Bank group called Zion Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support themselves in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To procure smoked fish and tilapia.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
"I started my rice farm since I got married. My harvest is what I expect to help me provide the needs of my family," says Carlos D. from Bunawan Agusan Del Sur. Carlos is 55 years old and has 5 children. He works hard to increase his yield. He also grows vegetables in his farm to supplement his income.

He is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and moluscides. The loan will really help him increase his harvest and buy their needs.

CEVI has helped a lot of farmers grow their small farms. CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, herbicide, and moluscides

loans.name: Ni Ketut Sumadi

texts.en:
Ni Ketut Sumadi - (DNR.M-0681), a 40 year-old married mother of two school-aged children, lives in the town of Sari Kuning – Melaya, where she owns and operates a business raising livestock. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Ni Ketut Sumadi has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 500,000 IDR a month.

In 2008, Ni Ketut Sumadi joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ni Ketut Sumadi is now requesting a loan, her second from DINARI, of 5,000,000 IDR, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. Ni Ketut Sumadi plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell.

loans.name: Mr. Chenda Tim Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty seven people living in Preah Theat village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mr. Chenda T. is the 28-year-old village bank president.

Mr. Chenda T. is a farmer who owns 0.5-hectar (1.25-acre) piece of land on which he cultivates rice. In his plantation, he faces a problem because his field is infertile. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer; he would use the rest of loan to hire laborers to work on the field. His wife, Mrs. Num Dara, is a construction worker. This couple has two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the youngest one is just two years old.

Mr. Liheng P. did not come to take a loan but his wife did, so she is shown in the picture instead. 

Seventeen members in this group are taking end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Those taking end-of-term loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term.

End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to hire laborers to work on the field

loans.name: Lo

texts.en:
Lo S., 46, helps support her whole family by selling grocery items. For additional income, she also sells beef soup to her neighbors in the evening. She is married with one young child. Her husband raises pigs out of their home.

Recently, Lo S. sold nearly all the items from her store, so she needs to buy more grocery inventory in order to continue selling. However, she does not have enough money to do so. That is why she has decided to ask for a loan of $600 from Kiva’s partner HKL. This will provide her with additional income to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To replenish her grocery inventory

loans.name: Saidanvar

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
     Саиданвару 32 года. Он женат и отец 3-х детей. Его жена нигде не работает. Она сидит дома и делает домашнюю работу, нянчит своих детей и кормит скот. Саиданвар занимается откормом и продажей скота. Летний сезон для Саиданвара – это сезон закупа скота, потому, что летом скот и его корм стоит дешево. И для откорма скота не надо много тратиться. Скот ест горную траву, и Саиданвар экономит на корме скота. С наступлением зимы Саиданвар продает часть откормившегося скота. Но он не покупает скот. Он покупает корм, для откорма оставшегося скота.
texts.en:
Saidanvar is 32 years old. He is married and is a father of 3 children. His wife is not employed. She stays at home and does domestic work, raises their children and feeds livestock. Saidanvar is involved in raising and selling livestock. Summer season for Saidanvar is the time to purchase livestock because livestock and feed are less expensive during the summer. And he does not have to spend much for animal feed because livestock eats mountain grass, and, thus, Saidanvar saves on livestock feed. With the onset of winter, Saidanvar sells some of the raised livestock, but does not buy any new livestock. He buys animal feed for the remaining livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Casilda

texts.es:
Préstamo anterior: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id= 101966&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Casilda  es socia del Bancomunal El Triunfo. 
Casilda  sigue trabajando en su bodega, ella trabaja  todo el día, atienD. sola.  
Casilda necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles, para comprar bebidas. 
El préstamo ha hecho que su capital aumente y tiene su bodega mas surtida. 
El sueño D. Casilda es seguir trabajando hasta que  sus fuerzas le den.
texts.en:
Click HERE to see the previous loan.

Casilda is a member of El Triunfo (The Triumph) Communal Bank. She continues working every day at her grocery store, which she manages by herself.

She needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy beverages. The money will increase her operating capital so that her store remains well stocked. She hopes to continue working as long as she has the strength.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beverages

loans.name: Fatma

texts.fr: Fatma N. est une femme âgée de 54 ans, mère de 6 enfants. Elle vend des fruits de saison et aimerait renforcer son activité pour mieux subvenir aux charges familiales.

loans.use: Vente de fruits de saison

loans.name: Mireille

texts.en: Mireille is a 32-year-old married woman living with her husband and 2 children. In 2006 she decided to open her own store where she produces packaging and decoration for chocolates. Today, Mireille is requesting to borrow $1,100 to purchase merchandise for her business.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Ouvrir un second point de vente

loans.name: Las Aguilas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Águilas” esta representado por la señora Katherine  y conformado 14 miembros los cuales todos tiene  actividades comerciales como la venta D. ropa, comida, cosmético, pan, empanadas y refrescos, algunos tienen trabajos como cargadores, taxistas y empleadas domestica, todos son personas D. escasos recursos pero muy trabajadoras y responsables es por esta razón que no tiene mucha  competencia ya que su trabajo es duro y difícil D. realizar en la misma zona. El destino del crédito es la inversión en nuevos negocios para salir D. algunos empleos difíciles como el empleo domestico y el cargar bultos que van acabando con la salud D. los socios, el resto D. los socios requiere el crédito para la  compra D. mercadería mas barata e insumos para incrementar sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos que ayudara en el mejoramiento D. la calidad D. vida D. sus familias. En cuanto a la experiencia los socios han demostrado responsabilidad en sus pagos y sobre todo muchas ganas D. seguir creciendo es así que la institución les brinda un nuevo apoyo económico.
texts.en:
Catherine represents the Las Águilas Group, which is comprised of 14 members. They are engaged in businesses like selling clothes, food, cosmetics, bread, empanadas, and soft drinks. Some of them have work as porters, as taxi drivers, and as domestic employees. All of them have scant resources, but they are very hard-working and responsible. That is the reason that they do not have much competition. Their work is hard and difficult to do. The loan is to invest in new businesses to leave some difficult jobs like being a domestic employee and carrying luggage. These jobs are having an adverse affect on the members’ health. The rest of the members need a loan to buy cheaper merchandise and supplies to increase their sales and improve their income. This will help them improve the quality of life for their families. As far as the members’ experience goes, they have demonstrated responsibility in their payments. Above all, all of them have the desire to keep growing. That is why the institution offers them a new economic support.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Mary Wambui

texts.en:
Mary runs a kiosk from which she sells charcoal, and once in a awhile some vegetables if she is able to get a hold of them. This is the first loan she has ever taken from any institution, and she plans to use it to purchase additional stock of charcoal and potatoes to sell from her kiosk. Mary lives in a very low income area and most of her customers live in this area. Her goal is to one day grow her business and increase her profits so that she can develop a more sturdy, secure home to live in. 

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Purchase charcoal and potatoes to sell from her kiosk

loans.name: El Tocte (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Tocte  se formó en la hermosa ciudad de Cuenca, cuna de artistas, escritores, deportistas,  dueña de una riqueza incalculable de arquitectura e historia acoge al turista nacional y extranjero para brindarle toda la belleza natural que encierra la urbe y su entorno.

Este banco lo integran hombres y mujeres emprendedores con deseos de superarse cada día tanto en sus hogares  como en  su comunidad para ofrecer a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida basada en valores como la honestidad, el trabajo, la ayuda mutua para alcanzar los objetivos planteados.

La señora  Norma  Lucía C. es socia del banco comunal el Tocte, vive en el cantón de Gualaceo a las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca,  tiene 21 años convive con su esposo y su niña de un año cuatro mese, su cónyuge trabaja como estuquero, cuidan una casa y en ella habitan ya que aún no tienen casa propia.

Norma comparte sus actividades entre  los quehaceres domésticos y la cría de animales como cuyes y  gallinas  para venderlos a sus vecinos de la comunidad y para el consumo en casa.

Lleva tres ciclos trabajando con su banco comunal, nos comenta que los préstamos le han ayudado para comprar sus animales  y su  alimento,  con el nuevo préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le entregue  va a comprar  más cuyes y gallinas, alimento y vitaminas para su crianza para incrementar su criadero.

El señor  Luis Z. es el único hombre en su  banco comunal, él  vive en la parroquia de Jadan en el sector el Tocte, tiene 29 años de edad, se encuentra soltero y vive con sus padres apoyándolos un poco económicamente ya que  tiene un hijo de 6 años por lo que tiene que  solventar los gastos de mantención y  estudio de su niño.

 Luis trabaja como estuquero  tiene su taller propio lleva 12 años trabajando en este oficio, su horario es de lunes a viernes, también  tiene un pequeño bazar donde expende principalmente  hilos, agujas, lanas y más artículos para las manualidades.

Lleva tres ciclos trabajando con su banco comunal  y nos comenta que los préstamos le han ayudado mucho para comprar los materiales necesarios para su trabajo, con el nuevo préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le entregue  va a  comprar materiales como carrizo,  cal,  para seguir elaborando las planchas de cielo raso  para mantener abastecido  su negocio y dar un buen servicio a sus clientes.

Su gran sueño es llegar hacer un gran comerciante.
texts.en:
The Tocte Community Bank is based in the beautiful city of Cuenca, which is home to artists, writers and sportsmen. The city has a priceless wealth of architecture and history and welcomes domestic and foreign tourists to see all the natural beauty that the city and its surroundings offer. This bank is composed of both men and women entrepreneurs with a daily desire to overcome both at home and in their community to give their families a better quality of life based on values such as honesty, hard work and mutual support to achieve their objectives. Mrs. Norma Lucia Court is a member of the Tocte Community Bank and lives in the town of Gualaceo on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca. She is 21 and lives with her husband and child of 1 year and 4 months of age. Her husband works as roof designer, and they jointly care for the house and live there but still do not own their own home. Norma splits her time between household chores and raising animals like guinea pigs and chickens to sell to her neighbors in the community and for consumption at home. She has been with her community bank for three cycles and says that the loans have helped to buy animals and food. With this new loan provided by Fundación Espoir, she will buy more guinea pigs, chickens, feed and vitamins for breeding in order to increase the size of her farm. Mr. Luis Z. is the only man in his village bank. He lives in the parish of Jadan in the Tocte sector. He is 29 years old, is unmarried and lives with his parents who he supports financially a bit. He has a 6-year old for whom he covers the costs of living and study. Luis works as a roof designer and has his own workshop. He has been working for 12 years in this job. His hours are Monday through Friday. He also has a small stand at the local market where he mainly sells thread, needles, wool and more items for crafts. This is his third cycle working with his community bank. He stated that the loans have greatly helped him to buy materials needed for his work. With the new loan provided by Fundación Espoir, he is going to buy materials such as reeds to further develop roofs in order to keep his inventory stocked and to provide good service to his customers. His big dream is to become a great trader.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Fellow

loans.use: Buy chickens, guinea pigs, animal feed and vitamins, buy roofing materials

loans.name: Lizbeth

texts.es: Lizbeth G. es una socia dinámica y optimista, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 35 años, es madre de una niña (menor de edad). Lizbeth se dedica a la venta de jugos y desayunos,  cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es comerciante. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Juntas hasta el final” desde hace cinco años, el primer préstamo que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue utilizado en la compra de una batidora. Ahora Lizbeth necesita un crédito de 1600 soles, que será utilizado en la compra de otra batidora y accesorios para la implementación de su negocio. La meta de Lizbeth es llegar a construir habitaciones para dar el servicio de hospedaje donde se de una buena atención a los clientes.
texts.en:
Lizbeth G. is one of our dynamic and optimistic members who lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She is 35 years old and the mother of a young daughter.

Lizbeth sells breakfasts and juices and has the support of her husband, who works as a merchant. She joined the Communal Bank “Juntas hasta el Final” (Together until the End) five years ago. The first loan she received was in the amount of 300 soles and was used to purchase a blender.

At the moment, Lizbeth is requesting a loan of 1600 so that she can buy another blender and accessories to continue her business. Her goal is to eventually construct boarding rooms and offer hospitality services. In this future endeavor, she hopes to provide good service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a blender & other accessories

loans.name: Nkechi

texts.en:
Nkechi is 40 years old, married, and has three school-aged children who are still dependent upon her. She is a very hardworking and friendly woman.
Nkechi sells foodstuffs at retail prices to her customers. She loves her business because of the one-to-one interaction she has with her customers. Nkechi is a committed client of Kiva partner, LAPO, which is dedicated to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Ricardo José

texts.es:
El señor Ricardo M. se ha destacado como un alegre comerciante de frutas y verduras las que son ofrecidas en el municipio de Somotillo en su propio establecimiento donde oferta los productos a sus clientes que le visitan con el fin de comprar las frutas y las verduras.
Actualmente está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de las frutas y las verduras y de esta manera obtener los ingresos para llevarlos hasta su casa de habitación y así beneficiar a su familia.
Espera que su crédito le sea entregado satisfactoriamente  para continuar con este trabajo y así  mejorar sus condiciones económicas y las de su familia.
texts.en:
Ricardo M. stands out as a happy fruit and vegetable vendor. He sells his fruits and vegetables out of his own establishment in the municipality of Somotillo, where his clients visit him regularly to buy the products he offers.

He is currently requesting a loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables that will provide him with earnings to take home to support his family.

He hopes to be approved for this loan so he can continue in his current line of work and thus improve both his and his family’s economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Huthnance, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Prudencia

texts.en:
Prudencia is a client of Asociación Arariwa.  She is a member of a communal bank consisting of 20 members in Cusco.  The group is called Las Hijas de Maria (“Mary’s daughters” in Spanish).  Prudencia is married and lives in Cusco.  She has seven children.  The two oldest children are now university students, one of whom is studying to become a math professor. 

Prudencia runs a small food distribution business in Cusco which she started five years ago.  She buys cheeses and meats in the Chumbivilcas province (a remote and poor region south of Cusco), which she then sells in Cusco.  Prudencia is requesting a loan to invest in her business and to help with her son’s tuition payments.

Prudencia appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

Prudencia is pictured with her husband.

loans.use: to buy meat and cheese to sell and to pay for tuition

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort O. sells dried salted fish, maize and other food supplies at Elmina. She has received senior high education. She is married and has three children and her husband is a driver.

Comfort has been selling food supplies for some time now, supporting her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy bags of maize, salted fish and other food supplies for resale. In the photo, she is displaying the variety of fish she sells.

Comfort hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to improve the quality of education for her children.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize, salted fish other food supplies to sell

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: Monsieur Mamadou G. est un jeune couturier de 31 ans qui habite à Bambilor. Il  a démarré son activité depuis 1992.Il en est à son premier crédit. C’est après avoir abandonner les études qu’il s’est oriente cette activité. Ce qui l’intéresse le plus dans cette  activité ce sont les relations  qu’il entretient avec la clientèle. Il sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs destine a l’achat de tissus qui vont servir a la confection  de prêts a porter. Ce crédit va lui permettre d’augmenter ses bénéfices et a mieux subvenir a ses besoins.
texts.en:
Mr. Mamadou G. is a 31 year-old tailor living in Bambilor. He started his business in 1992 after having left school. What he likes the most about this business is the relationships that he has with his customers. He is requesting a 100 000 francs loan to purchase fabrics to make ready-to-wear garments. This will be his first loan. It will allow him to increase his revenues and better meet his needs.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en: “Thankfully, my business is going well. My husband and I make sure we have abundant harvest every time”, Annabelle shares of her rice farming. A 30-year-old woman, she has two young children that motivate her to work hard. Now, she needs farm inputs for her rice farm. She asked for a loan of 5,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She said the loan would be used to purchase farm supplies like seeds, fertilizers and others.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Nget

texts.en: Mrs. Nget K. lives in Prey Prum village in Takeo Province and she was born in 1958. She and her husband, Mr. Chheng Man, are farmers who own a plot of land for growing rice which is how they support their family.  They have some problems with the rice field because it is located far from an irrigation system. Thus, in order to improve their business, Mrs. Nget K. has decided to request a loan to buy a water machine. She will also buy a cow for breeding. This couple has a child who attends the local public school. Her husband is on the left in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a water machine and a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
En el barrio Carlos Fonseca  Municipio de Somotillo 
El señor J. C.   realiza su trabajo como chofer de una ruta de taxis Somotillo Guasaule dándo les da servicio de viajes a todos los clientes de las comarcas y alos del casco urbano.
 El quiere el crédito para comprar de  30 bolsas de cemento  para la construcción de una pared en su casa de habitación y de esta manera tener una mejor seguridad para el su familia
texts.en:
In the neighborhood of Carlos Fonseca, municipality of Somotillo, Rodolfo works as a chauffeur on the taxi route Somotillo-Guasaule, providing transportation services for all customers of the region, as well as for those of the urban center. He needs the loan to buy 30 bags of cement (and to pay for labor) to construct a wall in his home. In this manner, he hopes to provide greater security for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING 30 BAGS OF CEMENT AND PAYING LABOR COSTS FOR BUILDING A WALL IN HIS HOME

loans.name: Wait For Me Group

texts.en:
Here are small-scale entrepreneurs from Makeni City, in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 500,000 for each person in the group to further strengthen their businesses. With the help of the loan, they will be able to buy more goods, attract more customers, make more sales and profit, and consequently improve their living conditions.

Isatu K., who is pictured second from left, is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. The forty-two-year-old is married to a driver and they have two children who attend primary schools. Isatu has been a businesswoman for two years. Isatu sells bowls, dishes, spoons, knives, palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil) and sugar. With her share of the loan, she will buy the above mentioned items in wholesale to add to her current ones.

loans.use: Buys bowls, dishes, spoons, knives, palm-oil and sugar

loans.name: Qolquewasi Group

texts.es:
Los socios del banco comunal “Qolquewasi” se reúnen cada treinta días en las oficinas de la unidad de micro finanzas de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Actualmente, el banco comunal se encuentra en el ciclo 12 y está conformado por  personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. 
	
Gladys, tiene 47 años, es viuda,  tiene tres hijas de las cuales dos son independientes y una todavía depende de  ella. 

Gladys nos cuenta. - En mi banco comunal “Qolquewasi”  somos  13 integrantes (10 mujeres y 3 varones) y me eligieron a mí como representante del banco comunal para dar mi testimonio de mi actividad económica. Gladys es enfermera y trabaja en ESSALUD. Ya son 20 años que trabaja en el seguro y le va muy bien. Ella y su hermana Nataly tienen un negocio familiar de venta de artesanía en el centro comercial “Intipakaria”  en la Av. del Sol de la ciudad del Cusco. Gladys hace dos años que fue elegida como la fiscal.  Gladys requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo tela, pinturas, etc.     

Las actividades económicas de algunos de los socios a lo que se dedican son  a las ventas de  comestibles, venta de productos secos, venta de cuyes, venta de autopartes, venta de panadería, venta de muebles  de madera y otros socios brindan servicios de transportes, empleada, atención de familia, profesora de inicial, lavar ropa y además son profesionales en ingeniería de sistemas y educación.

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

Cusco es una ciudad que se caracteriza por sus centros arqueológicos, su centro histórico,  sus paisajes, su historia, siendo una ciudad encantadora de la región sur del país.

(La socia Lucila a parece en la parte inferior de fotografía pues llegó tarde a la toma de la foto).
texts.en:
The members of the “Qolquewasi” communal bank meet every thirty days in the offices of the “Asociación Arariwa” microfinance company in the city of Cusco. Currently, the communal bank is in its 12th cycle and is made up for hardworking, enterprising people who are always looking for ways to get ahead. With their daily efforts, they are securing a better future for their children. Gladys is a 47 year old widow with three children, two of whom are grown up and one who is still dependent upon her. Gladys tells us: “In my communal bank “Qolquewasi” there are 13 members (10 women and 3 men) and they elected me to represent the communal bank and give my testimony of my economic activity.” Gladys is a nurse and works in ESSALUD. It has been 20 years since she started working there and it is going very well. Along with her sister Nataly, she has a family business selling crafts in the “Intipakaria” market on the Sol Avenue in the city of Cusco. Gladys requires the loan in order to buy things such as material and paints for work. The economic activities of some of the members include selling groceries, dry goods, guinea pigs, car parts, bread, and wooden furniture. Some members are involved in the service industry working in transportation, housekeeping, child minding, teaching and laundry services. Others are professionals in engineering systems and education. The members value and appreciate the loans authorized through this method and promise to repay the loan in the established plan. Cusco is a city that is known for its archeological and historical centers, its scenery, and its history. Cusco is a much loved city in this southern region of the country. (Lucila, one of the group members, appears in a separate photo since she arrived late to the photo session).

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Gladys requires the loan in order to buy things for work such as material, paints etc.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
La señora Juliana D. P., es casada de 58 años, tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad que trabajan  como albañiles apoyando a sus padres cuando logran recoger algunos  ahorros, ella comprende su situación puesto que el desempleo y el bajo pago con que hoy en día solventan no les  permite que le apoyar a su familia, ella tiene una tortillería desde hace mas de 22 años, este ha sido por largo tiempo su fuente de ingresos y sustento,  fue con el apoyo de su esposo que sus días de venta  de tortilla iniciaron.

Su casa de habitación es muy humilde y el techo se encuentra muy destruido, es por esta razón que solicita de un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción que le permitan componer y cambiar las laminas de zinc, esa inversión es de manera  urgente, debido a que las temporada de invierno ya inicio y cuando llueve se les filtra el agua y amenaza con la salud de los que en ella habitan y con la destrucción de  los bienes inmuebles del hogar.
texts.en:
Juliana D. P., age 58, is married and has two children. They are grown, and they work as bricklayers. They help their parents when they are able to get some savings. She understands the situation given the unemployment and low pay that exists now. It does not allow them to support the family. She has had a tortilla shop for 22 years. For a long time this has been her source of income and support. It was with the help of her husband that she started selling tortillas. Her house is very modest, and the roof is in very bad shape. That is why she is requesting a loan to buy construction material. This will allow her to repair and change the zinc sheets. This investment is urgent due to the winter season, which has begun. This is when it rains and the water leaks. It threatens the health of those that live with her. It also could destroy the furniture in the house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair the roof of her house

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is married with one small son. She sells women's clothing at the central market in Stryi and her average profit is 5,000 UAH per month.

Mariya has been in this business for nine years and has her kiosk in a very good place at the market. She sets affordable prices and provides very good client service. This brings many repeat clients to her business and helps her to make enough money for her family needs.

Mariya would like to borrow 12,000 UAH to increase her inventory. She hopes to make additional profits and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To increase her assortment

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette is 25 years old, married with one child who is one year old.  Jeanette makes a living by selling a variety of goods in her shop and this is her 11th successful year in this business.  Jeanette's shop is open from 6 am until 7 pm every day.

After realizing that her capital is still too low to expand meaningfully, Jeanette is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, Jeanette will hopefully earn more profits through the sale of foodstuffs as well as drinks, which in turn will allow her to keep reinvesting and saving for better financial stability.

loans.use: a variety of goods including foodstuffs and drinks

loans.name: Bat-Erdene

texts.en: Bat-Erdene D., 40 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Arhangai province, central Mongolia, in an apartment. His son attends a local high school, his elder daughter is a student and his wife works a a teacher in their town. Bat-Erdene manages a grocery business selling food he grows on a field that he owns. He started his business in 2005 and has since found success and built a stable business operation. He attributes his success to his good customer relationships and communication skills. Today, his working capital exceeds 3,000,000 MNT. Bat-Erdene is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more seed to plant on 10 hectares of land.

loans.use: To purchase more seed

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase a new carpet frame and materials

loans.name: Elizabethe De Los Angeles

texts.es: La señora Elizabethe De Los Ángeles, Carazo, tiene 23 años de edad, es casada y tiene 1 hijo, de 3 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja en Provinsa, como guarda de seguridad. Ella se dedica a la venta y distribución de ropa de manera ambulante. También viaja a Granada y a Masaya a vender, sus compras las realiza en el mercado Oriental de Managua.  Ella dio inicio con este negocio desde hace 4 años, ante la gran necesidad que tenia ya que había quedado embarazada y necesitaba empezar a pensar en su futuro. Ella por supuesto, desea seguir continuando con su negocio. El crédito será invertido en la compra de de ropa y quiere invertir un poco en la compra de calzado, para tener mayor variedad de productos a vender. Su sueño siempre ha sido llegar a tener una casa propia, ya que actualmente está viviendo en la casa de sus suegros. Ella piensa, con las ganancias del negocio algún día comprar un terreno para construir su propia casita.
texts.en:
Sra. Elizabethe De Los Ángeles lives in Carazo. She is 23 years old, married, and has a three year old child. Her husband works in Provinsa as a security guard. Elizabethe sells and distributes clothing as a street merchant. She also travels to Granada and Masaya to sell her products, as well as generating sales at the Eastern Market of Managua. Elizabethe started this business four years ago out of necessity because she was pregnant and needed to start thinking about her future. She wants to continue her business so that she can get ahead.

She wants to invest this loan in the purchase of clothing and use a small amount to buy shoes so that she will have a wider variety of products to sell. Her dream has always been to have her own house since she currently lives at the home of her in-laws. Using the earnings from her business, Elizabethe believes that someday she will be able to buy land on which she can build a small house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing & shoes

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa Adelaida Anguisaca es socia del banco comunal San Miguel, vive en la comunidad de San Miguel que es perteneciente a la parroquia del Valle,  su gente se dedica  a la agricultura y cría de animales, la mayor parte de su población joven sale a la ciudad a laborar en diferentes oficios y muchos han migrado en busca de trabajo para ofrecerles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.

Doña Rosa es socia de la banca comunal hace 13 años y con los créditos ha podido terminar su casa. Ella trabaja de empleada domestica 4 días a la semana y labora muchos años en esta actividad, para tener otro ingreso económico también se dedica a la cría de chanchos.

La Señora Rosa tiene 34 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 21, 18, 14y 11 años de edad, su primera hija es madre soltera y vive en su casa junto a su nieto de dos meses de edad, su segundo hijo trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, sus dos últimos hijos estudian en el colegio y en la escuela, su esposo es de profesión albañil y con el trabajo y sacrificio conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.
 
Su nuevo crédito lo va invertir a en la compra de mas chanchos.

Su meta es terminar algunos acabados en su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Adelaida Anguisaca is a member of the San Miguel communal bank, and she lives in San Miguel, part of the Valle parish. People there work in farming and raise animals. Most of the youth go to the city to work in various trades, and many have migrated to look for work and provide a better future for their children. Rosa has been a member of the communal bank for 13 years, and has used loans to finish her house. She has worked for many years as a housekeeper, 4 days a week. In order to have another source of income, she also raises pigs. Rosa is 34 years old, married, and has 4 children (21, 18, 14, and 11 years old). Her oldest daughter is a single mother and lives in her house along with her 2-month-old grandson. The second child works and helps her financially. The other two children are in school. Her husband is a bricklayer, and by hard work and sacrifices, they have been able to build their own house. This new loan will be used to buy pigs. Their goal is to finish some improvements to their home.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora L. is from the village of Barangay 4, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 64 years old. Leonora is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Leonora owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing "tri-sikad" (transport) services to local community members with her husband as the driver. Leonora has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Leonora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonora is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Leonora from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Romela

texts.en:
Romela A. is 50 years old, married and has two children. She is from the town of Banga in South Cotabato province on the Mindanao islands. Romela has been planting and harvesting rice for more than twenty years. She says their farm helps her family a lot.

Romela and her husband also bought two motorcycles that are being used to transport people around their community. They hired two relatives as drivers, and the income from the motorcycles helps in taking care of their daily needs.

Romela joined CEVI to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Romela is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used for farm supplies and motorcycle maintenance. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: For farm supplies and motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: María Rosa

texts.es:
La Señora María G. es socia del banco comunal Damas del Futuro, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por su belleza arquitectónica, sus bellos paisajes y su naturaleza, es la tercera ciudad  más importante del país.
 
Doña María tiene 57 años, es viuda hace 10 años, tiene 7 hijos que son mayores de edad, sus cinco hijos están casados y viven independientes, sus dos hijos solteros trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, con su trabajo y esfuerzo ha logrado construir su casa propia.
 
La Señora. María es comerciante, vende todo tipo de ropa, actividad que lo realiza hace muchos años, ella vende recorriendo el campo, labora todos los días menos los días miércoles.
 
Se encuentra en su octavo ciclo, en este tiempo ha llegado a tener una gran amistad con todas las socias de la banca comunal, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más ropa para surtir su mercadería.
 
Su meta es comprarse un vehículo.
texts.en:
Mrs. María G. is a member of the Damas del Futuro Communal Bank, she lives in Cuenca city, this city is known for its architectural beauty, its beautiful landscapes and flora and fauna, and it is the third most important city of the country.

Mrs. María is 57 years old, she has been a widow for 10 years, she has 7 children who are grown up, five of them are married and live independently, the other two are single, work and help María economically. Through hard work, María was able to build her own home.

Mrs. María is a merchant and sells all types of clothing, a job that she has done for many years, she sells her items by going to the countryside, she works everyday except Wednesdays.

This will be María’s eight loan, and she has been able to have great friendships will the other members of the communal bank. María’s new loan will be used to buy more clothing to stock her shop.

María’s goal is to buy a car.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine E. is from the village of Kinura, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 34 years old.  Josephine is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a bakeshop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from baking & selling a variety of bread like monay bread and loaf bread for the local community.  Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Josephine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital.  Josephine is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional cooking ingredients and working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Josephine from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 


About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines.  It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baking ingredients and working capital

loans.name: Gracelyn

texts.en:
Desiree Militante is engaged in buying and selling of coconuts. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income is come from selling of copra and charcoal. She has been operating her business for one year and earns a monthly net income of 2,300 PHP. Desiree is 26 years old, married with one infant. She is from the village of Unidos, Calamba.

In 2008, Desiree joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Desiree has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Desiree is requesting her 6th loan with the amount of 25,000 PHP which will be used for house renovation.  

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For house renovation

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un padre de familia dde 40 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el sector Laguna Grande, una zona agrícola del distrito de Santa Rosa, el cual de encuentra ubicado a más de 25 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de diez años a trabajar en la crianza y venta de animales, el cuenta con algunas vacas de las cuales comercializa a diario la leche que producen entre los vecinos de la zona, también cuenta con cerdos y aves de corral las cuales comercializa entre los negociantes de la zona. Paralelamente se dedica a la venta de chatarra. Con estos negocios el se encarga de sacar adelante a su familia y de solventar su economía diaria.

Manuel desea adquirir alimento balanceado para mejorar la producción de sus animales y percibir mayores ganancias, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1800 nuevos soles.

El es un padre que siempre vela por el bienestar y desarrollo de su familia. Su mayor anhelo es verlos progresar y gozar de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Manuel is a 40 year old father who lives with his wife and children in the Laguna Grande area, a farming area in the Santa Rosa district, which is located more than 25 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

For more than 10 years he has worked as an animal breeder and seller. He has cows which he uses as part of a dairy business, selling the milk they produce to his area neighbours. He also has pigs and free-range birds which he markets among local businesses. At the same time he sells scrap metal. With these businesses he is in charge of providing for his family and settling his dairy business.

Manuel wishes to buy well-balanced feed to improve his animal products and to receive greater profits, so he thought it wise to apply for a loan of 1800 Nuevos Soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

He is a father who always looks out for his family's well being and development. His greatest desire is to see them progress and enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: To acquire well-balanced feed to improve his animal products and to receive greater profits.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
Doña Domitila, reside en San Miguel, departamento de San Miguel, donde vive con su hermana y la hija de su hermana, doña Domitila tiene 63 años de edad y administra una tienda que lleva 30 años de existir donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad y su ventaja es el no poseer competencia en el lugar.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de productos para la tienda, como jabón, aceite, frijoles, arroz entre otros que son de mayor duración, este préstamo le ayudara a comprar estos productos antes mencionados y le ayudara también a ella a contar con mejores ventas.
Su objetivo es mantener el negocio, surtirlo y ofrecer lo mejor a los clientes, para recibir ingresos que le ayuden a cubrir sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Doña Domitila lives in San Miguel, in the department of the same name, with her sister and niece. She is 63 years old and has run a store for 30 years selling basic necessities. One advantage she has is that there is no competition in the area.

Domitila is seeking a loan to buy more goods for the store such as soap, oil, beans and rice, items that last a long time. This loan will help her obtain these products and lead to more sales. Her goal is to continue with the store, stock it well, and offer the best to her customers. That way she will earn enough money to cover her needs.

loans.use: to buy soap, oil, beans, rice.

loans.name: Efren's Group

texts.en:
Efren T. Sr. is from the village of Barangcuag, Angadanan, Isabela. He is 57 years old. Efren is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Efren is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Efren operates a furniture making business, producing and selling cabinets and wardrobes  to local businesses and community members. Efren has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Efren joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Efren has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory. Efren is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional inventory. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Efren from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory for making furniture

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan O. is the mother of two daughters and four sons. Hanan's son, who is studying in the university and who helps his mother in the store, appears in the picture here, as she is a religious woman like most of Gaza Strip’s citizens.

Hanan and her husband and children, who are students, live in Rafah in Gaza Strip. Her husband owns a grocery shop. The store is the only source of income for the family; therefore, Hanan and her husband want to improve it and sell a larger variety of goods to attract more customers. That is why she is requesting a loan from FATEN.

loans.use: To purchase a large variety of goods for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more electrical goods.

loans.name: Rudy Santiago

texts.es: El  Sr Pueto  labora como fontanero es casado tiene  tres persona a su cargo, es el primer crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga, agradece el apoyo que  brinda esta institución con  este  desembolso para realizar  compra de  materiales  de construcción bloque, cemento, arena, hierro, piedrín, estribo, alambre y pago de mano de obra para hacer un cuarto en su vivienda.
texts.en: Mr. Pueto works as a plumber.  He is married and has three people he is in charge of.  This is his first loan with CEPRODEL and he is grateful for the support provided him by this institution -- the disbursement that will help him purchase construction materials like blocks, cement, sand, iron, gravel, bracket, wire, and labor to build a new room for his home.

loans.use: Home improvement and purchase of construction materials.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 34 years old, married, and is a father of three children.  To earn a living, he makes and sells shoes.  In addition, he runs a kiosk for extra income.   He has been running the business for five years.  He hopes to open a shop to sell shoes mainly for school-going children.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, John has managed to increase his monthly income.  He dreams of making shoes in large numbers in five years.  He has requested a loan for 40,000 Kes to buy shoes.

loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: Dario Andres

texts.es:
Dario Andres L. M. tiene 22 años, es soltero vive los padres en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. No tiene hijo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JOSE DE LOS AMARILLOS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Amarillos, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Dario se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial Murillo y los vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es  tener un negocio propio.

Le gusta jugar indor.
texts.en:
Darío Andrés León M., 22, is single living with his parents in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  He has no children.

The members of the “SAN JOSE DE LOS AMARILLOS” communal bank are located in Amarillos which belongs to Ventanas Canton.  They are short cycle corn and rice farmers.

Darío farms corn and rice.  He buys his products in Comercial Murillo and sells them there as well.

He is asking for a loan to plant corn and rice, to buy farming supplies and fertilizer for the crops.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  The challenges he faces are infestations, illnesses and climactic variations.

His dream is to have a business of his own; he enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and fertilizer for the crops.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita was born in 1972 in Cotonou, Benin's largest city. She now lives in the Sémé-Podji district with her husband Eugène and their six children. All of their children are schooled.

For the past 10 years Anita has sold beauty products from her stall in the Abattoir district. This is her sixth loan with ALIDE following successful past repayments and will allow her to purchase stock in bulk from Tokpa, Benin's largest market. Her aim is to strengthen her business in the short term.

loans.use: to purchase stock of beauty products

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco tiene 32 años de edad, es soltero y con su familia en el distrito de Saqa, un distrito conocido a nivel regional por sus tradiciones. Se encuentra ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo

Se dedica a la crianza de ganado. El cría sus animales en un terreno situado cerca a la zona en donde vive y se vale de el para agenciarse de ingresos diarios con los cuales sustenta la economía de su familia.

Marco desea adquirir alimento balanceado para mejorar la producción de sus animales y percibir mayores ganancias, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Con los ingresos que perciba de esta actividad el espera aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, el es una persona tranquila, responsable y emprendedora.
texts.en:
Marco is 32 years old, single, and lives with his family in the district of Saqa.  Saqa is a regional district renowned for its traditions and is located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Marco raises livestock.  He breeds the animals in an area located near where he lives and he uses his daily earnings to support his family.  Marco wants to buy nutritious food to improve the health and breeding of his animals, thus increasing his profits.  He is requesting a loan of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

With the funds received, he expects to increase his income and improve the quality of life for his family.  Marco is a quiet, responsible, and hardworking person.

loans.use: To buy nutritious food for his livestock.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria came to Grameen America two years ago looking for an opportunity. She loved to cook and was always being praised for her talent in the kitchen, but had no way of transforming that gift into professional success. Now, Maria runs her own business selling ice cream and other desserts out of her food truck. She used her first three Grameen America loans to get her business off the ground and acquire the necessary licensing and permit stickers. Now, she is seeking a fourth loan of 3,000 USD to stock up on ice cream and other ingredients and to renew her permit sticker so she can continue growing her business doing what she loves. Maria hopes to one day buy a food cart big enough for her to cook and serve a wide array of her favorite foods, from ice cream to tamales. Maria works incredibly hard in pursuit of her goals and has already created her own business from scratch. Now, with just a 3,000 USD loan, she will have the opportunity to continue building the future she has always dreamed of.

loans.use: to pay for ingredients and a permit sticker for her food truck

loans.name: Merlyn Del Socorro

texts.es:
Merlyn tiene su propio negocio, en su casa de habitación, una pulpería que gracias a sus padres y financiamiento con Afodenic, ha logrado salir  adelante en su economía para el apoyo de sus tres hijos. 
Son cinco años trabajando en la inversión muy dedicada desde horas temprana abre para lograr mejores ventas. Lleva  tres ciclos trabajando con préstamos que le ah ayudado al desarrollo de su negocio. En donde también ha puesto venta de cosméticos, productos farmacéuticos y productos escolares.
Hoy con este financiamiento comprara: granos básicos, productos lácteos, gaseosas, golosinas, productos de aseo personal, productos de aseo del hogar, así como frutas y verduras, ya que son productos de demanda.
texts.en:
Merlyn has a home-based business, a store that she established thanks to her parents and a loan from AFODENIC. This business has enabled her to get ahead financially so that she can support her three children.

This investment has allowed her to work the past five years with great dedication. She opens her store in the early morning hours so that she can obtain better sales. Merlyn has participated in three loan cycles and each one has helped her develop her business. In her store, she has also sold cosmetics, pharmaceutical products, and school supplies.

She will currently use this loan to buy basic grains, dairy products, sodas, candy, personal hygiene products, household cleaning products, fruits, and vegetables since these items are in demand.

loans.use: to purchase various products for her store.

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar is married with seven children: four of them work and two study in school. Her eldest daughter who is 20 years old stays at home and helps Kosar in her routine tasks. Her husband is a vegetable vendor and sells vegetables by putting them on cart and visiting different streets of the city. 

Kosar herself is a housewife and a seamstress. She sews clothes for her neighborhood clients. She is very skillful in her work. She does this business to supplement the income for her family. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to buy some fresh seasonal vegetables to sell. Kosar is hopeful that by investing loan money in her husband’s business, her husband will be able to make good profits and improve his business.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
