Maria Elena tiene 29 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos, tiene 2 hijos vive en el Recinto Agua Clara Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes.

Los miembros de la V.R.C SANTA ROSA DE AGUA CLARA, está ubicada a 20 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, esta constituida por 20 socios es el segundo crédito que solicitan a la cooperativa, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembran cacao y yuca, además se dedican al comercio.

Maria Elena se dedica a la agricultura siembra cacao y yuca en tierras propias, ademas se dedica al comercio de frutas. Las compras las realiza en Chillanes y San Pablo y las vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

El crédito le ayudará en la compra de insumos para los cultivos y comprar mas mercaderia de frutas, el crédito le apoyado de manera que han incrementado la producción de los cultivos. Ha enfrentado desafíos como enfermedades de los trabajadores y las plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es poder tener salud y vida para seguir trabajando y salir adelante.

En los tiempos libres o sea por las tardes conversar con las amigas para jugar cartas.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is 29 years old, is married and lives with her ​​husband and children.  She has 2 children, and they live in the Agua Clara precinct which is part of the Chillanes district.

V.R.C SANTA ROSA in AGUA CLARA is located 20 minutes from the office in Chillanes, it consists of 20 members.  This is the second loan requested by the cooperative.  The members of this group are dedicated to agriculture.  They plant cocoa and yucca, they are also engaged in trade.

Maria Elena's occupation is agriculture; she plants cocoa and yucca on her own land, she also works as a fruit vendor. Purchases are made ​​in Chillanes and San Pablo, and she sells at the Sunday market in Chillanes.  The loan will help in the purchase of supplies for crops and buying more fruit merchandise.  The loan will support increased production of crops.  She has faced challenges such as workers' illness, pests and crop disease.  Her dream is to have health and life so that she can continue working and move forward in life.

In her free time or in the evenings, she talks with friends and plays cards

loans.use: to purchase supplies for crops and buy more fruit merchandise.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: In the picture above, Efua has displayed some tubers of yam for sale. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a mason. Efua uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Efua will use the loan to purchase more foodstuffs for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is married and has four children. Her husband is a driver. Her schooling is up to the junior high level. In the photo above, Abena has some ceramic plates, jewelry and bowls around her. She moves from one area to another to sell them. She is also a baker. She uses her income to support her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Abena will use the loan to purchase more bowls and plates for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abena plans to reinvest back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase more bowls and plates for resale.

loans.name: Gladis Helena

texts.es:
Gladis tiene un negocio de confección de correas con su hermano, ella con su taller de confección le brinda a su hijo una buena calidad de vida, además le puede brindar la posibilidad de estudiar y salir adelante.

Ella se siente muy feliz ya que puede generar algunos empleos puesto que su negocio cada vez está mejor. Gladis se sueña con una taller mas grande y así poder tener una producción mucho mejor y generar de esta forma mas empleo. Para esto necesita iniciar con la compra de una máquina dobladora que le permitirá mejora los tiempos de producción y así incrementar sus ventas y  mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y sus empleados.
texts.en:
Gladis has a manufacturing business where she makes belts with her brother. She has a manufacturing workshop that allows her to provide her son a good quality of life, the chance to study, and the ability to get ahead.

Gladis is very happy to be able to generate a few jobs since her business is getting better. She dreams of having a larger workshop so that she can have much better production and generate more jobs. For this reason, she needs to start out by purchasing a folding machine that will improve production times and increase sales. As a result, Gladis will be able to improve her quality of life and that of her employees.

loans.use: to purchase a folding machine for manufacturing belts.

loans.name: Sari Pertiwi Group

texts.en:
The Sari Pertiwi group is made up of 17 women who are neighbors in the same village in Melaya, West Bali. The group is seeking a loan of Rp. 20,000,000, and each member will receive Rp. 1,000,000 – Rp. 1,500,000.  The group was formed out of these women’s common interest in raising pigs to supplement the family income, and out of their interest in education on best practices for pig raising. This is their third loan with MUK.

Ni Luh is the head of the Sari Pertiwi group. She is married and has three children. Two of the children are married and the last is still in school. Ni Luh would like to help support her family with her pig raising business. She will use the loan to buy four piglets and pigs feed. She plans to sell the piglets after five months for use as fattening pigs. With the increase in household income, she hopes to be able to pay school fees.

loans.use: To buy four piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 40 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Iganga region of Uganda.  He is married and has 3 children.  Two of his children are currently in school.  Simon has a small retail shop that sells sugar, which he has had for 5 years.         

To help expand his business, Simon has requested a loan of 1,600,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Simon hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, Simon hopes to expand his business.  Simon is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program (SEP), which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is an honest businesswoman, aged 25 years. She is married and blessed with two children, aged 10 and 2 years. For the last 10 years, she has been operating a retail shop to make a living. In the next five years, she wants to have another shop. Her dream is to own a wholesale business. She is requesting a loan of 20,030 Kenyan shillings to buy sweets, sodas, salt and cooking oil.

loans.use: To buy sweets, sodas, salt and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise to supply her store

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz tiene 30 años es casada y vive en Otavalo al norte de Ecuador. Luz se describe como una mujer emprendedora y felíz. En la fotografía Luz es la señora que está a la izquierda las otras dos personas son familiares que le ayudan en su pequeño negocio.

Trabaja con su familia en la elaboración de manillas a mano. Trabaja con Fodemi por 6 años el actual crédito que solicitó es para la compra de materia prima como es hilo, lana, mullos, perlas de plástico etc para incrementar su producción y de esa manera poder mejorar sus ventas y sus ingresos lo cual le ayuda para dar el estudio a sus hijos.

Su sueño es tener un local propio para su negocio y poder incrementar su producción teniendo ayudantes y poder pagarles.
texts.en:
Luz is 30 years old and is married.  She lives in Otavalo in the north of Ecuador.  Luz describes herself as an enterprising and cheerful woman,  In the photo, Luz is the woman on the left; the other two are family members who help her with her small business.  She works with her family making bracelets by hand.  

She has been working with Fodemi for six years.  The loan that she is currently requesting is for the purchase of raw materials such as thread, wool, beads, plastic beads, etc., for increasing her production and in this way improving her sales and income.  This will help her to provide her children with an education.

Her dream is to have her own premises for her business, and to be able to grow her production by having employees and being able to pay them.

loans.use: To buy raw material such as thread, wool, beads, plastic beads, etc.

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru: Фарход житель района Кубодиен. Он женат.  Ему 42 года. У него четверо детей. Его жена предоставляет услугу, занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Сам Фарход зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже год. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Farhod resides in the Qubadiyon region. He is 42 years old, married and has four children. His wife is a seamstress, she makes traditional Tajik dresses. Farhod makes a living by raising cattle and has had his heard for a year now. He would like to take out this loan to purchase more animals for his herd.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony is 40 years old and married. He is blessed with five children aged 1, 3, 5, and 8 years old. Antony provides transportation services in Muhoroni town where he transports people from one destination to another. He has been in operation for a period of four years, earning a monthly income of 16,000 Kenya shillings (KES).

He has applied for a loan of 70,000 KES from KADET LTD, which will be his second term loan after he paid the previous loan successfully. He wishes to use the money to purchase a new motorbike for his business. 

He says the profits will be used to invest in farming activities. His dream is to own a pickup truck in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 54 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Letecia has a personal products business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more personal products like body lotions, perfumes, etc. to sell.

Letecia has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Letecia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more personal products like body lotions, perfumes etc. to sell.

loans.name: Yetana B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from the Yetana B Group in Western Kenya! It is headed by Debora as its facilitator. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Debora is a mother of 5 children. She joined One Acre Fund due to the prices offered by the firm and in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds to ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Debora had an excellent maize yield harvesting 15 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Debora was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Debora and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Debora will educate her children and ensure food security and also invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Yetana B group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

She is pictured in the photograph with her group members.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Batjargal

texts.en: Batjargal is 33 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. His wife helps with his business, and his two sons are school students. He started his car parts retail business in 2001 by renting a container in a market. He started his business by selling oil. Now he sells a wide variety of car parts; however, he is lacking Korean car parts, which are the most in-demand car parts. He is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to buy Korean car parts. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says. "Now that Korean cars are increasing, parts demand is high. If I don't sell Korean parts, I might lose my business."

loans.use: To buy Korean car parts

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is 24 years old and married. She has one child.

Filomena owns and  operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro (a potato-like tuber) for sale. She has one year of experience in this business.

Filomena needs a loan of WST 1,500 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 WST or US $208 per week) to financially support the immediate members of her family.

Filomena joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Filomena's second loan with SPBD. 



*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the ""overall social metric score.""  For example, a 3 out of 3 on ""level of education"" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  "

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 53 year-old businessman.  He is married to Lucia, who is a farmer. They are blessed with three children, aged 23, 21 and 18 years, respectively. He has been running a retail shop for the past nine years, with a monthly income of KES 20,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loan successfully. Peter will use the loan to buy a stock of sugar, rice and wheat flour for his shop. 

With the anticipated profit, he will expand his business. His hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop which will improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy stock of sugar, rice and wheat flour for his shop

loans.name: Jorge Fructuoso

texts.es: El socio es el Sr. Jorge Fructuoso;  Continua con su negocio con su taller de carpintería metalica, el socio continua con sus diferentes trabjaos de carpinteria metalica como puertas, portones, escaleras, ventanas, rejas entre otros mas, el socio a estado ampliando su negocio y aún le falta inversión para comletar la ampliación, motivo por el cual en esta ocasión el socio desea el credito para invertir en la compra de materiales y en la ampliación de sus local.
texts.en: The member is one Jorge Fructuoso. He continues with his business, which is a metalworks workshop. He continues with different metalworking jobs such as doors, entryways, stairs, windows, and grilles among others. The member has been expanding his business and he still needs an investment to complete the expansion. This is his motive for seeking a loan to invest in buying materials and expanding his shop.

loans.use: to invest in materials and in the expansion of his shop.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is a 39-year-old married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She has been selling charcoal in Kator, South Sudan, for one year. Anita is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Tob's Group

texts.en:
A villager of the Sa And district, Tob is 29 years old and married. She has four children, one of whom is in school.

Tob is a rice farmer who has been farming her own farmland for eighteen years. She buys and sells fish in the village to supplement her income. She now earns 10 USD each day from her work.

This is Tob’s group’s first loan with VisionFund. She leads this group of three members in applying for a loan of 3,000,000 KHR with the lender. As the leader of the group, she wants to buy more fish to resell.

Tob hopes this loan will enable her to grow her fish-selling business and make her life better.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell.

loans.name: Khady's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé depuis août 2015 rassemble des membres qui habitent le même village et ont comme activité le commerce.

Khoudia qui se trouve à l'extrême droite de la photo,levant le bras et habillée en bleue,est la représentante du groupe,elle est âgée de 46 ans,est mariée et mére de 09 enfants dont 02 filles.

Elle tient un restaurant dans sa localité où elle vend des plats pour petit déjeuné et déjeuné.

Avec l'argent du crédit,elle compte acheter 02 sacs de riz à 13000f le sac,01 bidon d'huile à 15000f,10 kg de sucre à 500f le kg et du sel et de l’aromate pour 4000f.

Avec le bénéfice réalisé,elle compte assurer les frais scolaires de ses enfants et aussi réfectionner sa case.
texts.en:
This group, created in August 2015, unites members who live in the same village and whose business is small-scale commerce.

Khoudia, who is on the far right in the photo, raising her hand and dressed in blue, is the representative of the group. She is 46 years old, married and the mother of nine children, two of them girls. She runs a restaurant in her locality where she sells breakfast and lunch. With the loan, she intends to buy two sacks of rice at 13,000 francs per sack, one jerrycan of oil for 15,000 francs, 10 kg of sugar at 500 f per kilo and some salt and flavoring for 4,000 francs. With the profit, she intends to cover school fees for her children and also renovate and repair her little house.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, sugar, and various products such as salt and flavoring for her restaurant.

loans.name: Velichka

texts.en:
Velichka S. keeps a small grocery in one of quarters of Smolian – Ustovo. There are some other groceries in the quarter but her one is maybe the neatest and well-supplied. Her neighbours say that prices in the grocery are the lowest in the quarter.

Velichka S. graduated German language in University. Some years she worked as a German teacher in 11th classes but she was not satisfied and got quit of school. In 1997 she started her business. First she has kept a stall in the town but in 1999 she opened the grocery in Ustovo. On the stall now works her sister.

One of her biggest problems remains sales on credit. Although the dificulties she has no serious problems in collecting her debts.

Velichka will spend this 800 USD loan on buying wasing materials that she will supply in her grocery.

loans.use: Buying washing materials for the grocery

loans.name: Esinam

texts.en: Mama Esinam, as she is called by her customers, sells cooked kenkey, a local meal. She lives in a farming community where the farmers need an energy-giving meal early in the morning before going to their various farms. For this reason demand from her to cook in large quantity is high, but she has no capital. She is seeking a loan of $725 from Kiva to enable her cook in bulk.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Manjore Njeri Karau wants to buy a dairy cow and animal feeds.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria M. is a motorcycle spare part dealer. She is asking for a Kiva loan of $400 so that she can increase her inventory and improve the outlook for her future.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts for resale

loans.name: Dovi

texts.fr:
At age 47, Mrs. Dovi Y. is married and mother of ten children. Most of her children are not in school because she lacks sufficient financial means to pay school fees, etc. Illiterate parents unfortunately often do not have high expectations for their children’s education.

Farming had always been Mrs. Y.’s principal source of income but nowadays, her impoverished soil has made crop production very poor and so suddenly, she finds herself with little income and living conditions for her family become worse and worse.

Mrs. Y., aware of this situation, has opened a little business selling rice, gari (manioc flour, a Togolese staple), cooking oil, etc. This initiative has begun to improve her income to the point where she feels the need to apply for a loan of US$ 750 to expand her micro-business. The expansion of her business will allow her to send her children to school.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

A 47 ans, Madame Y. Dovi est mariée et mère de dix (10) enfants. Presque tous ses enfants ne sont pas scolarisés faute de moyens financiers. Les parents analphabètes ne nourrissent aucune ambition pour leurs progénitures.

L’agriculture est l’activité principale de cette femme mais aujourd’hui, la pauvreté des sols fait que les rendements sont devenus très mauvais. Du coup, il n’y a plus de sources de revenus et les conditions de vie sont devenues pires qu’avant.

Madame Y. Dovi, consciente de la situation, a vite monté un petit commerce de riz, gari, de l’huile et autres. Cette initiative a commercé par améliorer son revenu d’où le désir de prendre un crédit de $750 afin de renforcer son commerce. Ce qui lui permettra d’envoyer ses enfants à l’école.

loans.use: expanding her little business selling Togolese staple foods

loans.name: Victorinda

texts.es:
Victorinda is the mother of a family, and every day she strives to give the best of herself to her small children. She has practiced embroidery since her childhood, as her parents taught her this worthy trade with diligence. Today, thanks to this, she can support her family. This fills her with satisfaction because she can use her money to secure the well-being of her family. Not long ago, she formed a co-operative of embroiderers with her brother, in which they work adorning traditional suits. The embroidery and preparation of a suit takes her one to two months depending on the complexity of the work. She always makes a suit according to the preferences of the client. She now plans to keep working even more and plans to raise animals to be able to provide for the needs of her home when there is scarce demand for her suits. This is why she is requesting a loan of $200, which she will invest in the purchase of fabric and thread to continue creating her beautiful hand-made adornments for the benefit of her children. Let's help these marvelous hands that create a promising future every day.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer.

Victorinda es una madre de familia que cada día se esfuerza por dar lo mejor de sí a sus pequeños hijos.Se dedica al bordado desde su niñez ya que sus padres le enseñaron con diligencia este digno oficio y hoy gracias a ello puede sostener a su familia.Esto la llena de satisfacción porque puede disponer de su dinero para procurarle bienestar a su familia y junto a su hermano hace poco han formado una sociedad de bordadores en la cual se desempeñan adornando trajes típicos. El bordado y acondicionamiento de un traje le toma de uno a dos meses dependiendo de la complejidad de sus trabajos, siempre lo hace al gusto del cliente y ahora piensa seguir trabajando más ya también piensa dedicarse a la crianza de animales para poder atender en tiempos de escaso trabajo las necesidades de su hogar, es por ello que solicita un préstamo de 200 dólares los cuales invertirá en la compra de tela e hilos para seguir realizando sus bellos adornos manuales en beneficio de sus pequeños.Apoyemos a estas manos maravillosas que cada día forjan un futuro prometedor.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric and thread.

loans.name: Tepalua

texts.en: Tepalua is a married mother with 6 children.  Her husband is a taxi driver and his weekly income is not sufficient to support the whole family.  Tepalua has been selling her handicrafts to shops around town, but she wasn’t making enough money, especially with the cost of transportation from her village to town.  With her first loan, she was able to open her own handicrafts shop.  This is Tepalua's second loan and her business is progressing well.  She is planning to open a flea market stall where she could sell more handicrafts and other varieties of Samoan products.

loans.use: To buy supplies and materials for her handicrafts business

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị T., 23 years of age, has been running her clothing store for 5 years. It is her family’s traditional business. Her husband, Nguyễn Văn Minh, lends her a hand in taking care of the store. Clothing sales are currently booming and profitable. After all expenses, the yearly income is about 3000USD. She often said: “This business of my family always relies on loans.” That’s the reason of her joining TYM Fund. In 5 years, her loans has totaled to 2000USD. This time Mrs. T. is applying for a loan of 950USD for purchasing more goods to get ready for this year’s Tết.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị T., 23 tuổi, mở cửa hàng kinh doanh quần áo cách đây được 5 năm, đây là một nghề chính của gia đình chị. Chồng chị, anh Nguyễn Văn Minh là người thường xuyên hỗ trợ chị trong việc kinh doanh. Nghề kinh doanh hàng quần áo của chị T. hiện nay rất phát triển, sau khi trừ chi phí, thu nhập một năm của gia đình chị khoảng 3000USD. Chị thường xuyên tâm sự, với nghề này thì gia đình tôi lúc nào cũng cần đến nguồn vốn vay. Do vậy chị đã tham gia vào quỹ TYM đã được 5 năm và đã vay tổng số vốn của Quỹ là 2000USD. Hiện nay chị đang đề nghị Quỹ cho chị vay mức vốn 950USD để mua thêm hàng về bán vào dịp Tết âm lịch.

loans.use: Buy clothes

loans.name: Pop

texts.en: Mrs. Pop O. is a mother of four children and lives with her husband in a part of Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia. To supplement her household, she cooks various kinds of Khmer food and sells them to the people in her area, making on average around $2.50 each day of profit. Her husband therefore works as a construction foreman making typically around $5 each day of profit. One of her children works with her selling rice and food; another one works with her husband as a construction foreman; and the rest are enrolled in school. Furthermore, Mrs. Pop O. hopes to use this loan to expand her store, and the remainder of the money is to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To expand her store and to reinvest her business.

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hoàng Thị Giới, 38 years old, lives with her husband and two school age children in Mê Linh, Vĩnh Phúc. When the agricultural expansion plan introduced to all provinces, Mrs. Giới has soon realized that that was a very rare opportunity. While other families might use their monies to build houses, she wisely used her money to invest in her farm. The investment brings her a handsome income. Currently she has a nice half acre farm which produces vegetable for the Hanoi’s markets. The product impresses the Office of Agricultural Encouragement of the Department of Agriculture and the office endorses it as an agricultural model for the province. Recently she invested 1,500USD to purchase 500 grapefruit trees for her current project. This time she is applying for a loan of 950USD to purchase more fruit trees and fertilizer.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Hoàng Thị Giới, 38 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 2 con đang trong độ tuổi đi học tại Mê Linh, Vĩnh Phúc. Khi việc xây khu công nghiệp phát triển tại các tỉnh, chị Giới đã sớm nắm bắt được điều kiện và cơ hội của gia đình mà không phải ai cũng có thể làm được. Trong khi nhiều gia đình đã dùng tiền đền bù xây dựng nhà cửa, mua sắm tiện nghi, thì chị Giới và chồng đã dùng đồng tiền đó vào việc cải tạo ruộng đất, dồn điền đổi thửa thành khu tập trung trồng trọt các loại rau sạch cung cấp cho thị trường. Số tiền đầu tư vào dự án cũng khá lớn và đang cho thu nhập cao. Hiện tại chị Giới có 7 sào vườn trồng các loại rau cung cấp cho thị trường Hà Nội và các vùng khác. Sản phẩm của gia đình chị được Phòng khuyến nông, sở nông nghiệp chọn làm dự án điển hình và nhân rộng ra toàn tỉnh. Mới đây chị Giới còn đầu tư 1500USD đầu tư mua 500 cây bưởi Diễn trồng quy hoạch theo mô hình trang trại, dự kiến sau vài ba năm sau sẽ cho thu nhập. Dự án lớn, dám nghĩ, dám làm và rất năng động đó là cảm nhận của người viết bài khi đến thăm mô hình của chị. Tương lai còn đang ở phía trước vẫn còn không ít những khó khăn, vất vả nhưng chị Giới luôn tin tưởng vào sự thành công của dự án. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 950USD mua cây giống và phân bón.

loans.use: Buy fruit trees and fertilizer

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga's chronic ailment drove her to experiment with natural alternative medicine to appease her pain, as well as the consequences of her past malady. The Omnilife products were recommended to her, and she was under this treatment for a long time. After some time her pain and fatigue dissipated. This result is the reason why she decided to sell this and similar products. She recounts her story to millions of suffering and hopeless people. She is now the most popular salesperson of this product because of her testimony. She has decided to install a small product display space in her home. With your important contribution, she will succeed in that which she set out to accomplish.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace mucho el padecimiento de Olga la condujo a probar con la medicina natural, alternativa para aplacar dolores y demás consecuencias de la enfermedad que tenía, le recomendaron los productos de Omnilife y estuvo bajo tratamiento por un largo período, al cabo de este sus dolencias y fatigas se fueron, y a razón de este hecho decidió incursionar en la venta de los mismos para contar su historia a miles de personas que padecen como ella y creen que todo está perdido; se ha convertido en una de las vendedoras más populares de este producto por su testimonio y ha decidido instalar un pequeño centro de asesoramiento en su domicilio, con vuestra importante ayuda alcnzará lo que se ha propuesto.

loans.use: To install a small product display space in her home

loans.name: Maria Salicia

texts.es:
The Lady Maria Salicia M. Campo belongs to the " Ayaymaman" Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martin Region, province of Moyabamba, district of Moyabamba. She developed her business in a stall of the Supply Market of this City where the household members shop daily, both inhabitants of her own locality and visitors from nearby places

Because of the separation from her husband, she has had the courage to proceed alone and to go forward with her children, a beginning that was very difficult. She decided to sell food on foot and, thanks to the support of the communal bank to which she belongs, she was able to install her business in a stall in the Ayaymaman market, thus offering better attention to her clients.

With the loan of 800 soles, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy the necessary accessories for the arrangement of her stall with majolicas (brightly glazed earthenware) and she will buy the supplies for food preparation such as rice, sugar, stew in kilograms, vegetables of all varieties per kilogram, beef, chicken, pork and fish also in kilograms. That will permit her to prepare various foods for the attention of her clients.

Maria is a happy and enthusiastic woman of 54 years. She wants to forge a better future and a tranquil old age when she longs to have a business in her own house.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Maria Salicia M. Campo , pertenece al Banco Comunal ”Ayaymaman”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de Moyabamba y distrito de Moyabamba , desarrolla su negocio en un puesto de ventas del Mercado de Abasto de esta Ciudad a donde diariamente acuden su comensales, que son moradores de la propia localidad o visitante de lugares cercanos

A raíz de la separación de su esposo tuvo la valentía de afrontar sola y sacar adelante a sus hijos, en un inicio le fue muy difícil, decidiendo vender comida en forma ambulatoria y gracias al apoyo del banco comunal a la que pertenece se pudo instalar en el mercado Ayaymaman brindado así una buena atención a sus clientes .

Con el crédito de S/ 800.00, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará los accesorios necesarios para el arreglo de su puesto de venta con mayólicas y comprará los insumos para la preparación de los alimentos como: arroz, azúcar, menestras en kilos, verduras en todas sus variedades por kilos, carnes de res, pollo, cerdo y pescado también en kilos, que le permitirá preparar comida variada atención a sus clientes.

Maria es una mujer entusiasta y alegre con sus 54 años, quiere forjarse un futuro mejor y una vejez tranquila por lo que anhela tener un negocio en su propia casa .

loans.use: To buy the necessary accessories for the arrangement of her stall with majolicas (brightly glazed earthenware) and to buy supplies for food preparation in larger quantities such as rice, sugar, stew, vegetables of all varieties, beef, chicken, pork and fish.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 33 year-old Ruth M.. She is married, and has one child, aged 3. In 2002, Ruth opened her salon and soft drinks business. Ruth has applied for a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of hair care products and soft drinks in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

Hair, hair and more hair! This is the place where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, blue hair, and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or plaited, and made to look like your own.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of haircare products and soft drinks in bulk

loans.name: Barno

texts.en: B. Barno is 45 years old. She is married and the loving mother of one. Having only one son she is doing all she can to make him well-educated and happy. Barno is a market vendor. She sells underwear for women and girls in the local market. She travels to the neighboring city to buy goods, with the help of her son. Generally, the business is stable with a strong possibility to grow. After loans provided by the International Micro-Loan Fund IMON she managed to accelerate the process of development of her business considerably.  With one of the loans, for example, Barno was able to rent one more trading place in the market. Now she plans to increase the working capital to expand her business. She requests $600 US Dollars for the term of 12 months. Barno promises to mange the current loan with accuracy as she did all the previous ones and thanks everyone supporting her.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a variety of goods to operate her small hair salon.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady P. est mariée et mère de 06 enfants avec 01 autre dont elle a la charge. Elle veut renforcer son commerce de fruits saisonnier locaux. Activité qu’elle a déjà menée et dont elle a une bonne expérience. En ce moment, elle a investit son prêt dans la vente  en gros de pastèques et de mangues. Cette activité lui permettra d’assurer à ses enfants une bonne condition de vie, de santé et de scolarisation. <b>Elle va rembourser en une seule échéance au bout de six mois <b/>.
texts.en:
Khady P. is married and the mother of 6 children with one other for whom she is responsible. She would like to bolster her business selling seasonal local fruit. She has already been in this business and has a good deal of experience in the field. At this point in time, she wants to invest her loan in selling watermelons and mangoes wholesale. This business will permit her to ensure good living conditions, health and education for her children. She is going to reimburse the loan in one single repayment at the end of 6 months.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and re-sale of local fruit

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is 50 years old and married with one child, who is 18. She has been a bites seller since 2006. She works every day from 6 am to 6 pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

In the past, Mwanajuma has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Mwanajuma is now looking for a loan to expand her business by increasing her current stock.

loans.use: To expand her business by increasing her current stock.

loans.name: Yehya

texts.en: Yehya is a 48 year old man and he lives in Beirut with his wife and five children. Yehya owns a taxi and works 16 hours every day in order to support his family. His taxi is suffering from severA. major mechanicA. problems and so he has asked for a loan of $1200 in order to perform maintenance on his vehicle. This is the second time that Yehya has requested a loan from A. Majmoua. His previous loan was repaid in full and on time.

loans.use: Yehya would like to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Ban

texts.en:
Ban S., 31, is married and lives with four young children in the Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer, growing rice, and typically makes US$3 each day, while her husband is a fisherman and soldier. On average, he makes US$2 a day. Two of their children are students and the two others are too young to attend school.

The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Ban S. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$300 to purchase fertilizer for their farm, a purchase that she believes can bring an increase to her daily income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for their farm.

loans.name: Chausiku D.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 44-year-old Chausiku M. from Kyela. She is married with four children, between the ages of 10 and 28. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting 2 dependants who are orphans. Chausiku has been running a local restaurant, 'Mama Lishe', since 1996.

When you see a SELFINA entrepreneur whose business title is 'restaurant' or 'café', you may have to adjust your mental image of what that is. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches, with the sky as a ceiling. Such places don’t even appear in the Lonely Planet’s budget guide, but if you’re looking for a cheap and tasty meal, and someone to have a chat with, this is the place to be. The food is all-local: rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savoury banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of yummy sauces.

She works at the business for 9-21 hours per day, 7 days per week. Chausiku currently earns about $170 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $250 USD in order to purchase additional stock of maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil. In the future, she plans to establish another business and to employ more workers. Chausiku thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys N. is married, has 5 dependants, and received schooling through junior high. Her husband is a customs officer.

Gladys sells fabric and clothing at Elmina, which she has done since 2003. Gladys is seeking a loan to purchase additional fabrics and clothes to sell to her customers. With the expected profits from her expanded business, Gladys hopes to add to her and her husband's savings in order to someday acquire a piece of land where they can build a house for their family.

loans.use: To expand her business by increasing her inventory of fabrics and clothing

loans.name: Norma Gladys

texts.es:
NORMA GLADYS P. R., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Guerreras” ubicado en la Calle Salaverry N° 140, frente al Parque Otorongo en la ciudad de Pucallpa del Distrito de Callería, tiene 48 años de edad, con 01 hijo, madre soltera, socia 09 años en Manuela Ramos.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, sandalias, bandejas, vestidos, polos todo lo que sus clientes del mercado le pedían, cobraba del diario. Gracias a sus ahorros y préstamos compró un motokar, el cual le robaron, volvió a comprar otro motokar el cual le ayuda a realizas sus cobranzas.

Con este préstamo que recibió fue de S/.3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprara repuestos para arreglar su motokar como tapizar los asientos, volver a pintarlo, la señora Norma vende productos de belleza, por catálogo, adquirió muchos clientes.

Está muy agradecida de Manuela Ramos, por entenderla y apoyarla en los momentos que más necesitaba.
texts.en:
Norma Gladys P. R., 48, is a member of the Communal Bank "The Warriors", located in the Calleria district. Norma is the single mother of one son, and has worked with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for 9 years. The first loan that she received (300 soles) was used to purchase sandals, dresses, t-shirts that her customers ordered. Later, she bought a motocar with her savings and other loans. This motocar was stolen, and she bought yet another, to be able to drive around collecting payments from her customers. This loan of 3,000 soles is to repair and maintain her motocar. Norma sells beauty products by catalog, and has a large number of customers to visit. Norma is thankful to Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for providing help and support when she most needed them.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and maintain motocar used in beauty product sales

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
S. is a widow, age 45. She and her 4 children live in Siem Reap province. She earns a living by raising and selling pigs. The pigs are raised in a stall next to her house. As another source of income, she grows vegetables on farmland that she owns.

Three of S.'s children are employed and their contributions help feed the family. Two children are construction workers, and the other one sells firewood. Sreiheand recently sold all her pigs to the slaughterer. She plans to use the loan to buy another pig and a cow to raise.

loans.use: Buy piglets and a cow to raise

loans.name: Juraboy

texts.en:
Juraboy E. applied first to the MicroInvest program in 2007 and since that time he has applied to MicroInvest for other business development loans. Juraboy has been engaged in livestock for 40 years and has cows and 5 rams. He recommends himself as the executive and a reliable client.

Today Juraboy is applying to Kiva for a business support loan of $725 (2,700 TJS) for 8 months to buy a pedigree bull. He thanks Kiva for its support and wishes all the best.

loans.use: to buy a pedigree bull

loans.name: Nguen Thi

texts.en:
Nguen Thi H. is forty-eight years old and started with the Kiva partner, TYM, in 1999. She and her husband have three children who are twenty-one, twenty-four and twenty-six years old and are all grown up. 
Because of TYM’s workshops, where people learn what to raise and grow, Mrs. H. decided to raise chickens and pigs.  She also grows rice. For this she needed a first loan of $85, which she got from TYM. 
Because of her success at running her business, she has a monthly income of $112.  Unfortunately, that isn’t enough to live on, so she is reliant on the financial help of her children. With the next loan through Kiva, which is $575, she hopes to stop this economic dependence on her children by improving her raising possibilities (built a bigger cote) and by buying animal feed.

loans.use: Improving of raising possibilities

loans.name: Akwasi

texts.en:
Akwasi A. is a thirty-five year old married man and the father of four children, three of whom are boys. He says all of them are still in the primary school. His wife trades in textile materials. Akwasi lives with the wife and children in a rented apartment in a town called Achiase. Achiase is a farming and busy trading community in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Akwasi has a sand winning business. What he does is he acquires a piece of land and hires workers to dig for the sand which he then sells to building contractors in tipper trucks. Akwasi says that after winning the sand, the land returns to the owner from whom he acquired it.

Akwasi has been in business for six years. He is hopeful to give his children the best possible education.

loans.use: To acquire a piece of land for sand winning

loans.name: Fightness

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 33 year old Fightness B. from Mwanza. She is single with two children, between the ages of 4 and 12 years old. Fightness has been running a clothing business since 2008. She works at the business for 8 hours per day, 6 days per week. Fightness currently earns about 150USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 500USD in order to purchase more kanga (clothes) and to increase her capital. In the future, she plans to add more clothes. Fightness thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and to increase her capital.

loans.name: Saifiniso

texts.en:
E. Saifiniso is 52 years old and comes from a large and humble family. She is a widow and the loving mother of two children. Her father's hard and demanding character showed her, from the time she was young, the significant value of work, and therefore she has been successful in various activities throughout her life. Now she dedicates herself to raising and selling cows. With the income she generates she provides a better quality of life for her children, who are her greatest joy and have become her best friends. Saifiniso asks for a loan of $700 USD in order to buy more young cattle to later sell when they are fully grown. With this investment Saifiniso will be able to substantially grow her earnings and improve her quality of life. Let’s support this dedicated mother's proposal.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase small cattle to sell

loans.name: Chan Mali

texts.en: L. Chan MaL. is a 28-year-old widow. She has a fruit stand at the market, which is well-located and therefore good for business. L. Chan MaL. lives with her young child and hopes that her only child will be able to finish high school and study at a good university. To generate more income and save for the family’s future, she has decided to take a loan of $1000 USD from Kiva partner, CREDIT, in order to expand her inventory in the fruit business.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Prok

texts.en:
Prok P. is 41 years old and resides in the rural area of Kompong Cham Province. She and her husband are currently local cultivators who grow all kind of crops. This family has been blessed with six children, three of whom are sewing staff in the garment industry.

Prok P. has been depending on the farming business only, so her family’s income is not stable. Because of this bad condition, she would like a loan to use as capital for her husband to start a service repairing vehicles in front of their home. She plans to use the rest of the loan to buy more fertilizers to fatten her crop yield.

loans.use: To start a vehicle repair service and buy fertilizer

loans.name: Bavuudorj

texts.en:
Bavuudorj C. is a 38-year-old married man who has three children ranging in age from 9 to 13. His family lives in a ger district, on a plot of land he owns in Arhangay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. In 2003, his family moved from Hangay, a small administration center, to a central province looking for a better life. As soon as he moved in, he started his own small business selling food products together with his spouse, Gerelt-Od, age 34. Bavuudorj has a secondhand Japanese vehicle. He usually purchases food products from the local central market at wholesale prices, then drives to the countryside to visit local herders and sell his products door-to-door. When he began his retail business, he purchased items for 1 million tugrugs ($1 USD = 1450 MNT). Now his working capital has increased to 2 million tugrugs. In 2007, he bought a plot of land in a central province with his profit. With future profits, he plans to build a house for his household needs. Bavuudorj is a very quiet and hardworking person. His wish is to expand his business as soon as possible, since it is the only source of his family's income. Bavuudorj requests a loan to purchase food products for his business.

About XacBank: Founded in 1998, XacBank is a community development bank and microfinance institution in Mongolia, headquartered in Ulaanbaatar. It currently serves approximately 16,000 clients from 76 branches in all 21 aymags (provinces) in Mongolia, making it the largest microfinance institution in the country.

XacBank's mission is to contribute to sustainable development of Mongolia that can only come from educated and skilled people and competitive and dynamic businesses concerned equally about planet, people, and profit. The bank provides equitable access to transparent, reliable and responsive banking products and services to the bank’s clients, including its traditional micro-entrepreneurs as well as small and medium businesses.

Your loan enables XacBank to expand its microloan capacity and return a portion of the interest back to the borrower at the end of the loan term.

To learn more, please visit the XacBank website at: www.xacbank.mn.

loans.use: To purchase food products

loans.name: Mariarosa

texts.en:
Mariarosa A. is a 45-year-old woman living in the town of Mulifanua Fou 3.  She is married and has six school-aged children.  To make a living, Mariarosa owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting fruit and vegetables for sale.  Mariarosa has been engaged in this business for more than 3 years and earns approximately 250 WST a month from these activities.

In 2007, Mariarosa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Mariarosa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1250 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  Mariarosa is now requesting a new loan of 1600 WST, which will be used to rent land to raise additional crops.  The loan will be the third loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Mariarosa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To rent land to raise additional crops

loans.name: Elisa Domingos

texts.pt:
Elisa S. nasceu na província de Gaza, no distrito de Chibuto, de 35 anos de idade, casada e mãe de dois filhos com idades compreendidas entre 2 e 6 anos e o primeiro filho freqüenta escola na vila de boane. Concluiu 12 classe.
Alem dos filhos, sustenta 1 sobrinho que vive com ela na casa do serviço na vila de Boane.

Cresceu na companhia dos seus progenitores e m chibuto e mudou juntamente com os pais para o distrito de Boane no ano de 1983.
Trabalha na Escola primaria de Boane como assistente técnico há mais de 10 anos e recebe 2.400,00MT mensais que aplica no sustento da família e pagamento de uma empregada domestica. Teve formação técnica em matérias de administração de escolas.

Teve empréstimos com outros Bancos (Associação de credito de Gueguegue, que opera na vila de boane) tendo concluído sem problemas. Procurou a Hluvuku-Adsema por preferir a metodologia de credito individual.
É pela primeira vez que vem solicitar o empréstimo no valor de 15.000,00MT para compra de material de construção de uma casa de alvenaria.

Propõe se a pagar o credito sem problemas para poder aceder a mais empréstimos com objectivo de concluir a sua casa pra confortar a família orgulho de ter casa própria.
texts.en:
Elisa S. was born in the province Gaza, district of Chibuto. She is 35 years old, and is married with two children, 2 and 6 years old. Her elder son goes to school in the town of Boane. She finished 12th grade. In addition to her two children, she also supports a nephew who lives with her in her house in Boane. She was raised by her parents in Chibuto, and moved with them to Boane in 1983. She has worked in Boane's elementary school as a technical assistant for more than 10 years, where she earns 2400 meticals a month. She uses her salary to support her family and employ someone in her home. She has technical training in school adminsitration. She's had loans from other banks (the Gueguegue Credit Association, which operates in Boane), which she paid back without difficulty. She came to Hluvuku-Adsema because she preferred our method of offering individual loans. This is the first time she's requested a loan in the amount of 15,000 meticals to buy construction materials for a brick house. She intends to pay off her loan without problems so she can apply for more, with the goal of finishing her house and offering her family the pride of having their own home.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Afaf

texts.en: Afaf is a 62-year-old woman living with her 6 siblings. She has owned her own lingerie shop for the past 10 years where she services the neighboring villages. Today, Afaf is requesting to borrow $800 to increase her purchases to be able to keep up with the demand of the market.

loans.use: to increase her purchases

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en: Sylvia is a 38 married with two children aged between 10 and 20 years. All her children go to school .She takes care of additional family members. Berna resides and rents a two roomed house where she is staying with four people. There is electricity and   piped water at home  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala in Mengo Bakuli. Sylvia works seven days a week .She buys her merchandise   from Kikuubo and  incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping.  She pays monthly rent of 50000/=.  She sells to all categories of people and on both retail and whole sale Sylvia has been in this business for ten years and with MCDT for four years servicing her eighth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more merchandise. Sylvia is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and start ad whole sale shop .

loans.use: To buy more  merchandise  for her retail shop

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
La señora CONSUELO S. R., tiene 55 años, vive en el distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES VALEROSAS.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 6to de Primaria.
Refiere que es de santiago de Chuco y que antiguamente en la sierra los padres no se preocupaban por darles educación a sus hijos sino porque aprendan las labores del campo.
La socia es casada  y tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 2 dependen económicamente de ella.
CONSUELO se dedica a la fabricación y venta de calzado solo para niñas.
Los fabrica y vende con el apoyo de su esposo.
En ocasiones o fechas especiales viaja a Bagua a vender el calzado.
El primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra de cuero, hilos y pegamento para la fabricación del calzado.
Este crédito de 1,100 nuevos soles lo utilizará en la compra de más productos para la fabricación de su calzado (cuero, pegamento).
La empresaria sueña aumentar sus ventas, espera mejorar de salud para empezar a viajar y vender su calzado.

loans.use: compra de productos para la fabricación de calzado (cuero, pegamento)

loans.name: Adio

texts.en: Adio is 50-years old and married with four children. He lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo State, Nigeria. Adio produces and sells blocks (which are used for building), a business he has been in for 15 years. He loves his business. He is requesting a loan of $1000 so he can purchase more cement and sand to increase production. This will improve his income and help him better provide for his family. Adio says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cement and sand for production of blocks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
Rufina D. G. is 50 years old and is married to Diosnel Arrua, who works as a construction worker. 
They have 2 children, one who is 30 and a mathematics teacher, and one who is 15 and enrolled in secondary school. Rufina has operated a pantry out of her home since 1990, where she sells groceries and haberdashery. 
Rufina would use her loan to purchase goods wholesale, such as sugar, noodles, rice – which would decrease the cost and increase her profits. She would also be able to have a greater variety of merchandise to offer her customers.
texts.en:
Rufina D. G. is 50 years old and is married to Diosnel Arrua, who works as a construction worker. They have 2 children, one who is 30 and a mathematics teacher, and one who is 15 and enrolled in secondary school. Rufina has operated a pantry out of her home since 1990, where she sells groceries and haberdashery. Rufina would use her loan to purchase goods wholesale, such as sugar, noodles, rice – which would decrease the cost and increase her profits. She would also be able to have a greater variety of merchandise to offer her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Foodstuffs

loans.name: Monicah Wangari

texts.en:
Monicah, a hardworking woman, has been running a grocery business for three years. She is married to Peter and they have two children: Leah and Mary, ages 8 and 2 years old respectively. Monicah's business is situated in a densely populated residential area and has many customers. With this loan she will increase her stock of tomatoes, onions and cabbage to sell in the shop.

Monicah was introduced to KADET by existing clients. This is her first loan and she has no previous loans from other MFIs. With the extra profit she anticipates as a result of this loan, she will add more stock to her business. Since Monicah resides in a rental house, her dream is to grow her business and purchase a piece of land to build her own home.

loans.use: To add stock of tomatoes, onions and cabbage to her grocery shop

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy M. is a resident of the municipality of Laua-an in the province of Antique. 

At times, she is a reserved type of person, but most of the time she loves talking to people in her community, especially to her colleagues in ASHI. She feels that, through ASHI, she has found friends and someone to confide in when problems beset her. Through her membership, she realized that many mothers have the same problem as hers: poverty. From them, she gained strength and she is determined to work hard to improve her standard of living. She wants her four children, ages 7 to 19 years old, to finish their studies until college. 

With the support of her husband, Mercy took the risk of requesting a loan through ASHI to expand her small dressmaking business and to start a duck-raising business. By raising ducks in their backyard, she will put the wide space surrounded their rice field to its best use, and augment the income she earns from her dressmaking business.

As a woman, having her own business and source of income is more important than depending on her husband’s income.

loans.use: To buy materials for her dressmaking business and to buy ducklings for a new duck-raising business.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor tiene 54 años, vive con su  esposa y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia.
Tiene 30 años de experiencia trabajando arduamente brindando el servicio de construcción civil, para ello cuenta con sus propias herramientas y hace todo tipo de construcciones, instalaciones eléctricas y de agua potable. Por tal motivo, en su zona lo conocen como una persona muy responsable y con mucha calidad en sus labores.
Pero Víctor no se queda atrás, pues cuando los trabajos de construcción son escasos, se sustenta con la agricultura, ya que tiene unos terrenos de cultivo donde siembra papa y maíz.

Esta es la tercera oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP y ha demostrado ser muy colaborador y puntual en su banco comunal. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más herramientas para su trabajo; como puntales, tablas, clavos, desarmadores, entre otros.
texts.en:
Victor is 54 years old; he lives with his wife and their 2 children in his own home. He has 30 years of experience working hard providing construction services. He has his own tools, and he does every kind of construction, including electrical installations and potable water. For this reason he is known in his area as a person who is very responsible and who does quality work. But Victor will not get left behind, because when construction work is scarce he sustains himself with agriculture, since he has some fields where he cultivates potatoes and corn. This is his 3rd opportunity to take a loan with MFP, and he has demonstrated that he is very cooperative and punctual in his communal bank. With the money he requests now he will buy more tools for his work, such as struts, boards, nails and screwdrivers, among others.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction tools and materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bales of used clothes in bulk

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 27 years old, married and has one child. He has a taxi business and also practices dairy farming. He has been in the taxi business for six years. He feels that, through Faulu Kenya, he has become financially stable and he believes that Faulu Kenya is a bridge to success. He has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy taxi spare parts, paint the taxi and buy new tires. He hopes to become a prominent businessman in Limuru area. He sees himself having a fleet of cars, buses and vans in the future.

loans.use: To buy spare parts, paint the taxi and buy new tires

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Mrs. Phally P., who is a villager in Preay Totueng village in Kandal province, is 55 years old. She and her husband, Mr. Chhum Chory, are farmers who own a small piece of land to grow crops to sell in order to support their family. However, though this family tries to work hard, they cannot earn enough income because their field is far from an irrigation system, and they do not have enough money to support it. They would also like to start a new business. 

Thus, in order to improve the family's living conditions, Mrs. Phally P. decided to seek a loan to buy a water machine, some piglets for breeding, and food for the pigs. She is the mother of two children who are attending the local public school. Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a water machine, some piglets, and pig food

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo T. is from the village of Brgy, which is in Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 33 years old. Alfredo is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Alfredo operates motorized tricycle transport services. Alfredo has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Alfredo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. He wanted to help improve his living situation and increase his ability to engage in business activities. Alfredo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. Alfredo is requesting a new loan in the anount of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase a new transport unit. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Alfredo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a new transport unit

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
La  señora Rosa María M., tiene 42 años de edad, vive en Sabana Grande, es casada y su esposo le apoya económicamente, él labora como fresador en un taller de torno, ellos tienen 2 hijos, los cuales se encuentran bajo su dominio.

Ella es comerciante y dentro de sus anhelos, esta la compra de un terreno en donde instalar una tienda de ropa, por esta razón  de superviviencia es que solicita un préstamo para la compra de utencilios plasticos, y ropa veraniega apra ofrecerla en la temporada que se avecina, con este apoyo económico,  tiene la ilusión que a futuro podrá realizar la apertura de dicha tienda y que esto le conlleve a mejores condiciones económicas o el capital necesario para futuras inversiones.
texts.en:
Rosa María M., 42, lives in Sabana Grande. She is married and her husband supports her economically. He works as a miller in a workshop. They have 2 children who are in currently in their care. She is a merchant, and her wish is to buy some land where she could set up a clothing store. For this reason she requests a loan to purchase plastic utensils and summer clothing to offer in the coming season. With this economic support, she hopes that in the future she will be able to open her store, and that this will lead to better economic conditions or the capital needed for future investments.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy plastic utensils and used clothing for summer

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Bun P., 40, is married and resides with his wife and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. He is a motor-taxi driver in the city and earns an income of about USD 3.60 per day. His wife is a farmer, earning an income of USD 0.50 per day to help cover the family's expenses.  

P. is requesting a loan of USD 1,100 to purchase blacksmith equipment to expand his child’s business. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house.  This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy blacksmith equipment

loans.name: Future In Our Hands Group

texts.en:
John C. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. He was born in Makeni about 37 years ago. He is married to a businesswoman and the couple has four children: three in primary school and the other a baby.

For over ten years now, John has been selling different type of bags – school bags, ladies’ bags, traveling bags, etc.

This is the first loan that John and his group have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improving their living conditions.

John will use his SLL 500,000 share of the loan to buy different types of bags wholesale to add to his current stock.

loans.use: To buy different types of bags to add to his stock

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth pertenece al Banco Comunal Violeta.
Elizabeth es conviviente, tiene 1 hijo, Elizabeth se dedica a la venta de artesanías en telar, productos que elabora y comercializa a intermediarios, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Elizabeth necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lanas.
El sueño de Elizabeth es mejorar su negocio y educar a su hijos.
texts.en:
Elizabeth belongs to the Violeta village bank. She lives with her partner and has one child. She works every day making hand-woven products that she sells to middlemen. Elizabeth is seeking a loan of 1000 soles to invest in the purchase of wool. Her dream is to improve her business and educate her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool.

loans.name: Celestino

texts.es: Celestino, es un hombre honesto y laborioso que tiene 55 años, está casado con Juliana de 51 años, ambos tienen 2 hijos, que son su adoración, esta familia vive en su casa propia. La actividad agrícola es el oficio que practica desde hace 30 años y en este largo tiempo sembró diferentes variedades de papa. Desde entonces afrontó muchas dificultades, como el alza de precio y las perdidas de su cosecha, pero estas situaciones nunca lo hicieron rendirse, sino por el contrario,  hicieron que él ame su trabajo, labrando con bastante esmero y dedicación. En tanto su esposa, cría ganado ovino, porcino y vacuno, para luego venderlo y de cuyas ganancias la ayudan afrontar algún imprevisto económico. Considera que la agricultura es muy rentable, pues le permite vivir cómodamente y cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos, quienes son su adoración y su motivo para continuar trabajando. En adelante arrendará sus tierras para poder tener ingresos económicos y con la administración de sus hijos continuará sembrando pero en mayor cantidad, asimismo comprará más cabezas de ganado ovino, que venderá cuando necesite. Esta es la cuarta vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y está contento de laborar en su grupo comunal, porque le gusta ahorrar dinero para disponerlo en el futuro. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono, que facilitarán el buen crecimiento de sus productos agrícolas.
texts.en:
Celestino is an honest and hard-working 55 year old man. He is married to 51 year old Juliana. They have two children, whom they adore. This family lives in their own house. Farming has been his occupation for 30 years. During those many years he has planted different varieties of potatoes. He faced many difficulties like prices rising and losing his crops. But, these situations never made him give up; they did just the opposite. They made him love his work. He works very carefully and with dedication. So does his wife. She raises sheep, pigs, and cows. She later sells them. Her earnings help her confront any unforeseen event. He considers farming to be very profitable. It allows him to live comfortably, and it covers his children’s necessities. He adores his children, and they are his reason for continuing to work. In the future he will rent his fields to be able to have income. Under his children’s management he will continue planting, but in greater quantities. He will also buy more heads of sheep, which he will sell when needed. This is his fourth loan with MFP. He is happy to work with his communal bank because he likes to save money for the future. He will use the loan he has requested to buy sacks of fertilizer. This will facilitate good growth of his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita C. is from the village of West Poblacion in Kalilangan Bukidnon. She is a 54-year-old widow with 9 children. Three of the children are still in school. Lucita has run a sari-sari (variety) retail shop for 6 years where she sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste. Lucita earns approximately 11,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Lucita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Lucita is requesting her 2nd loan, for 7,000 PHP, to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Novelyn

texts.en: Novelyn C. is from the village of Wadya, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 44 years old. Novelyn is widowed and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Novelyn runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products, especially soft drinks, in the local community. Novelyn has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 5,600 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Novelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Novelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Novelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma A. is from the village of Bitibut Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old, married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, Wilma operates a specialized retail store that sells fish in the local community. Wilma has been engaged in business for over 10 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Wilma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase additional inventory. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 50000 PHP to expand her business. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

----------------------------------------------------
About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business
