loans.name: Danayda Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Danayda posee un negocio que es la venta de productos plásticos, de manera ambulante y en  su casa de habitación. Ella compra sus productos de contado y sus ventas son de contado y al crédito. Por lo que siempre ha sido una mujer muy responsable, por lo que disfruta de tener un medio de ingreso que le genere ganancias. La señora vive con su madre  a la cual le ayuda con los gastos del hogar con lo que logra ganar de su trabajo, el producto lo compra en el mercado oriental, ya que en este centro de ventas los productos se encuentran más baratos.  Ella vive de manera moderada y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos.
texts.en:
Danayda has a business selling plastic products, both door-to-door and from her home. She buys her products in cash, and then sells them on a cash or credit basis. She has always been a very responsible woman, and enjoys having a means by which to generate income. She lives with her mother, and contributes financially to their household’s expenses through the income from her work. She buys her products at the eastern market, as this is where she can buy her merchandise at the best prices. She lives modestly, and has all the basic necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Guido

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DE SAN SEBASTIAN”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio  es el Sr. Guido; El socio tiene 49 años de edad;  ella es casado y tiene 3 hijos, El socio es carpintero de profesión, el socio tiene su taller en su C. y el desea a futuro un taller más grande y comprar todas las maquinarias necesarias para elaborar muebles a gran escala. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de  madera para elaborar trabajos de carpintería y venderlos. 

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This community bank member belongs to the "Virgen del Rosario de San Sebastian" community bank, which is located in the Huanchac district in the province and department of Cusco. He is Sr. Guido, who is 49 years old. He is married and has three children. He is a carpenter by profession. His workshop is in his house, and in the future he would like to have a larger workshop and buy all the machines necessary to produce furniture on a large scale. He is applying for the loan to invest in the purchase of wood to make carpentry products and sell them. He is grateful for and values the loans granted through this means, and at the same time he promises to make all the payments according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of wood to make carpentry products and sell them

loans.name: Roxanne

texts.en:
Roxanne L. is from the village of Barangay 4, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 26 years old. Roxanne is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Roxanne owns & operates a business providing tri-sikad services to local community members. Her husband is the driver. Roxanne has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Roxanne joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roxanne is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Roxanne from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor O. O. is twenty-four years old and married with no children yet. His wife stays at home to perform household chores as Victor goes out to earn a living. His business is located in a busy town center called Kakamega. He sells mangoes to the local people. He has been doing this for three years now and says that his business is profitable. He describes himself as very hardworking and visionary.

The major challenge Victor faces is that there are other people in the area doing the same kind of business, so it is difficult to maintain customer loyalty. The customers’ purchasing power is also low. In addition, they don’t purchase mangoes a lot since nutrition is not something people in rural areas are really knowledgeable about. However, he works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep his business doing well.

Victor is using his loan of 20,000 KES to buy more mangoes to meet customers' demands and with the hope of being able to supply fruit and vegetable vendors with mangoes in bulk in the future. He also hopes to buy land and build a house for his family.

loans.use: To buy more mangoes to sell

loans.name: Kanko

texts.fr: Kanko est  une femme  de 32 ans, elle a appris le métier de la coiffure. A la fin de son apprentissage elle a ouvert son propre atelier  qu’elle a nommé «  AFRO STAR ». Elle vend dans son atelier des mèches, perruques et tissages qu’elle utilise pour  coiffer  ses clientes. Elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour  l’achat de cartons de mèches, tissages et perruques. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants.
texts.en: Kanko is a 32 year-old hairdresser. When her apprenticeship came to an end she opened her own studio which she named 'Afro Star'. She sells streaks of hair, wigs and weaves which she uses to style her customers. She is seeking a loan from WAGES in order to purchase packs of streaks, weaves and wigs. She is married with two children.

loans.use: To purchase streaks of hair and wigs

loans.name: Parkimaso Ole

texts.en: Parkimaso Ole N. is 45 years old. He is a farmer and supports eight people in his family. His spouse is Naponu N. and they have children aged between six and 18 years. Naponu is a housewife and also helps Parkimaso in his farming. Parkimaso has been a wheat farmer for the last twelve years. This will be his second loan which he is planning to spend on chemicals and fertilizer. He is planning to use the anticipated profit from his loan to expand his farm by renting more land to increase his wheat production. His dream is that he will become a large-scale farmer and be financially stable to better support his family.

loans.use: to buy chemical and fertilizer for his wheat farm.

loans.name: Naheed's Group

texts.en:
Naheed makes and sells artificial flowers.  She takes orders from different gift shop and supplies them with flowers to order.  She is very skillful in her art and receives regular orders every month.  She also sells bangles.  She has a large variety available to sell to her clients.  She does these businesses to share the financial burden with her family. 

She lives in the historic city of Pakistan called Lahore.  Lahore is the second largest city of Pakistan and known for its history and culture. She lives there in a three room brick house with her family in the area named Green town.  

Her husband has a business of making stoves (used to cook food on it).  He has been doing this business for the past 18 years.  Earlier, he made stoves for someone else, but later he started making them for himself.  Now he makes stoves and sells to his own clients and earns a good profit.
 
Naheed has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy steel and iron in larger quantities and that will enable him to make more stoves and to complete the orders for his clients.  Naheed is hopeful that with this investment, her husband will be able to improve his business and increasing his sales. 

She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and this is her first loan application.

loans.use: To buy steel & iron for stove making business.

loans.name: Noelina

texts.es:
Noelina es una madre de familia de 29 años de edad que tiene un hijo menor de edad y que reside en el distrito agrícola de Nueva Arica, una zona ubicada a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir en su domicilio. Ella vende prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños entre sus vecinos y conocidos de la zona. El negocio es su única fuente de ingreso por lo que siempre da lo mejor de si para sacarlo adelante. Debido al tiempo que lleva en el negocio (10 años) actualmente cuenta con una clientela fidelizada.

Noelina desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda que aumenta durante estas temporadas navideñas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer luchadora y que siempre da lo mejor de si para sacar adelante a su menor hijo, las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien alegre y que siempre ayuda cuando se le necesita.
texts.en:
Noelina is a 29 year old mother with a young son. She lives in the farming district of Nueva Arica, an area situated an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

From her home she sells items of clothing for women, men and children, and she sells them to her neighbours and people that she knows in her area.  The business is her only source of income so she always tries her best to ensure that it works out. She has a very loyal client base as she has been running this business for 10 years.

Noelina wishes to expand her business by buying more fashion items in order to satisfy the increase in demand over the Christmas period. As such, she thought it wise to apply for a loan of 2000 Nuevos Soles from Edpyme Alternativa that will help her achieve her objective.

She is a strong woman who always does the best that she can to care for her young son. People who know her consider her to be a happy person who always helps others whenever there is need to do so.

loans.use: To buy more fashion items to satisfy the increase in demand during this Christmas period.

loans.name: Celso David

texts.es:
Celso David A. A.  tiene 30 años. Es Soltero, vive con los padres en el cantón  Ventanas en la Provincia de los ríos.  No tiene hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS VENCEREMOS  se encuentra ubicada a pocos minutos de la Oficina Ventanas en el recinto la América , perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Celso David se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul desde hace 2 años. Compra sus productos en Agripac, Agro insumos Karlita y Comercial Jiménez  los vende en la feria en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandu. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un terreno y sembrar cacao.

Le gusta el deporte.
texts.en:
Celso David A. A. is 30 years old and single.  He lives with his parents in  Ventanas in Los Ríos province. He has no children.  He likes sports.

The UNIDOS VENCEREMOS community bank in Ventanas is dedicated to the short-term agricultural cultivation of corn, rice, and gandul beans, which are labor-intensive.

Celso David has been farming corn, rice, and beans for the last two years. He buys his products from companies that sell them in the nearby market. Like other framers in the region, he faces problems like blight and adverse weather.

He will use this loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizer for growing corn, rice, and beans.  This funding will help him to meet his everyday needs.  His dream is to buy some land and grow cocoa.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies and fertilizer

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 32-year-old, married man with four children, living in his own house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in tailoring business for the last fifteen years. He started with one sewing machine and now has four. His hardship is debtors who delay to pay him. His vision is to have ten machines, bigger stock and to educate his children.

John needs the loan to buy cloth material for making men's suits.

loans.use: Buy cloth materials to make men's suits

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita O. is 59 years old, married and has seven adult children. She is from the village of Poblacion, Sapang Dalaga. To make a living, Perlita runs a grocery store, selling basic household items in the local community. She has been in her business for five months and earns a monthly income of 2,300php.

In 2010, Perlita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perlita is requesting her first loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for the business.  

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for the store

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is a married man with four children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees.

He has operated a second-hand clothes business for the past two years, selling at the market to his neighbors. Said faces a major challenge of theft in his business. He hopes to establish a shop to sell clothes in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. He decided to join Yehu because it is near his place of operation.

loans.use: To purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: German Francisco

texts.es: Germán tiene 64 años su negocio es brindar el servicio de taxi. Desde hace mas de 10 años que tiene este negocio, siempre esta ofreciendo un buen servicio, esta no es la primera vez que solicita crédito por lo que con la experiencia que ha obtenido le ha brindado nuevos clientes entre otras cosas. Su trabajo inicia desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, pues es muy peligroso trabajar a horas más noche la edad y parte de su enfermedad tampoco se lo permiten. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de  llantas, focos entre otras cosas necesarias.
texts.en:
Germán is 64 years old and has a business providing taxi services. He has been in this line of work for more than ten years and always provides good service. This is not the first time he has requested a loan since his previous credit experiences helped him obtain new customers, among other things.

Germán begins work at 5am and continue to 9pm. It can be dangerous to work at night because his age and illness will not allow him to do so. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy tires, headlights, and other necessities.

loans.use: Operating capital to purchase tires, headlights, and other necessities

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is a married woman who lives in Toledo City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a motorcycle transport.  Her husband Arcadio, who is 33 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living. They have three children who are between 7 and 11 years old. Jacqueline joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Jacqueline has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 8,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000 uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 13,000 to buy new tools and equipment for her motorcycle transport business so that she can serve more passengers and earn a higher income. Jacqueline is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: To buy new tools to maintain her motorcycle

loans.name: Mariana De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora. Mariana O. es socia del banco comunal Estrellitas, vive por la parroquia de Baños, esta parroquia es conocida por sus aguas termales las que le hacen un lugar muy turístico, cuenta con una variada gastronomía, su gente es muy amable y cordial.

Doña Mariana tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos de 13, 10 y 8 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio  y sus dos últimos hijos en una escuela de la ciudad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando. 

La Señora Mariana hace 16 años se dedica a la venta de limpiones de cocina, colchas y muchos artículos mas, también labora 2 veces por semana en el arreglo de una casa.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 4 años y  su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mercadería (limpiones). Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mariana O. is a member of Estrellitas community bank and lives in the village of Bath. This village is known for its thermal water that makes it a tourist spot, with its varied cuisine and its friendly and cordial people. 
Mariana is 34 years old, single mother of three children who are 13, 10 and 8 years old. The eldest is attending juniot high school while the other two are in a primary school in the city. She rents the house where she lives as she does not have her own house.
Mariana has been selling kitchen wipes, quilts and similar items for the past 16 years and she also works twice a week as house maid.   
She has been a member of the community bank for four years and she will use this new loan to purchase merchandise (wipes). Her dream is to be able to buy her own house.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen wipes

loans.name: Alina

texts.es: Alina, de 32 años. Vive en concubinato con Diego. Ambos tiene 2 menores hijos: Sarai y Cristofer; a los que alimentan y educan en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Miraflores. Todas las mañanas como hace 8 años. Alina se dirige con su esposo al caserío de Ayapata, lugar donde se ubican los terrenos agrícolas que posee. Sus principales cultivos constan de papa, maíz y demás hortalizas. Según cuenta, en temporadas de cosecha contratan con su esposo peones que les ayudan a extraer más rápido el fruto de la tierra, “eso me gusta”, afirma. Pero existen temporadas en los cuales las plagas azotan sus sembrío por lo que pierden el dinero invertido. Asimismo cuenta que siembra en terrenos extensos por lo que no tiene el capital necesario para la inversión de la cosecha. Por ello está planeando viajar a la capital del país a comercializar los alimentos por toneladas. Así ahorrará dinero para poder seguir sembrando. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay”, y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera se siente agradecida por el apoyo que recibe de parte de los integrantes de su asociación. Alina, tiene sembrado arveja en sus terrenos agrícolas. Por el cuidado constantemente que tiene que brindar a sus cultivos, comprará con el crédito varios sacos de abono orgánico, como también fertilizantes naturales.
texts.en:
Alina is 32 years old.  She lives with her life partner, Diego.  They have two minor children, Sarai and Cristofer.  They are feeding and raising the children in their own house in the rural community of Miraflores.  

For eight years Alina and Diego have been going every morning to the village of Ayapata.  That is where their farming land is.   Their main crops are potatoes, corn, and other vegetables.  She says that at harvest time they hire workers to help them collect the fruit of their land more quickly.  “I like this,” she says.

However, there are seasons when their plants are in the grips of the pests, and they lose they money they invested.  She says that she plants on extensive fields, but does not have the money needed to invest in the harvest.  That is why she is planning to travel to the capital of the country to market the food by the ton.  That way she will save money in order to continue planting. 

She belongs to the Señor de Muruhuay Communal Bank.  This is her second loan with MFP.  She is grateful for the support she has received from the association members.

Alina has planted peas on her land.  Because of the constant care that she needs to give her crops, she will use the loan to buy various sacks of organic fertilizer.  She will also buy natural fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Nergui

texts.en:
Nergui is 57 years old and lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 
They live in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her husband helps in her business. She rents a container (a stall) at a wholesale center and conducts business selling flour and rice. Over the years she has gained a lot of experience. She was selling her goods wholesale to citizens and individuals on “Khar Khorin” market. Her daily earnings are 500,000 MNT. Nergui is very a hardworking and persistent person. 
Her future plan is to improve her family’s living condition by buying a family house. She is asking for a loan to increase her working capital by buying some flour and rice.

loans.use: to buy flour and rice to sell

loans.name: Claudia Virginia

texts.es:
La señorita Claudia de 31 años de edad, es una joven emprendedora y madre soltera de una niña de 3 años. Alquila un local comercial en donde vende todo tipo de lencerías, bijuoteries, carteras y accesorios varios.
Ella se inició en este negocio gracias al apoyo económico de su padre que realiza trabajos de tapicería, empezó vendiendo a sus amigos, compañeros y vecinos de su barrio, luego se animó y alquiló un local comercial para la venta, actualmente cuenta con un próspero negocio.
Acude a la Fundación Paraguaya para acceder a una pequeña ayuda crediticia que destinaría a la compra de lencerías y carteras. La misma al retirarse agradeció la ayuda a la Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo, esperando contar con la ayuda de Kiva.
texts.en:
Claudia, 31 years of age, is a young entrepreneurial single mother of a 3-year old daughter.  She rents a space locally where she sells all types of lingerie, costume jewelry, purses and various accessories.

She started this business thanks to financial support from her father, who was in tapestry making.  She started selling to friends, companions and local neighbors.  Later, she was encouraged, and rented her own locale for the business.  She currently has a prosperous enterprise.

She turns to the Fundación Paraguaya to access a small amount of loan assistance to buy lingerie and purses.  She thanks Fundación Paraguaya for their support, and hopes to count on Kiva’s help.

loans.use: buy lingerie and purses.

loans.name: Carlos Jose

texts.es:
Carlos es una padre de familia de 51 años, tiene casa propia y vive con su esposa e hijos, la cual  cuenta con el servicio de agua y luz, ubicado en el pasaje Moore del distrito de Chepén y a una hora del departamento de la Libertad.  Este distrito se caracteriza porque su gente dedica a la agricultura,  ganadería y Turismo.
Carlos labora desde hace 10 años  como chofer de transporte público (colectivo – maneja auto en elque moviliza personas de un lado a otro, cupo máximo de su auto son 4 pasajeros), cubriendo la ruta Pacasmayo – Chepen, pero tiene un pequeño inconveniente que su auto es gasolinero y gasta una fuerte cantidad de dinero en gasolina, lo que no le permite tener mayores ingresos diarios en su actividad que realiza.
Por lo mismo ha visto la posibilidad de pedir un préstamo a Edpyeme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para realizar el cambio de sistema de gasolina a gas para que le sea más rentable el trabaja que realiza, y por ende le ayudará ha tener mayores ganancias para seguir sacando adelante ha su familia.  
Carlos es una persona muy conocida en su ciudad por ser muy responsable, respetuso con su pasajeros y con muchas ganas de brindarles una mejor oportunidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 51-year-old father who lives in his own house with his wife and children. Their home receives services, such as water and electricity, and is located along the Moore Passageway in the District of Chepén, which is an hour away from the Department of La Libertad. This area is known for its residents who engage in the agriculture, livestock, and tourism sectors.

For the past 10 years, Carlos has worked as a driver in the public transportation sector. He is part of a union and drives an automobile back and forth that can hold a maximum of four passengers. His route runs from Pacasmayo to Chepen. However, his problem is that his vehicle runs on gasoline and takes up a large expense. He does not earn enough money to continue his business on a daily basis.

For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN so that he can convert his operating system from gasoline to natural gas. This will allow his work to become profitable and help him earn more money to continue supporting his family.

Carolos is a person who is well-known in the city for being responsible, showing respect to his passengers, and wanting to provide his children better opportunities in life.

loans.use: to convert his vehicle to a system powered by natural gas.

loans.name: Elfa

texts.en:
Elfa is from the village of Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old, married, and has 2 grown children. To make a living, Elfa owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Elfa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC, which was used as additional capital for her business. She is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be Elfa’s second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family’s general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership consists mostly of farmers, fisher-folk and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Carlos Ruperto

texts.es:
Carlos Ruperto tiene 61 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive en el Recinto Agua Clara Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes.

Los miembros de la V.R.C SANTA ROSA DE AGUA CLARA, está ubicada a 20 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, esta constituida por 20 socios es el segundo crédito que solicitan a la cooperativa, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembran cacao y yuca, además se dedican al comercio.

Carlos se dedica a trabajar como chofer de un taxi en donde hace carreras dentro y fuera del Recinto, ademas se dedica a la crianza de chanchos. Las compras las realiza en Chillanes y las vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

El crédito le ayudará en la compra de alimentacion para los chanchos, el crédito le apoyado de manera que ha podido realizar algunos cambios de repuestos en el vehiculo. Ha enfrentado desafíos como enfermedades y la demanda de muchos taxis y camionetas que realizan esta actividad. Su sueño es tener buena salud para seguir trbajando y dar lo que necesitan a los hijos.

Le gusta salir con la familia de paseo.
texts.en:
Carlos Ruperto, 61, is married and lives with his wife and children in Agua Clara which belongs to Chillanes Canton.

The “Santa Rosa de Agua Clara” communal bank is located 20 minutes from the Chillanes office.  It has 20 members and this is the second loan they’ve requested from the Cooperative.  The members of this communal bank farm cocoa beans and manioc and are also merchants.

Carlos is a taxi driver; he makes runs both inside and outside Agua Clara.  He also raises pigs.  His purchases are done in Chillanes and San Pablo and his sales take place at the Chillanes Sunday farmers market.

The loan will help him buy feed for the pigs. The credit has helped him to be able to make make some changes to his vehicle. He has faced challenges such as illness and the demand of many taxis and trucks that do this job as well. 

His dream is to stay healthy to continue working to provide his children with everything they need.  He enjoys going out on family excursions.

loans.use: to buy pig feed.

loans.name: Charita

texts.es: Charita, de 38 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 hijos menores Rutger de 16 y Alith de 14 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El negocio al que Charita se dedica es la venta de cerveza, gaseosa y agua. Su puesto esta ubicado en su misma casa, es así que cada fin de semana procura renovar y abastecerse de mercadería. Ella es una vendedora muy alegre y carismática, por eso sus clientes la prefieren antes que a la competencia. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, ya que así hace más amena sus largas jornadas de trabajo, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar las cajas de cerveza hacía su puesto de venta.  Su objetivo es tener una tienda donde pueda desenvolverse como comerciante, además de poder ofrecer una mejor atención a sus clientes. Este será su décimo segundo crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el  apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para establecer su negocio. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más cajas de cerveza, ya que por estas fechas se incrementa su demanda.
texts.en:
Charita, 38 years old, is a very kind and hard-working woman, who lives in her own house with her 2 minor children, Rutger, aged 16, and Alith, 14, to whom she wishes to offer a better quality of life. Charita's business is selling beer, soft drinks, and water. Her store is located in her own house. Thus, every weekend, she attempts to renew and restock her merchandise. Charita is a very happy and charismatic vendor, and her customers prefer her to the competition.

What Charita likes best about her work is conversing with her customers; it makes her long days less tiresome. She has had her business for 4 years and what she finds most difficult is transporting the cases of beer to her store. Charita's goal is to have a better store where she can develop as a merchant, and be able to offer better service to her customers.

This will be Charita's 2nd loan through MFP, and she hopes for the help of each one of you to establish her business. With the 3,000 new sols requested, she will buy more cases of beer, since during the present epoch, demand increases.

loans.use: buy more cases of beer to sell.

loans.name: Soforal Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 03juin 2010. Il est composé de quatorze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Diariétou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main et le responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 53 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de trois enfants. 

Elle s’active dans la vente de rafraichissement(crème glacée, de la bouillie de mil etc...). Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on June 3, 2010. It comprises fourteen women who live in the same area. Their main work involves small-scale commerce. 

Ms. Diariétou (at the right in the photo with her hand raised) is the group's official. She is 53 years old, a widow, and the mother of three children. She is active in selling refreshments (ice cream, millet porridge, etc.) She has good experience in this domain of work, since she has been working at it for several years. 

This loan will enable her to boost her capital and to develop her business further. The profits will allow her to improve her family's living conditions (health, food, clothing, etc.) and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy millet, sugar, "monkey bread", and some ingredients

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
El Sr. Nelson tiene 41 años, vive en la Ciudad de Concepción , tiene un hijo de 9 años quien vive con el.
El cliente tiene un lavadero desde hace mas de 1 año, también  un taller  de motos que le genera muy buenas ganancias. El es muy conocido en la ciudad, por lo que ya tiene muchos clientes quienes le traen sus autos para mandarlos lavar.
El se considera una persona de confianza, gracias a su honestidad está donde está. Le gustaría algún dia ampliar su negocio para poder tener mas capacidad para mas vehículos.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de los limpia autos que utiliza para la limpieza de los mismos. El esta muy esperanzado en el crédito, ya que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Sr. Nelson is 41 years old and lives in the city of Concepción. He has a nine-year-old son who lives with him.

Nelson has managed a car wash for more than a year. He also owns a motorcycle workshop that generates very good revenues. Nelson is well-known in the city and has many customers who bring their cars to him to be washed. He is considered to be a trustworthy person because of his honesty. Someday he would like to expand his business so that he can accommodate more vehicles.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy car wash supplies to use in his business. He is very hopeful that the loan will be of great help.

loans.use: to purchase car wash supplies.

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en:
Mercidita is 38 years old, married and has six dependents. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur in the Philippines.

Five years ago Mercidita opened her sari-sari store, earning a monthly income of 10,080 PHP. Her family's daily expenses are covered by her income.

In 2010 she became a member of GDMPC. Mercidita is now requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase more products to sell and to sustain her family’s livelihood. With the loan, Mercidita hopes to boost her income and improve her family’s general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Silvia Margarita

texts.es:
La Señorita Silvia es socia del banco comunal Unión y Prosperidad, vive por la parroquia de Zhidmad, lugar que cuenta con hermosos paisajes, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes trabajos.

La Señorita Silvia tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres quienes se dedican a la agricultura, la casa en la que habita es de propiedad de sus padres.
 
Nuestra socia labora como empleada domestica y trabaja de lunes a sábados medio día. 

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para construir su casa.
 
Su meta es culminar sus estudios del colegio.
texts.en:
Señorita Silvia is a member of the "Union and Prosperity" communal bank.  She lives in Zhidmad Parish, a place that has beautiful scenery.  Its people work in animal husbandry and agriculture, with many working in the city in various jobs.

Señorita Silvia is 22 years old and single.  She lives with her parents who work in agriculture.  The house where she lives is owned by her parents.

Our member works as a maid, working from Mondays through noon on Saturdays.

This is her first loan through the community bank, and she will invest it in the purchase of construction materials for construction on her house.

Her goal is to complete her college studies.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Kyegwisa Bakyara  Twimukye Group

texts.en:
At her food stall, 32 year-old Ovia sells bananas, sweet potatoes, maize, Irish potatoes and yams. The odds to succeed in her type of business in Western Uganda are ten to one. These odds go into overdrive when one practices farming. In a broad sense that means being able to easily harvest what one plants and, at length, being able to sell the produce.
Food businesses are all the rage in most cities in the West of Uganda. Of late, most of these food sales entrepreneurs have been driving roaring trades selling their foods to the more lucrative food markets in Central Uganda. Many people are partial to bananas and Irish potatoes from Western Uganda..

Ovia farms her land in Ibanda.  She says that her monthly gross sales revenue totals to Uganda shillings 120,000.

Going by accounts from Pearl, this is the 5th time, Ovia's group is receiving a loan, and the repayment record has been good enough.
Ovia says this loan will help her purchase high grade manure for her farms.

loans.use: to purchase high grade manure for her farm.

loans.name: Yuli Yohana

texts.es:
Yuli de 25 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de  luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Yuli desde hace unos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral (gallinas y pavos), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos familiares.  También comercializa ropa para damas lo que le permite tener otro ingreso para su hogar

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para comprar alimento balanceado y mercadería para seguir ofreciendolo a sus clientes, con las ganancias que obtenga con la venta de sus animales podrá cubrir su crédito como tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Yuli es una persona que con esfuerzo y mucho empeño a sabido sacar adelante a su familia con la finalidad de que logren sus objetivos que se han planteado.
texts.en:
Yuli is 25 years old.  She lives with her family in her own home, which only has electricity (no running water).  Her home is located in the rural area of the Tambogrande district, which is part of the Piura department.  This area has agriculture, livestock and handicrafts.

For several years, Yuli has been raising and selling farmyard poultry (chickens and turkeys). Her farmyard is in the rear of her home, and is spacious and suitable for this.  She feeds them with a balanced feed, so that her poultry are able to reach an optimum size and she can offer them for sale in the different area markets and so get good earnings to cover her family's expenses.  She also sells women's clothing which provides her with another source of incomer for her household.

She has requested a loan of 500 New Soles form Edpyme Alternativa to buy balanced feed and merchandise that she can continue selling to her customers.  With the earnings from the sale of her poultry, she will be able to cover her loan as well as have a better quality of life.  

Yuli is a person with much drive and much determination to move her family ahead in life, with the end goal of achieving her planned objectives.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her poultry, and merchandise for her other business.

loans.name: Sidlia

texts.es:
Sidlia es socia del Banco Comunal "Las Moralinas“ del distrito Morales en el departamento de San Martín. Es soltera, tiene 49 años y tres hijos, entre 18 y 22 años que le apoyan en su negocio y también en casa.

Ella se dedica a la venta de gaseosas en la entrada de su casa. Su negocio opera tres días a la semana, desde el jueves hasta el sábado.  A veces prepara comida como asaditos y pollo. 

El nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,800.00 lo invertirá en la compra de nuevas bebidas de variados sabores y marcas. Dice que està muy bien, aunque le gustaría tener un piso màs arreglado par poner un local de venta de ropa.

Lleva tres años con Manuela Ramos y le agradece la oportunidad de recibir un préstamo con tanta rapidéz.
texts.en:
Sidlia is a member of the communal bank "Las Moralinas" in the district of Morales, department of San Martín.  She is single, 49, and has three children between the ages of 18 and 22 who help in the business and at home.

She sells sodas at the entrance to her house.  He business is open three days a week, from Thursday to Saturday.  Sometimes she prepares food such as small roasts and chicken.

The new loan in the amount of 1,800 PEN will be used to buy new beverages in a variety of flavors and brands.  Although she claims her life is alright, she would like to have a nicer apartment so she could set up a clothes shop.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for three years and is grateful for the opportunity to receive a loan so quickly.

loans.use: To buy beverages.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
This is Emma, 56, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Jose, an OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker). She is a mother of four children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Emma owns a sari-sari store. She buys groceries like canned goods, condiments, milk, sugar and primary commodities that are needed in every household. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this, she also sells direct selling products by means of a catalogue. Her store is located adjacent to her house.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 13,000 that will help to continue her operations.  She will use the loan to buy additional grocery items and accommodate the orders in her direct selling business. Her profits allow them to enjoy some comforts in life and secure their children’s future.

Emma dreams of improving their family living. She is hopeful that her business will continue to grow. She never fails to attend the fellowship* every week as it inspires her to grow more spiritually and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and other products

loans.name: Samuel Thiongo

texts.en: Samuel is a 30-year-old married man. He has two children with ages ranging from 3 years to 8 years. He describes himself to be devoted and passionate. Samuel operates a shoe sales business where he sells shoes to the local people. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a growing shopping centre. He describes his biggest business challenge to be harrassment by the local administration. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to increase his stock of shoes. His business goal is to grow his business into wholesale within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will own very big shoe sales shops in Thika.

loans.use: To increase stock of shoes

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 33 years old and married with one child.  He has been operating a retail shop for four years. He has managed to retain his business through his hard work and determination.  He has also grown his business with his previous loans from Faulu Kenya.

Joseph hopes to expand his business into wholesale in the future.  He has requested 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, cooking fat and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking fat and maize flour.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 23 years old and has been in farming for eight years in her home area of Litein, Kenya. She currently produces tea, milk and eggs for the local market. She is married with two children ages 9 and 10. She employs one farmhand. She also has a retail tea business. She sources her tea from other farmers in the area.

Caroline has made a 20,000 KES loan request from Juhuhdi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds for her poultry-farming business. She says the loan will enable her business to double and to make life better for her family as well as provide income to educate her two children.

Caroline is happy Juhudi Kilimo is providing farmers with loans.

loans.use: to purchase poultry birds for her poultry-farming business.

loans.name: Yuthy

texts.en:
Yuthy, who is 36 years old, is married and lives with her husband and child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorian sites. She sells food, and her husband is a tailor. They work very hard every day to generate income to help cover the family's expenses. 

Yuthy is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to purchase more food to resell to her new and existing customers. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This is her first loan from KREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more supplements to expand her food-selling business.

loans.name: Senerita

texts.en:
Senerita, age 55, owns and operates a business venture catching and selling farm-raised fish. She has five years of experience in this business. Senerita needs a loan of WST $1,500 to purchase additional fish to raise. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve and expand the business. She and her husband have eight children.
 
In 2009, Senerita joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Senerita's second loan with SPBD. 
 
*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers. Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score." For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About SPBD:
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase fish to raise and sell

loans.name: Alimatu

texts.en:
Alimatu is 30 years-old and married with two children, aged seven years and 15 years-old. She runs a general merchandise store in Goderich in a western area in Freetown, Sierra Leone. Both of her children are currently attending school. She has three additional dependents that live with her at home.

She's been in this business for seven years and sells Maggie, rice, cooking oil, sugar, tomatoes, macaroni, baked beans and palm oil at her store.  She also earns income from her husband, who works as a police man, a government civil servant. She says that her business is doing well and they are living an average life.

Alimatu requested this loan through Kiva partner BRAC Sierra Leone in order to purchase more palm oil, eggs, luncheon meat, tinned tomatoes and bags of rice. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her profit and improve her children’s welfare. In the future, she would like to open another outlet in a different area. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, eggs, luncheon meat, and bags of rice.

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es:
Micaela de 30 años de edad, convive con Carmelo, el padre de sus 4 hijos de 15, 13, 9 y 7 años. Esta familia vive en la casa de la hermana de Micaela, en el anexo de Kivinaki, en la provincia de Chanchamayo. Micaela tiene una rutina cansada. Se dedica a la venta de alimentos que ella misma prepara. El trabajo inicia en las mañanas, momentos donde lava, corta y cocina los alimentos. “Los comensales salen contentos por que mi sazón les gusta, por eso mis clientes son fieles, incluso me recomiendan con otras personas”, comenta. Es así que ella no descansa en todo el día, ya que prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas. 
Los sábados y domingos se encarga de lavar ropa ajena, así obtiene ingresos extras. 
Carmelo no se encuentra viviendo por ahora con ella, pero recibe un dinero mensual, con el que paga la educación de sus hijos. Y como si fuera poco, Micaela cría chanchos y los vende a un buen precio. Ahora cuenta con 9 animales, y cree que venderá cada uno a 700 o 800 soles, para esta campaña navideña.
Ella ansía mejorar y ampliar su negocio de chanchos, para ello invertirá cada vez un poco más. Éste sería su primer préstamo de MFP, que recibiría gracias a su ayuda. “Las Semillitas de Kivinaki” es el nombre de su banco comunal del que se siente entusiasmada por el trabajo a realizar.
Invertirá el dinero en la compra de insumos para preparar los alimentos que venderá. Además comprará alimentos especiales para dar de comer  a sus chanchos.
texts.en:
Micaela is 30 years old and lives with Carmelo, the father of her four children, ages 15, 13, 9, and 7.  This family lives in Micaela’s sister’s house in the Kivinaki annex of the Chanchamayo province.  Micaela has an exhausting routine.  She sells food that she prepares herself and begins working in the morning, where she washes, cuts, and cooks the food.  She says, “The consumers are happy because they like my seasonings, so my customers are loyal and recommend me to others.”  This is why she doesn’t rest all day; she sells breakfast, lunch, and dinner.  She does other people’s laundry on the weekend for extra money.

Carmelo doesn’t live with her at the moment, but sends money every month, with which she pays her children’s educational expenses.  As if this was not enough, she also raises pigs and sells them for a good price.  She has nine animals and believes that she will sell each for 700-800 PEN for the Christmas season.

She wants to improve and expand her pig business and she will steadily invest more into it.  This will be her first loan through MFP, thanks to your help.  The communal bank is called “Las Semillitas de Kivinaki” (The Little Seeds of Kivinaki), and she is excited about their work.

She will invest the money into ingredients to prepare the food she will sell.  She will also buy feed for her pigs.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and animal feed.

loans.name: Medina

texts.en: Medina is 39 years old, married and has earned a living for the last two years by selling clothing in Kator, South Sudan. She is applying for this loan from BRAC South Sudan to buy more clothes to sell to her customers. She hopes to use the extra income earned as a result of this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Gita

texts.en:
Gita is 46 years-old. She is married and has 2 children aged 25 and 14.  In 2000, she established her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 6 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, Gita plans to improve the economic conditions of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods

loans.name: Frola

texts.en:
Flora, aged 29 years old, is a mother of two children.  She lives with her parents in Morogoro District. She is a committed Camfed Learner Guide who teaches students life skills studies and self-awareness for at least two and half hours per week. 

Flora has a business of selling charcoal. She started this business in order to solve the challenges faced by her family. She is doing this kind of business, because most people in her society use charcoal rather than firewood as a source of energy. She uses the profits she obtains through this business to meet the needs of her family. 

She is requesting a loan from Kiva in order to build a simple room (store) for selling charcoal and to expand her business. Her vision is to save money for the purpose of sending her children to English medium school.

loans.use: to build a simple room (store) for selling charcoal and to expand her business.

loans.name: Maria Blanca

texts.en:
By my age no longer I can work in a large company, so I needed to start my own business. I sell sweets, fruits and treats in one of the main streets of my community. The majority people in my town are clients and they usually buy candies first. This way, I can cover the medical expenses for me and my family as well as my house. At this moment I want to buy grapes, apples to begin to sell this Christmas season. I am sure that this will really help sales this year.

SPANISH

Por mi edad ya no puedo trabajar en alguna empresa asi que decidi dedicarme a mi propio negocio, vendo dulces, frutas y golosinas en una de las principales calles de mi comunidad, que esta ubicada frente a la Alcaldia por lo que es bastante transitada. La mayoria de personas son clientes quienes me estiman y me compran dulces todos los dias de esta manera puedo obtener dinero para cubrir mis gastos medicos, alimento y casa. En este momento quiero comprar uvas, manzanas para comenzar a vender en epoca navideña, estoy segura que me ira mejor en mis ventas.

loans.use: Compra de churros, dulces, galletas, uvas, manzanas y otros.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa has been working on her business for 3 years. It is a family business where her two twin daughters and husband make the product. Elsa learned the business from her parents and they motivated her to continue working in the field. She buys the prime material from Quito every week. With the primary material she makes brooms and brushes. The business is based on the patio of her house, which is where everything is made. Her husband is responsible for delivering the products in a small second hand truck that he owns. Before she ran a store, but she had to close it in order to look after her daughters. She needs the loan in order to buy greater volumes of bristle, straw and sticks. She was born in Guayaquil and is 40 years old. She has 2 daughters. Her husband works with his truck doing deliveries. They are a humble couple, hard workers and they all work together to make the business work. Thanks to the business, they have a house and little by little they are putting down cement and making the place more suitable for the business. They have a view onto the street. She wants to keep working on the business as it is her only source of income.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Zoe], Kiva Volunteer.

Elsa tiene 3 años realizando esta actividad. Es una empresa familiar porque sus 2 hijas gemelas y su esposo son quienes elaboran el producto. Este negocio lo aprendió Elsa de sus padres. Ellos la motivaron para que también siga esta línea. Ella compra la materia prima en Quito y le llegan cada semana a la ciudad. Con eso elabora las escobas, cepillos y trape adores. El negocio esta en el patio de su casa allí elaboran el producto. Su esposo se encarga de hacer la entrega en una pequeña camioneta de segunda mano que tiene. Toda la mercadería que colocan es al contado. Anteriormente ella tenía una tienda pero tuvo que cerrar por sus hijas que no podía atenderlas. Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar en mayor volumen: las cerdas de nailón, paja y palos. Elsa nació en Guayaquil. Tiene 40 años. Con 2 hijas. Su esposo trabaja en su camioneta haciendo fletes. Ambos son una pareja muy humilde, trabajadores, todos trabajan en el negocio apoyándose mutuamente. Gracias al trabajo ellos tienen su casa y poco a poco la están haciendo de cemento, a su vez están acondicionando un espacio para el negocio con vista hacia la calle. Su deseo es seguir en el negocio ya que es su única fuente de ingreso segura.

loans.use:
To buy bristle, straw and sticks

para comprar: las cerdas de nailó, paja y palos.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I intent to expand and diversify my business

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: "I am proud to have been a Lift Above Poverty Organization client for the past 3 years," stated Mrs. Florence O.. Florence is 30 years of age, married with five children. She lives in Asaba of Delta State in Nigeria and sells plantains and bags of rice to people in her area. Florence believes that a loan of $400 will allow her to expand her business successfully and increase her turnover.

loans.use: To buy more plantains and rice for her inventory

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es:
Janeth lives in her mother's house on Fernando Diez Street in the Alto San Pedro district of La Paz. She is 30. She works as a cleaner in offices and private homes. She has a two-year-old daughter and is separated from her husband. She would use the loan to make improvements to the room where she lives and make it more habitable. She is a new client and would draw from funds in our Development Program, Service Sector.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

Janeth vive en casa de su madre en la calle Fernando Diez de medina de la zona de Alto San Pedro de la Ciudad de La Paz; tiene 30 años de edad y trabaja como empleada de limpieza en oficinas y casas particulares; tiene una niña de 2 años y esta separada del esposo. El crédito que solicita es para refaccionar la habitación donde vive y hacerla mas habitable Es cliente nuevo y puede acceder a un crédito que estará dentro de nuestro programa de fomento, sector servicios.

loans.use: Household improvements

loans.name: Maranata

texts.en:
Maranata used to be a teacher at Leififi College. She resigned from there four years ago and decided to stay home and run her own small shop. She is now joining the program and this is her first loan of $300.

She lives at Faleula, and her shop is located at the front of her house on the roadside. She is open seven days of the week from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m., and she manages to get $1,800-$2,000 a week.

She has one child and she is in the Primary Level at school. Her dream is to have a better future for her daughter, and to let the business grow.

loans.use: To buy more supplies and stock for her shop

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
Arturo E. is an example of the type of person who cannot sit by and do nothing. It has been thirteen years since he retired and, instead of staying home and relaxing, he began looking for a way to start his own auto repair shop/garage. He set up a small space and, with few tools and resources, began to build a customer base that helps simultaneously to recommend his services to others.

Arturo is asking for a $925USD loan, to be repaid over a period of six months, to outfit a new space for his business. His current space is still very small, making it difficult for him to work on the cars. With your help, Arturo will be able to make the most of his passion for mechanical work, be able to offer more to his family, and not have to rely solely on his pension for income.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Arturo E. es un ejemplo de las personas que no pueden estar sin hacer nada. Hace 13 años se jubiló y en lugar de quedarse sentado en su casa Arturo comenzó a buscar la manera de hacer su propio taller de reparación de carros. Por lo tanto acondicionó un pequeño espacio, con un poco de herramientas y refracciones fue que consiguió clientes y así poco a poco se ha ido haciendo de clientes que le piden los trabajos y al mismo tiempo lo recomiendan con sus amigos.

Arturo está solicitando un crédito de US $925 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Arturo podrá adecuar otro espacio. Puesto que en el que todavía está es muy pequeño y no puede maniobrar bien con lo carros. Con tu ayuda Arturo podrá sacar provecho de lo que tanto le gusta la mecánica, y al mismo tiempo podrá tener algo que ofrecerle a su familia. Y no sólo vivir de lo que le dan como pensión.

loans.use: Rent a larger space for auto repair shop.

loans.name: Neneng

texts.en: Neneng is a 30-year-old woman whose husband, M., has no fixed income. So, to cover day-to-day necessities, she sells  foods such as noodles, fried snacks, etc., and usually earns about US$ 2.50 - $3.50 per day. Neneng is a member of MBK and is requesting a US$ 75 loan to buy more goods for her food stall so that she can provide tuition for her children's education. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her stall

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
"I am Shazia K. from a small town: Arifwala, Pakistan. My husband is a tailor and I sell milk from my house. I want a loan to buy an additional cow to increase our milk production and earn more. We have already two cows for this purpose. I wish someday I can have my own house.

I am the group leader of few other women in my neighborhood. Bakhtnisha B. requires a loan to buy a donkey cart. Sharifa B. wants a loan to buy a rickshaw. Munnawer B. needs a loan to start a grocery store. Tasmeena B. will use her share of the loan to buy a donkey cart to transport bricks."

loans.use: Buy an additional cow

loans.name: Karla Nadia

texts.es:
Mrs. Karla R. has been selling clothes of all sizes and for all ages for the last 15 years in the La Terminal market of León. She has worked very hard and has invested much money to obtain and keep her own slot in the market . She has three children who have been able to go on with their schooling thanks to their mom's little business.

She started her business by selling in the traveling market, out in the sun and getting physically worn out after walking for long periods of time. Little by little, she started saving in order to invest in a slot inside the market, and, after obtaining it, she kept on selling clothes, but in smaller quantities.

Mrs. Karla is facing the need of investment of clothes to sell in her slot in the market, and that's why she's approaching Ceprodel: to benefit from a loan and buy the clothes she needs to sell. This will help to keep her family together.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica MR, Kiva volunteer

Desde hace 15 años en la ciudad de León en el mercado la Terminal, la señora Karla R. se dedica a la venta de ropa de todos tamaños y para todas las edades. Posee un tramo propio el cual le ha costado mucha inversión y esfuerzos por mantener este negocio. Es madre de tres hijos que gracias a su apoyo han logrado salir adelante en sus estudios.

El negocio lo comienza vendiendo ambulante en todo el mercado, exponiéndose al sol y al desgaste físico de producidos por el caminar mucho. Poco a poco comenzó a invertir para pagar un local interno en el mercado hasta que lo obtuvo y de aquí en adelante comenzó vendiendo la ropa pero en menores cantidades.

La necesidad que atraviesa la señora Karla es la inversión en compra de la mercadería es por eso que acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con créditos y de esta manera adquirir la ropa para comercializarla y así seguir manteniendo su núcleo familiar.

loans.use: Clothing purchase

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
About 2 years ago Elizabeth decided to remodel her home to include a small internet cafe to provide services to her community. Her business has been very successful because it is one of the few internet cafe's that exist in her community. But with the passing months things started to change and some competing business started to appear. She now sees that her household income has decrease due to this competition and she has seen the need to start another business. She decided to buy a hot dog cart and sell fast food (hot dogs and hamburgers). Elizabeth believes that with this new business she will be agle to obtain the important income she neesd for her beloved family, including her hard working husband Edgar and her little girl Teresa, aged 3 years. You can be a great contributor to Elizabeth and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace aproximadamente 2 años Elizabeth decidió acondicionar su vivienda para instalar y brindar servicios de internet a su comunidad, este negocio le fue resultando muy rentable porque es una de las pocas cabinas que existía en su zona en ese tiempo; pero con el transcurso de los meses las cosas fueron cambiando y la competencia fue extendiéndose.Ahora al ver que los ingresos de su hogar han disminuido debido a la competencia, se ha visto en la necesidad de abrir otro negocio, es así que decidió comprar un carrito salchipapero y vender en las afueras de su negocio comida rápida (salchipapas, hamburguesas), Elizabeth cree que con este negocio logrará obtener ingresos económicos importantes para su querida familia que la integran su laborioso esposo Edgar y su pequeña niña Teresa de 3 añitos de edad. Usted puede ser un gran colaborador de Elizabeth y su familia.

loans.use: Increase in capital to remodel the new business.

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Vũ Thị N. and her husband are both 42 years old. They have 3 school aged children. Before she joined TYM fund, she worked in her rice filed and and raised pigs. Her annual income was only 300 USD. After joining TYM, she uses the loans to buy waste material, sorts it into different categories: plastic, metal ...She then resells the waste material to recycling companies. Her family income has increased to 200 USD a month. Her wish is to raise more money to invest into her business e.g. buy more material. She is into her 10th year as TYM fund member. She is requesting a loan of 950 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Vũ Thị N. và chồng chị năm nay đều bước sang tuổi 42. Anh chị có 3 con đều đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ, công việc chủ yếu của chị N. là làm ruộng và chăn nuôi lợn. Thu nhập một năm chỉ khoảng 300USD. Sau khi vào Quỹ chị đã sử dụng vốn vay thu mua phế liệu. Sau khi mua về, chị N. phân chia từng loại và bán cho các cở sở đúc đồng và làm đồ nhựa. Thu nhập hiện nay của gia đình là 200USD/tháng. Mong muốn của chị là được vay thêm nhiều vốn hơn nữa để tăng lượng hàng thu mua. Tính đến nay, chị N. đã tham gia Quỹ được 10 năm. Mức vốn đề nghị của chị vòng này là 950USD.

loans.use: Buy waste material

loans.name: Naseem Jan

texts.en:
Naseem Jan, son of N. M., is 21 years old. He is a pharmacist and has a pharmacy in the second district of Ningarhar province.

Naseem Jan is an active person. He wants to improve his small business, and for this purpose he needs money to buy enough drugs for his pharmacy. He decided to take a loan so he has applied to AFSG for a 50,000 Afghanis loan for 18 months.

loans.use: To buy drugs for his pharmacy

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.en: I. Shavkat is 46. He’s married and the father of 6 children. Her wife Gulnora is a housekeeper. Shavkat is working hardto support his large family and to make all of his children well-educated. His business includes growing and selling agricultural such as onion, garlic, potatoes and maize. At the same time he raises cattle. His eldest son helps him with the business. Having been in business for fifteen years, Shavkat has gained rich experience. The business is the main source of income and generates stable income for the family. At the same time it requires considerable capital. The sowing season is beginning soon and he is planning to sow onion, garlic, potatoes and maize, so he wants to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer.  He requests a loan of $875 USD for 12 months. He promises to be accurate with paying the loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Ruach

texts.en:
Ruach is a 45-year-old married woman with 2 children, who are 12 and 16 years old, respectively. In addition, she takes care of 2 other people, who are 48 and 68 years old, respectively. She began her tailoring career in 1998. On a daily basis, she works from 9:30 am to 6:00 pm at her business. As a result, she can earn a monthly profit of approximately $40 from her sales.

Ruach now seeks a loan to buy more tailoring items and clothes for her business.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional tailoring items and clothes.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Marta is a member of the Maria Antonieta Communal Bank.

Marta is a single mother, is 51 years old and has one son who is 13 years of age. Marta is retired from the education sector. She lives with her mother and son and has a store in the Santa Clara Market for which she pays monthly rent. Marta sells a variety of clothing for women, gentleman, and children, and she acquires her products in Lima, Huancayo and also has suppliers that bring them to her business. With the help of her mother she operates the store, which is open every day of the week.

Marta needs a loan of 1350 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of polo shirts, pants and sweaters.

Marta dreams that her son will continue studying to be a professional, wants to diversity her business more and improve the appearance of her locale.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

Marta es socia del Banco Comunal Maria Antonieta.

Marta es madre soltera, tiene 51 años y 1 hijo de 13 años, Marta es jubilada del sector educación, Marta vive con su mama y su hijo, Marta tiene una tienda en el mercado Santa Clara por cual paga un alquiler mensual, Marta vende ropa variada para mujeres, caballeros, niños, sus productos lo adquiere en la ciudad de Lima, Huancayo y también tiene proveedores que le llevan a su negocio, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su mama, la atención en su tienda son todos los días de la semana.

Marta necesita un préstamo de 1350 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de polos, pantalones, chompas.

Marta sueña con que su hijo siga estudiando para ser profesional, surtir más su negocio, mejorar la presentación de su local.

loans.use: Marta needs a loan of 1350 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of polo shirts, pants and sweaters.

loans.name: Parveen M.ashraf Group

texts.en:
Parveen baji is the widow of M. A. and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore is famous for its historical places. She has been living in this city for the last 13 years. She is the mother of two sons. Her elder son is a salesman in an electronic items shop. Her younger son is a professional driver. Parveen baji has a business selling clothes. She has been in this profession for the last 10 years. She is applying for a loan to buy more clothes to resell.

She is joined in her loan group by four other members. Sajida baji wants a loan to buy iron to make iron chains, which are used to tie cattle. Azra baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Ayesha baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics for her beauty parlor. Rani baji wants a loan to buy wood for her furniture-making business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Pring would like to buy more fish to breed and more medicine for her husband who is a doctor.

loans.name: Minu

texts.en:
Mrs. Minu S. is a resident of Wolkhu, Lalitpur, and attends the microfinance group meeting in Tangal, which is only five minutes away from Wolkhu.  She lives with her husband, son, and daughter. Most of the people in this area are engaged in business. Her daughter is in grade 11, and her son is in grade 6.

Both Mr. and Mrs. S. are engaged in their own business. For 8 years they have make papads, colorful chips, snacks, and pickles in their own home, which they sell in grocery shops. Their snacks have become very popular. Mrs. S. is requesting her fifth loan of Rs 30000.00 ($400.00) to purchase more ingredients for their business.

loans.use: Ingredients for snacks

loans.name: Chhum

texts.en: Chhum S. is married and lives with her husband and young child in the Kampong Cham province of Cambodia. She is a midwife who earns $2 a day, while her husband is a village chief who also earns $2 a day.  She would like a loan of $1000 to reinvest with her sister to open a food shop at Phnom Penh. She believes that a food shop can increase their income and raise the standard of living for the whole family.

loans.use: To open a food shop.

loans.name: Sela

texts.en:
Sela K. is a single parent with 4 dependants, and she received schooling through junior high.

Sela has been in the fish-selling busines since 1991. More specifically, she buys fish from fishermen, brings the fish home to be processed and preserved, and then sends the fish to the market at Denu near Elmina to be re-sold for a profit. As a single mother, she is solely responsible for paying utility bills, her children's school fees, and other family living expenses. She is now seeking a loan to purchase more fresh fish for processing and resale purposes. She hopes to generate an increase in profits from her business, which she will reinvest back into the business to increase her capital reserves.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional fresh fish

loans.name: Thy

texts.en: Mrs. Thy L. is a villager in the Roka Kdouch Choerng Village in the Kampong Cham Province. She is a pig breeder. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing ten more piglets and pig food. She hopes to increase her income and provide a better life for her family after she sells her pigs. Her husband, Mr. Young Yen, is a construction worker. Mrs. Thy L. is 33 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy ten more piglets to breed and later resell and pig food

loans.name: Regina Nantaba Group

texts.en:
Regina N., 48, is the group leader for 5 members; she is a widow and she does not get any assistance from anyone else. She has children aged between 9 and 23 years old. Regina rents a one-roomed house where she stays with her children; she has access to electricity and piped water. She does not care for additional family members, and she normally has one meal a day.

Regina is a tailor and she mainly tailors "gomeses" (Ugandan traditional wear) and school uniforms. She rents a shop where she tailors her clothes and she works six days a week. She normally sews about 3 "gomeses" a day and her customers are mainly women and children. She normally sews materials that customers bring to her, charging them labour costs. And she has done this particular type of business for over 25 years now.

The problem she faces in her business is that of competition; there are many tailors around the place she tailors from. And also her clients normally come seasonally, for example, when schools are opening for the term.

Regina has been a client of MCDT for over 8 years now and she is servicing her 13th loan. The reason why she chose to work with MCDT is because of the timely loans; she has worked with her group for 8 years now . With this next loan, she wants to buy materials to sell to her customers. She will also use part of it to pay tuition for her children.

Regina wants one day to be able to buy a plot of land and build a house.

loans.use: buy fabrics for sale

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Yawa A. est âgée de 35 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Couturière de formation, elle exerce cette activité depuis 3 ans. Avec ce crédit Yawa souhaite acheter 2 machines à coudre et aussi des tissus et pagnes pour la revente. Cette deuxième activité lui permettra d’augmenter ses recettes et par là améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Yawa A., age 35, is married and the mother of two. A seamstress by training, she has been in this business for three years. With this loan, Yawa would like to buy two sewing machines and also some pagnes (colorful West African cloth) for resale. This second loan will enable her to increase her receipts and thus to improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two sewing machines and some cloth for resale

loans.name: Samar

texts.en: Samar is a 21-year-old young woman living in Al Mghayrieh in Mount Lebanon. She produces plastic bags for a local chocolate factory. She has been in this business since 2001. Today, Samar is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy decorative inventory in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: buy decorative inventory

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel A. is the pastor of a church and the proprietor of a school in the community where he lives. His school has created opportunities for the community and is where most parents send their wards to. He has run the school for the last 15 years now. The school has crèche to junior high school level. Right now, the intake is increasing because of the quality tuition the school offers to the public.
